src: Sollen wir etwa Sudschud zu dem vollziehen, den du uns anweist?!"
ref: Should we adore whoever you ask us to?"
draft: "Should we really execute Sudschud according to the instructions you give us?!"
hil: Should we really carry out Sudschud to the one you instruct us?!
compare: "Should we really execute Sudschud according to the instructions you give us?!"

src: Also richte deine Bittgebete an keinen anderen Gott neben ALLAH, sonst wirst du von den Gepeinigten.
ref: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment;
draft: Also do not direct your supplications to any other god but Allah, otherwise you will be among the tormented.
hil: So do not direct your supplications to any other god beside God, or you will be among the tormented ones.
compare: So do not direct your supplications to any other god beside God, or you will be among the tormented ones.

src: Nach dem Gesetz des Königs hätte es ihm nicht zugestanden, seinen Bruder (als Sklaven) zu nehmen, außer daß Allah es wollte. Wir erhöhen, wen Wir wollen, um Rangstufen.
ref: He could not take his brother by the law of the king (as a slave), except that Allah willed it. (So Allah made the brothers to bind themselves with their way of "punishment, i.e. enslaving of a thief.")
draft: According to the law of the king, he wouldn't have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah wanted it. We raise whomever We want in rank.
hil: According to the law of the king, he wouldn't have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah wanted it. We raise whomever We want in rank.
compare: According to the law of the king, he wouldn't have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah wanted it. We raise whomever We want in rank.

src: Diejenigen, die aus Furcht vor ihrem Herrn erschrecken,
ref: Surely those who live in awe of their Lord,
draft: Those who are frightened by their Lord,
hil: Those who are frightened by their Lord,
compare: Those who are frightened by their Lord,

src: Gut wart ihr, so betretet es; darin werdet ihr ewig weilen.»...
ref: So enter here to live for ever."
draft: Good were you, so enter; therein you will dwell forever.
hil: Good were you, so enter; therein you will dwell forever.
compare: Good were you, so enter; therein you will dwell forever.

src: O ihr, die ihr glaubt, fürchtet Allah; und eine jede Seele schaue nach dem, was sie für morgen vorausschickt.
ref: O you who believe, be fearful of God. Let each soul consider what it has sent (of good deeds) in advance for the morrow, and fear God.
draft: O you who believe, fear Allah; and every soul should look to what it has put forth for tomorrow.
hil: O you who believe, fear Allah; and let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow.
compare: O you who believe, fear Allah; and let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow.

src: Von Pharao. Er hatte hohe Gewalt und war einer der Maßlosen.
ref: From Firaun; he was indeed proud, among the transgressors.
draft: From the Pharaoh. He had great power and was one of the intemperate ones.
hil: "From Pharaoh. He had great power and was one of the intemperate ones."
compare: "From Pharaoh. He had great power and was one of the intemperate ones."

src: ALLAH erwählt aus den Engeln Gesandte und aus den Menschen. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allhörend, allsehend.
ref: Allah chooses the Noble Messengers from the angels, and from men; indeed Allah is All Hearing, All Seeing.
draft: ALLAH chooses messengers from among the angels and from among humans. Indeed, ALLAH is all-hearing, all-seeing.
hil: Allah chooses His messengers from among the angels and from among humans. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
compare: ALLAH chooses messengers from among the angels and from among humans. Indeed, ALLAH is all-hearing, all-seeing.

src: Beide versorgen WIR, diese und diese mit den Gaben deines HERRN.
ref: To each these as well as those We bestow from the Bounties of your Lord.
draft: Both of us provide, this and this, with the gifts of your LORD.
hil: We provide both of them, this and this, with the gifts of your Lord.
compare: We provide both of them, this and this, with the gifts of your Lord.

src: Und am Morgen war (der Garten) bereits verwüstet.
ref: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.
draft: And in the morning the garden was already devastated.
hil: And the garden was already devastated in the morning.
compare: And in the morning the garden was already devastated.

src: Es gibt keine Gottheit außer Ihm, so richtet an Ihn Bittgebete als Aufrichtiger im Din Ihm gegenüber.
ref: There is no god but He. Therefore pray to Him with obedience all-exclusive.
draft: There is no deity except Him, so direct your supplications to Him as a sincere one in religion towards Him.
hil: "There is no god but Him, so direct your supplications to Him as a sincere one in religion towards Him."
compare: "There is no god but Him, so direct your supplications to Him as a sincere one in religion towards Him."

src: Er sagte: "Mein Vater! Tu, was dir geboten wurde.
ref: Do what you are commanded!
draft: He said: "My father! Do what you have been commanded."
hil: He said, "My father! Do what you have been commanded."
compare: He said: "My father! Do what you have been commanded."

src: Gewiß, darin sind doch Ayat für Leute, die hören.
ref: Verily there are signs in this for those who pay heed.
draft: Certainly, there are verses in it for people who listen.
hil: Verily, therein are signs for people who listen.
compare: Verily, therein are signs for people who listen.

src: Die Gänge der Himmel, daß ich zum Gott des Mose emporsteige. Ich halte ihn ja für einen Lügner.» So wurde dem Pharao sein böses Tun verlockend gemacht, und er wurde vom (rechten) Weg abgewiesen. Die List Pharaos ist dem Verderben erlegen.
ref: “The routes of the heavens, in order to glance at the God of Moosa – and indeed I think he is a liar”; this is how the evil deeds of Firaun were made seeming good to him, and he was stopped from the path; and the evil scheme of Firaun was destined to be ruined.
draft: The aisles of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses. I consider him a liar.» So the Pharaoh's evil deeds were made enticing to him, and he was led astray from the (right) path. The trickery of Pharaoh has succumbed to ruin.
hil: The passages of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses. I consider him a liar." Thus, the Pharaoh's wickedness was made tempting to him, and he was led astray from the path. The trickery of Pharaoh has succumbed to ruin.
compare: The passages of heaven, that I ascend to the God of Moses. I consider him a liar." Thus, the Pharaoh's wickedness was made tempting to him, and he was led astray from the path. The trickery of Pharaoh has succumbed to ruin.

src: Diejenigen, über die das Urteil gefällt wird, sagen: "Unser Herr, dies sind jene, die wir irreführten.
ref: Those about whom the Word will have come true (to be punished) will say: "Our Lord! These are they whom we led astray.
draft: Those about whom the judgment is passed say: "Our Lord, these are the ones we misled."
hil: Those whom the judgment will be passed say: “Our Lord, these are the ones we led astray.
compare: Those whom the judgment will be passed say: “Our Lord, these are the ones we led astray.

src: Sie fragen dich um Belehrung. Sag: "Allah belehrt euch über den Erbanteil seitlicher Verwandtschaft. Wenn ein Mann umkommt, der keine Kinder hat, aber eine Schwester, dann steht ihr die Hälfte dessen zu, was er hinterläßt. Und er beerbt sie, wenn sie keine Kinder hat. Und wenn es zwei (Schwestern) sind, stehen ihnen (beiden) zwei Drittel dessen zu, was er hinterläßt. Und wenn es Geschwister sind, Männer und Frauen, dann kommt einem männlichen Geschlechts ebensoviel zu wie der Anteil von zwei weiblichen Geschlechts. Allah gibt euch Klarheit, damit ihr (nicht) in die Irre geht. Allah weiß über alles Bescheid.
ref: O dear Prophet (Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), they ask you for a decree; say, “Allah decrees you concerning the solitary person (without parents or children); if a man dies childless and has a sister, for her is half the inheritance; and the man is his sister’s heir if the sister dies childless; and if there are two sisters, for them is two-thirds of the inheritance; so if there are brothers and sisters, both men and women, the male’s share is equal to that of two females; and Allah explains clearly to you, so that you do not go astray; and Allah knows all things.”
draft: They ask you for guidance. Say: "Allah provides guidance concerning the share of inheritance for a person with no descendants or ascendants. If a man dies, having no child but has a sister, she shall receive half of what he leaves, and he is her heir if she has no son or daughter. If there are two sisters, they shall receive two-thirds of what he leaves. If there are siblings, male and female, the share of the male is equal to that of two females. Allah makes things clear to you, lest you err. Allah has knowledge of all things.
hil: They ask you for instruction concerning the inheritance. Say: 'Allah instructs you about it, and (also instructs you about) the reading of the book regarding the inheritance of the distant kindred. If a man dies having no children, but has a sister, then she receives half of what he leaves and he is her heir if she has no child. If there are two sisters, they shall receive two-thirds of what he leaves. If there are siblings, male and female, the share of the male is equal to that of two females. Allah makes things clear to you, lest you err. Allah has knowledge of all things.'
compare: They ask you for guidance. Say: "Allah provides guidance concerning the share of inheritance for a person with no descendants or ascendants. If a man dies, having no child but has a sister, she shall receive half of what he leaves, and he is her heir if she has no son or daughter. If there are two sisters, they shall receive two-thirds of what he leaves. If there are siblings, male and female, the share of the male is equal to that of two females. Allah makes things clear to you, lest you err. Allah has knowledge of all things.

src: O Prophet, wenn ihr euch von Frauen scheidet, dann scheidet euch von ihnen auf ihre Wartezeit hin, und berechnet die Wartezeit.
ref: O PROPHET WHEN you divorce women, divorce them at their appointed period, and calculate that period, and fear God, your Lord. Do not expel them from their houses, nor should they go away themselves, unless they are openly guilty of adultery.
draft: "O Prophet, if you divorce women, divorce them on their waiting period and calculate the waiting period."
hil: O Prophet, if you divorce women, divorce them during their waiting period and calculate the waiting period.
compare: O Prophet, if you divorce women, divorce them during their waiting period and calculate the waiting period.

src: Und wer von euch es sich nicht leisten kann, freie Mumin-Frauen zu heiraten, dann (heiratet er) von den Mumin-Dienerinnen, die euch gehören. Und ALLAH kennt euren Iman besser - die einen von euch sind wie die anderen.
ref: Any one of you who has not the affluence to be able to marry believing freewomen in wedlock, let him take believing handmaids that your right hands own; God knows very well your faith; the one of you is as the other.
draft: And whoever among you cannot afford to marry free Moomin women, then (he should marry) from the Moomin servants who belong to you. And ALLAH knows your faith better - some of you are like others.
hil: And those from among you who cannot afford to marry free Moomin women, then (let him marry) from the Moomin servants that you possess. And Allah knows your faith better, some of you are like others.
compare: And those from among you who cannot afford to marry free Moomin women, then (let him marry) from the Moomin servants that you possess. And Allah knows your faith better, some of you are like others.

src: So komme ich zu euch mit einem Zeichen von eurem Herrn.
ref: I have brought you a miracle from your Lord.
draft: So I come to you with a sign from your Lord.
hil: So I come to you with a sign from your Lord.
compare: So I come to you with a sign from your Lord.

src: Diese eilen zu den guten Dingen um die Wette und werden darin die Allerersten sein.
ref: Are the ones who hasten to goodness and outpace the others.
draft: These hurry to the good things as if in a race and will be the very first in them.
hil: Some of them hasten to compete in good deeds, and they will be among the foremost in them.
compare: Some of them hasten to compete in good deeds, and they will be among the foremost in them.

src: Sag: "Habt ihr irgendein Wissen darüber, das ihr uns offenlegt?" Doch ihr folgt nur dem Spekulieren, und ihr lügt ja nur.
ref: You follow only assumptions and only make guesses.”
draft: Say: "Do you have any knowledge that you disclose to us?" But you only follow speculation, and you are only lying.
hil: Tell them: 'Do you have any knowledge that you disclose to us?' But you only follow speculation, and you only lie.
compare: Tell them: 'Do you have any knowledge that you disclose to us?' But you only follow speculation, and you only lie.

src: Und bittet ALLAH um etwas von Seiner Gunst!
ref: Ask God for His favours.
draft: And ask Allah for some of His favor!
hil: And beseech Allah for some of His grace, verily Allah is Knower of everything.
compare: And beseech Allah for some of His grace, verily Allah is Knower of everything.

src: Und aus den Bergen hauet ihr euch Wohnungen geschickt aus.
ref: And dwellings hewed out of mountains ingeniously?
draft: And you skillfully carve out dwellings from the mountains.
hil: From the mountains, you cleverly carve out dwellings for yourselves.
compare: And you skillfully carve out dwellings from the mountains.

src: Und die Entscheidungsträger von ihnen gingen los: "Geht weiter so, und seid duldsam in eurer Gottheiten Sache! Gewiß, dies ist eine Sache, die doch erstrebt wird.
ref: The chiefs among them departed saying: go, and persevere in your gods; verily this is a thing designed.
draft: And their decision makers went on: "Carry on and be tolerant in the matter of your deities! Certainly, this is a matter that is sought after."
hil: And those in power among them said: "Continue like this and be tolerant in the matter of your deities! Indeed, this is an issue that is sought after."
compare: And those in power among them said: "Continue like this and be tolerant in the matter of your deities! Indeed, this is an issue that is sought after."

src: So gibt es von euch keinen, der es von ihm zurückhält.
ref: And not one of you would have been able to stop (Us).
draft: Therefore, there is none of you who withholds it from him.
hil: There is not one among you who withholds it from him
compare: There is not one among you who withholds it from him

src: Diejenigen, gegen die der Spruch zu Recht fällig geworden ist, sagen: «Unser Herr, diese, die wir haben abirren lassen, haben wir abirren lassen, wie wir selbst abgeirrt waren. (Von ihnen) sagen wir uns vor Dir los.
ref: Those against whom the Word will have proved true will say, “Our Lord! These are they whom we led astray; we led them astray the way we ourselves went astray; we are unconcerned with them and we incline towards You – they never worshipped us!”
draft: Those against whom the sentence has been rightly passed say: "Our Lord, these whom we have led astray, we led astray as we ourselves went astray. We declare ourselves innocent of them before You."
hil: Those against whom the sentence has been confirmed will say: Our Lord! these are they whom we caused to err; we caused them to err as we ourselves did err; to Thee we declare ourselves to be clear of them; they never served us.
compare: Those against whom the sentence has been rightly passed say: "Our Lord, these whom we have led astray, we led astray as we ourselves went astray. We declare ourselves innocent of them before You."

src: ER sagte: "Verlasse es als ein Verachteter, Verfluchter.
ref: "Begone," said (God), "contemptible and rejected!
draft: He said: "Leave it as a despised, cursed one."
hil: He said, 'Leave it as a despised, cursed one.'
compare: He said: "Leave it as a despised, cursed one."

src: Hätte Gott bei ihnen etwas Gutes festgestellt, hätte Er sie hören lassen. Und wenn Er sie hätte hören lassen, so hätten sie sich (dennoch) abgekehrt und abgewandt.
ref: And had Allah found any goodness in them, He would have made them hear; and had He made them hear they would, in the end, have turned away and gone back.
draft: If God had found something good in them, He would have made them listen. And if He had made them listen, they would still have turned away and turned away.
hil: "If God had found any good in them, He would have made them listen. And if He had made them listen, they would have turned away and turned away nonetheless."
compare: "If God had found any good in them, He would have made them listen. And if He had made them listen, they would have turned away and turned away nonetheless."

src: Doch nur die verständigen Menschen besinnen sich.
ref: They alone take warning who are wise,
draft: But only the rational people reflect.
hil: But only the wise people reflect.
compare: But only the wise people reflect.

src: Als sie dann vor Yusuf traten, nahm er seine Eltern bei sich auf und sprach: "Zieht in Ägypten in Sicherheit ein, wie Allah es will."
ref: When they went back to Joseph he gave his father and mother a place of honour, and said: "Enter Egypt in peace by the will of God."
draft: When they stood before Yusuf, he took his parents to himself and said, "Enter into security in Egypt as Allah wills."
hil: When they approached Yusuf, he took his parents in and said, 'Enter security in Egypt as Allah wills.'
compare: When they stood before Yusuf, he took his parents to himself and said, "Enter into security in Egypt as Allah wills."

src: ER läßt die Nacht den Tag überdecken.
ref: He brings the night as a cover over the day.
draft: He lets the night cover the day.
hil: He turns night into day, and turns day into night
compare: He lets the night cover the day.

src: Und haltet nicht die Kafir-Ehepartner!
ref: Do not retain your (marriage) ties with unbelieving women.
draft: And do not hold on to the infidel spouses!
hil: And do not hold onto infidel religious affiliates!
compare: And do not hold onto infidel religious affiliates!

src: Dienet Ihm.
ref: So worship Him.
draft: Serve Him.
hil: Serve Him.
compare: Serve Him.

src: 'Isa, der Sohn Maryams, sagte: "O Allah, unser Herr, sende zu uns einen Tisch (mit Speisen) vom Himmel herab, der für uns, für den ersten von uns und den letzten von uns, ein Fest sein soll und ein Zeichen von Dir. Und versorge uns.
ref: Eisa, the son of Maryam, said, “O Allah, O our Lord! Send down to us a table spread from heaven, so that it may become a day of celebration for us – for our former and latter people – and a sign from You; and give us sustenance – and You are the Best Provider Of Sustenance.”
draft: Isa, the son of Maryam, said: "O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us.
hil: Isa, son of Maryam, said: "O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table spread with food from heaven, to be for us a festival for the first and the last among us, and a sign from You. And provide for us."
compare: Isa, the son of Maryam, said: "O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us.

src: Diejenigen, denen WIR die Schrift zuteil werden ließen, tragen sie vor, wie es ihr gebührt. Diese verinnerlichen den Iman daran.
ref: Those (who embraced Islam from Bani Israel) to whom We gave the Book [the Taurat (Torah)] [or those (Muhammad's Peace be upon him companions) to whom We have given the Book (the Quran)] recite it (i.e. obey its orders and follow its teachings) as it should be recited (i.e. followed), they are the ones that believe therein.
draft: Those to whom WE have given the scripture recite it with its due right. They are the ones who believe in it.
hil: Those to whom WE have granted the scripture recite it as it should be recited, these are the ones who internalize faith in it.
compare: Those to whom WE have granted the scripture recite it as it should be recited, these are the ones who internalize faith in it.

src: Hierauf nahm Allah ihre Reue an. Dann aber wurden (wieder) viele von ihnen blind und taub.
ref: Thereafter Allah relented toward them, then they again blinded and deafened themselves.
draft: Then Allah accepted their repentance. But then many of them became blind and deaf again.
hil: Then Allah turned to them. But then many of them turned blind and deaf again.
compare: Then Allah accepted their repentance. But then many of them became blind and deaf again.

src: Aber diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, sind es, die der List erliegen.
ref: So the conspiracy will befall only upon the disbelievers.
draft: But those who are unbelievers are the ones who succumb to deception.
hil: It is those who disbelieve who succumb to deception.
compare: It is those who disbelieve who succumb to deception.

src: Also führe den bewaffneten Kampf fi-sabilillah!
ref: So fight on in the way of God (irrespective of the others).
draft: So carry out armed struggle fi-sabilillah!
hil: Therefore, O dear Prophet, fight in Allah's cause, and urge the believers to fight. It is likely that Allah will curb the strength of the disbelievers, and Allah's strike is most stinging, and His punishment the most severe.
compare: So carry out armed struggle fi-sabilillah!

src: An jenem Tag waren sie dem Unglauben näher als dem Glauben, sie sagten ja mit ihrem Munde, was nicht in ihrem Herzen war. Und Gott weiß besser, was sie verschweigen.
ref: They that day were nearer to unbelief than to belief, saying with their mouths that which never was in their hearts; and God knows very well the things they hide;
draft: On that day, they were closer to disbelief than to faith; they said with their mouth what was not in their hearts. And Allah is most knowing of what they conceal.
hil: On that day, they were closer to disbelief than to belief, saying with their mouth what was not in their hearts. And Allah knows best what they conceal.
compare: On that day, they were closer to disbelief than to faith; they said with their mouth what was not in their hearts. And Allah is most knowing of what they conceal.

src: Nehmen sie etwa nicht wahr, daß WIR gewiß Uns der Erde zuwenden und sie von ihren Enden einengen?!
ref: Do they not see Us advancing into the land, reducing its frontiers?
draft: Do they not perceive that WE are surely turning towards the Earth and restricting it from its ends?!
hil: Have they not perceived that WE are surely turning towards the Earth and restricting it from its ends?!
compare: Have they not perceived that WE are surely turning towards the Earth and restricting it from its ends?!

src: Und erbärmlich ist sie als (ihr) Werden.
ref: What a wretched retreat!
draft: And pitiful she is as (her) becoming.
hil: And miserable is she in her becoming.
compare: And miserable is she in her becoming.

src: Wenn dann der Tod an einen von ihnen herantritt, sagt er: "Mein Herr, bringe mich zurück
ref: (But the unbelievers will persist) until when death comes to one of them he will say: "O Lord, send me back again
draft: When death approaches one of them, he says, "My Lord, bring me back."
hil: When death approaches one of them, he says, "My Lord, bring me back."
compare: When death approaches one of them, he says, "My Lord, bring me back."

src: Auf solche (Sünder) wird ein böses Unheil niederfallen; und Allah ist zornig auf sie; und Er hat sie verflucht und Gahannam für sie bereitet.
ref: They shall be afflicted with misfortune, Allah is wroth with them. He has laid His curse upon them and has prepared for them Hell.
draft: Such (sinners) will experience an evil calamity; and Allah is angry with them; and He has cursed them and prepared Gehenna for them.
hil: "Upon such (sinners), a terrible calamity will fall; and Allah is angry with them; and He has cursed them and prepared Gahannam for them."
compare: Such (sinners) will experience an evil calamity; and Allah is angry with them; and He has cursed them and prepared Gehenna for them.

src: Sag: Allah hat das überzeugende Beweismittel.
ref: Say: "To God belongs the consummate argument.
draft: Say: Allah has the convincing evidence.
hil: Say: Allah has the convincing proof (evidence).
compare: Say: Allah has the convincing proof (evidence).

src: Das ist ein Warner nach Art der früheren Warner.
ref: He who warns you is one of the warners of old.
draft: This is a warning in the style of earlier warnings.
hil: This is a warning in the style of earlier warnings.
compare: This is a warning in the style of earlier warnings.

src: Sie sagen: «Sie sind uns entschwunden. Nein, wir riefen früher nichts an.»
ref: They will say: they have failed us: aye! we have not been calling upon aught afore.
draft: They say: "You have disappeared from us. No, we didn't call anything earlier."
hil: They say, "You have disappeared from us." Even so God leads astray the unbelievers.
compare: They say: "You have disappeared from us. No, we didn't call anything earlier."

src: (Sie ist) als Unterkunft von Einem Allvergebenden, Allgnädigen."
ref: As a gift from the forgiving, ever-merciful (God)."
draft: "She is seen as the abode of a forgiving, merciful one."
hil: She is seen as a dwelling place of a forgiving, merciful One.
compare: She is seen as a dwelling place of a forgiving, merciful One.

src: Und Wir hoben den Berg über sie bei (der Entgegennahme von) ihrem Abkommen empor.
ref: And We raised the Mount over them for their bond.
draft: And We raised the mountain above them at the time of their agreement.
hil: And (remember) when We raised the mountain above them as if it had been an awning, and they feared it would fall on them. Hold fast to what We have given you, and remember what is in it so that you may heed Allah's warning.
compare: And We raised the mountain above them at the time of their agreement.

src: Als Freudenbote und Warner.
ref: Announcing happy news and warnings.
draft: As a messenger of joy and warning.
hil: As a bringer of glad tidings and a warner.
compare: As a messenger of joy and warning.

src: Diejenigen, die glaubten und ausgewandert sind und sich mit ihrem Vermögen und mit ihrer eigenen Person auf dem Weg Gottes eingesetzt haben, und diejenigen, die (jene) untergebracht und unterstützt haben, sind untereinander Freunde. Mit denen aber, die glauben und nicht ausgewandert sind, habt ihr keine Freundschaft zu pflegen, bis sie auswandern. Wenn sie euch jedoch um Unterstützung wegen der (euch gemeinsamen) Religion bitten, so habt ihr die Pflicht zur Unterstützung, außer gegen Leute, zwischen denen und euch eine Vertragspflicht besteht. Und Gott sieht wohl, was ihr tut.
ref: Indeed those who accepted faith and left their homes and belongings for Allah, and fought with their wealth and their lives in Allah's cause, and those who gave shelter and provided help, are the heirs of one another; and those who believed but did not leave their homes – you have no right in their estates until they migrate; and if they seek help from you in the matter of religion then it is your duty to provide help, except against the people between whom and you is a treaty; and Allah sees your deeds.
draft: Those who believed, migrated and have striven hard with their wealth and their lives in the way of God, as well as those who had given asylum and help, are all friends and protectors of one another to one another. But as for those who believed but did not migrate with you, you are in no way responsible for their protection until they migrate. Yet if they ask you for help in respect of religion, it is your duty to give them help, excepting against a people between whom and you there is a treaty. And God is aware of what you do.
hil: Those who believed and migrated and have striven hard with their wealth and their lives in the way of God, as well as those who had given asylum and help, are all friends and protectors of one another to one another. But as for those who believed but did not migrate with you, you are in no way responsible for their protection until they migrate. Yet if they ask you for help in respect of religion, it is your duty to give them help, excepting against a people between whom and you there is a treaty. And God is aware of what you do.
compare: Those who believed, migrated and have striven hard with their wealth and their lives in the way of God, as well as those who had given asylum and help, are all friends and protectors of one another to one another. But as for those who believed but did not migrate with you, you are in no way responsible for their protection until they migrate. Yet if they ask you for help in respect of religion, it is your duty to give them help, excepting against a people between whom and you there is a treaty. And God is aware of what you do.

src: Und Wir gaben bereits Dawud und Sulaiman Wissen. Und sie sagten: "(Alles) Lob gehört Allah, der uns vor vielen Seiner gläubigen Diener bevorzugt hat!"
ref: We gave David and Solomon knowledge; and they said: "All praise be to God who has favoured us over many of His creatures who believe."
draft: And We already gave David and Solomon knowledge. And they said, "All praise is [due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
hil: And they said, "All praise belongs to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
compare: And We already gave David and Solomon knowledge. And they said, "All praise is [due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."

src: Dies sind die Ayat der Schrift und des erläuternden Quran.
ref: These are the verses of the Book and the perspicuous oration.
draft: These are the verses of the scripture and the explanatory Quran.
hil: These are the verses of the scripture and the explanatory Quran.
compare: These are the verses of the scripture and the explanatory Quran.

src: Diejenigen, die glaubten und ausgewandert sind und sich mit ihrem Vermögen und mit ihrer eigenen Person auf dem Weg Gottes eingesetzt haben, und diejenigen, die (jene) untergebracht und unterstützt haben, sind untereinander Freunde.
ref: Those who accepted the faith and set out of their homes, and fought in the way of God wealth and soul, and those who gave them shelter and helped them, are friends of one another.
draft: Those who believed and emigrated and exerted themselves in the way of God with their property and their own person, and those who housed and supported them, are friends among themselves.
hil: "Surely those who believed, emigrated and struggled in the way of Allah with their possessions and their lives and those who sheltered and supported them, are friends to one another."
compare: "Surely those who believed, emigrated and struggled in the way of Allah with their possessions and their lives and those who sheltered and supported them, are friends to one another."

src: Jede Trinkzeit soll (dann abwechselnd) wahrgenommen werden.
ref: Each one's right to drink being established (by turns).
draft: Every drinking time should be observed (alternately).
hil: Every time for drinking should be observed (alternately).
compare: Every drinking time should be observed (alternately).

src: Und hütet euch vor einem Tag, an dem keine Seele etwas anstelle einer anderen übernehmen kann und von keiner Fürsprache noch Ersatz(leistung) angenommen wird und ihnen keine Hilfe zuteil wird!
ref: Take heed of the day when no man will be useful to man in the least, when no intercession matter nor ransom avail, nor help reach them.
draft: And beware of a day when no soul can take the place of another and no intercession or compensation is accepted and no help is provided to them!
hil: Beware of a day where no soul can take the place of another, and no intercession or compensation is accepted, and no help is provided to them.
compare: And beware of a day when no soul can take the place of another and no intercession or compensation is accepted and no help is provided to them!

src: Doch WIR lassen es nur nach einem bekannten Maß nach und nach hinabsenden.
ref: And We send it not down except in a known measure.
draft: But we only let it gradually go down to a known level.
hil: But we let it gradually go down to a known level.
compare: But we let it gradually go down to a known level.

src: Er wollte euch aber in alledem, was Er euch gegeben hat, auf die Probe stellen. Darum sollt ihr um die guten Dinge wetteifern.
ref: If Allah willed, He would have made you one nation, but that (He) may test you in what He has given you; so strive as in a race in good deeds.
draft: He wanted to test you in everything he gave you. Therefore, you should compete for the good things.
hil: He wanted to test you in everything He has given you, so you should strive for good things.
compare: He wanted to test you in everything He has given you, so you should strive for good things.

src: Und Gottes Wille wird durch nichts vereitelt weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde. Er weiß Bescheid und ist mächtig.
ref: And Allah is not such that anything in the heavens or in the earth can break away from His control; indeed He is All Knowing, Able.
draft: And God's will is not thwarted by anything, neither in heaven nor on earth. He knows everything and is powerful.
hil: And Allah's will is not frustrated by anything, neither in the heavens nor on earth. He knows everything and is powerful.
compare: And God's will is not thwarted by anything, neither in heaven nor on earth. He knows everything and is powerful.

src: Er ist ja eine Erinnerung.
ref: Verily this Qur'an is an Admonition.
draft: He is indeed a memory.
hil: He is certainly a memory.
compare: He is certainly a memory.

src: DU hast mich aus Feuer geschaffen, aber ihn hast DU aus Lehm geschaffen."
ref: "You created me from fire, and him from clay."
draft: "You created me out of fire, but you created him out of clay."
hil: You created me from fire, but you created him from clay.
compare: "You created me out of fire, but you created him out of clay."

src: O die ihr glaubt, zehrt nicht euren Besitz untereinander auf nichtige Weise auf, es sei denn, daß es sich um einen Handel in gegenseitigem Einvernehmen handelt. Und tötet euch nicht selbst (gegenseitig). Allah ist gewiß Barmherzig gegen euch.
ref: O you who believe! do not devour your property among yourselves falsely, except that it be trading by your mutual consent; and do not kill your people; surely Allah is Merciful to you.
draft: O you who believe, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful.
hil: O you who have believed, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful.
compare: O you who believe, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful.

src: Diejenigen, die über ihn uneins sind, sind im Zweifel über ihn.
ref: Those who disagree in the matter are only lost in doubt.
draft: Those who are divided about him are in doubt about him.
hil: Those who differ about him are doubtful about him.
compare: Those who differ about him are doubtful about him.

src: WIR werden ihnen doch noch Unsere Ayat in allen Bereichen zeigen und an ihnen selber, damit ihnen deutlich wird, daß er (der Quran) gewiß dieWahrheit ist.
ref: We will show Our signs to them in the horizons of the external world and within themselves, until it becomes clear to them that it's the truth.
draft: WE will yet show them Our verses in all the areas and within themselves, so that it becomes clear to them that it (the Quran) is certainly the truth.
hil: WE will yet show them Our verses in all areas and within themselves, so that it becomes clear to them that the Quran is certainly the truth.
compare: WE will yet show them Our verses in all the areas and within themselves, so that it becomes clear to them that it (the Quran) is certainly the truth.

src: Weshalb, wenn euch gesagt wird: "Brecht auf fi-sabilillah", werdet ihr träge an der Stelle haftend?!
ref: What is the matter with you, that when it is said to you, “Migrate in Allah's cause”, you sit on the ground with heaviness?
draft: Why is it that when you are told "Break away fi-sabilillah," you become sluggish and remain in place?!
hil: Why, when you are told 'Break away fi-sabilillah', do you become sluggish and remain in place?
compare: Why, when you are told 'Break away fi-sabilillah', do you become sluggish and remain in place?

src: Und ER machte euch aus euren Partnerwesen Kinder und Enkel und gewährte euch Rizq von den Tay-yibat.
ref: He has created your sons and grandsons from your spouses and has given you pure things for your sustenance.
draft: And HE made children and grandchildren from your partnership creatures and granted you Rizq from Tay-yibat.
hil: And HE made for you from your partnership creatures children, and grandchildren, and provided for you sustenance from Tay-yibat.
compare: And HE made for you from your partnership creatures children, and grandchildren, and provided for you sustenance from Tay-yibat.

src: Wenn ihr einander eine Schuld für eine festgesetzte Frist gewährt, dann schreibt sie nieder!
ref: When you contract a debt for a fixed period, write it down.
draft: If you grant each other a debt for a fixed period of time, then write it down!
hil: O you who have believed, when you grant each other a debt for a specified time, write it down; and let a scribe write it for you in justice. Let no scribe refuse to write as Allah has taught him. So let him write, and let the one who has the obligation dictate. And let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not leave anything out of it. But if the one who has the obligation is of poor reasoning or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men; then if two men are not available, there should be one man and two women from those you would prefer to be witnesses so that if one of them forgets, the other can remind her. And the witnesses must not refuse when called upon to testify. And do not feel burdened to write it, whether the transaction is small or big – write it for up to its term's end. That is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger as evidence and more likely to prevent doubt between you, except when it is an immediate trade in which exchange is carried out immediately, there is no sin on you if it is not written down. And take witnesses whenever you perform trade; and neither the scribe nor the witnesses be caused any harm (or they cause any harm); and if you do so, it would be an offence on your part; and fear Allah; and Allah teaches you. And Allah knows everything.
compare: O you who have believed, when you grant each other a debt for a specified time, write it down; and let a scribe write it for you in justice. Let no scribe refuse to write as Allah has taught him. So let him write, and let the one who has the obligation dictate. And let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not leave anything out of it. But if the one who has the obligation is of poor reasoning or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men; then if two men are not available, there should be one man and two women from those you would prefer to be witnesses so that if one of them forgets, the other can remind her. And the witnesses must not refuse when called upon to testify. And do not feel burdened to write it, whether the transaction is small or big – write it for up to its term's end. That is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger as evidence and more likely to prevent doubt between you, except when it is an immediate trade in which exchange is carried out immediately, there is no sin on you if it is not written down. And take witnesses whenever you perform trade; and neither the scribe nor the witnesses be caused any harm (or they cause any harm); and if you do so, it would be an offence on your part; and fear Allah; and Allah teaches you. And Allah knows everything.

src: Sie schwören euch, damit ihr mit ihnen zufrieden seid.
ref: They will plead on oath that you accept them.
draft: They swear to you so that you are satisfied with them.
hil: They swear before you that you may be pleased with them; if you become pleased with them, then indeed Allah will never be pleased with the sinful.
compare: They swear before you that you may be pleased with them; if you become pleased with them, then indeed Allah will never be pleased with the sinful.

src: Dies, weil sie ALLAHs Ayat gegenüber Kufr zu betreiben und die Propheten zu Unrecht zu töten pflegten. Dies war für das, wie sie sich widersetzten und zu übertreten pflegten.
ref: Therefore settle down in Egypt or any city, where you will get what you demand”; and disgrace and misery were destined for them; and they returned towards Allah’s wrath; that was because they disbelieved in Allah’s signs and wrongfully martyred the Prophets; that was for their disobedience and transgression.
draft: This is because they used to commit Kufr against ALLAH's Ayat and used to unjustly kill the prophets. This was due to how they used to resist and transgress.
hil: This was because they were ever disbelieving in the signs of Allah and slaying the prophets without justice. This was due to how they used to resist and transgress.
compare: This was because they were ever disbelieving in the signs of Allah and slaying the prophets without justice. This was due to how they used to resist and transgress.

src: Bereits brachten wir dir eine Aya von deinem HERRN. Und Salam sei auf demjenigen, welcher der Rechtleitung folgt.
ref: We bring you a sign from your Lord, and peace be upon him who follows guidance.
draft: We have already brought you an Aya from your Lord. And peace be upon those who follow the guidance.
hil: "We have already brought you a sign from your Lord. And peace be upon those who follow the guidance."
compare: "We have already brought you a sign from your Lord. And peace be upon those who follow the guidance."

src: Und wenn sie darauf nicht reagieren, dann wisset, es ist mit Allahs Wissen offenbart worden; und es gibt keinen Gott außer Ihm.
ref: If they do not answer you, then know it has been revealed with the knowledge of God, and that there is no god but He.
draft: And if they do not respond to it, then know that it has been revealed with Allah's knowledge; and there is no god but Him.
hil: "And if they do not respond to it, then know that it has been revealed with Allah's knowledge; there is no God but Him."
compare: And if they do not respond to it, then know that it has been revealed with Allah's knowledge; and there is no god but Him.

src: Allah hat doch das Wort jener gehört, die mit dir wegen ihres Mannes stritt und sich vor Allah beklagte.
ref: God has heard the words of her that disputes with thee concerning her husband, and makes complaint unto God.
draft: Allah has indeed heard the words of those who argued with you about their husbands and complained to Allah.
hil: Allah has indeed heard the speech of the woman arguing with you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) concerning her husband, and is complaining to Allah; and Allah hears the conversation of you both; indeed Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
compare: Allah has indeed heard the speech of the woman arguing with you (O dear Prophet Mohammed - peace and blessings be upon him) concerning her husband, and is complaining to Allah; and Allah hears the conversation of you both; indeed Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

src: Und (Wir sandten) zu "Ad ihren Bruder Hud.
ref: And We sent Hud, their brother, to the people of 'Ad.
draft: And (We sent) to "Ad their brother Hud.
hil: And to 'Ad (people, We sent) their brother Hud.
compare: And to 'Ad (people, We sent) their brother Hud.

src: Gib mir ein, daß ich mich Deiner Wohltat, die DU mir und meinen Eltern gewährt hast, dankbar erweise, und daß ich gottgefällig Gutes tue, woran DU Wohlgefallen findest.
ref: Help me to be grateful for Your favours which You have bestowed upon me, and upon both my parents, and to do good deeds that will please You.
draft: Accept that I show gratitude for your favor that you have granted to me and my parents, and that I do good deeds that are pleasing to God and which you find satisfaction in.
hil: Grant me the ability to show gratitude for your favors that you bestowed upon me and my parents, and to perform good deeds that are pleasing to God and that you find satisfactory.
compare: Accept that I show gratitude for your favor that you have granted to me and my parents, and that I do good deeds that are pleasing to God and which you find satisfaction in.

src: Gewiß, sie haben sehr viele von den Menschen in die Irre geführt.
ref: They have indeed led astray many among mankind.
draft: Certainly, they have misled many of the people.
hil: Indeed, they have led many of the people astray.
compare: Certainly, they have misled many of the people.

src: Alhamdulillah: Alles Lob gebührt ALLAH, Der die Himmel und die Erde erschaffen und die Finsternis und das Licht gemacht hat. Dann (trotzdem) stellen diejenigen, die Kufr betrieben haben, ihrem HERRN etwas gleich.
ref: All praise is to Allah, Who has created the heavens and the earth, and has created darkness and light; yet the disbelievers appoint equals (false deities) to their Lord!
draft: "Alhamdulillah: All praise belongs to ALLAH, Who created the heavens and the earth and made darkness and light. Then (nevertheless) those who committed Kufr equate something to their Lord."
hil: All praise belongs to ALLAH, Who created the heavens and the earth and made darkness and light. Then (nevertheless) those who committed Kufr equate something to their Lord.
compare: All praise belongs to ALLAH, Who created the heavens and the earth and made darkness and light. Then (nevertheless) those who committed Kufr equate something to their Lord.

src: Aber Gott läßt nicht unbeachtet, was ihr tut.
ref: God is not unaware of all you do.
draft: But God does not overlook what you do.
hil: "However, God does not overlook what you do."
compare: But God does not overlook what you do.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Nehmt euch eure Eltern und eure Geschwister nicht als Wali, wenn sie den Kufr dem Iman vorziehen. Und wer von euch sie als Wali nimmt, diese sind die wirklichen Unrecht-Begehenden.
ref: O you who believe, do not hold your fathers and brothers as friends if they hold disbelief more dear than faith; and those of you who do so are iniquitous.
draft: You, who have internalized the faith! Do not take your parents and siblings as allies if they prefer disbelief over faith. And whoever among you takes them as allies, they are the wrongdoers.
hil: O ye who believe! Take not your fathers and your brothers as friends if they love infidelity above faith. And whoever among you takes them as friends, they are the wrongdoers.
compare: You, who have internalized the faith! Do not take your parents and siblings as allies if they prefer disbelief over faith. And whoever among you takes them as allies, they are the wrongdoers.

src: Und ER ist Derjenige, Der aus dem Wasser einen Menschen erschuf, dann machte ER ihn zur Abstammung und Verschwägerung. Und dein HERR ist immer allmächtig.
ref: And it is He Who created man from water, then appointed relatives and in-laws for him; and your Lord is All Able.
draft: And HE is the One who created a human being from water, then made him into relationships of lineage and marriage. And your LORD is always omnipotent.
hil: And He is the One who created a human being from water, then made him into relationships of lineage and marriage. And your Lord is always omnipotent.
compare: And HE is the One who created a human being from water, then made him into relationships of lineage and marriage. And your LORD is always omnipotent.

src: Und er betrat die Stadt um eine Zeit, da ihre Bewohner in einem Zustand der Unachtsamkeit waren; und er fand da zwei Männer, die miteinander kämpften.
ref: He came to the city when the people were in a care-free mood, and saw two men quarrelling, one belonging to his community, the other to his enemies.
draft: And he entered the city at a time when its inhabitants were in a state of carelessness; and he found two men there who were fighting with each other.
hil: He entered the city at a time when its inhabitants were heedless, and he found two men there who were fighting.
compare: He entered the city at a time when its inhabitants were heedless, and he found two men there who were fighting.

src: Als er dort ankam, wurde ihm vom rechten Ufer des Tales im gesegneten Fleck (Land) aus dem Baum zugerufen: "O Musa, gewiß, Ich bin Allah, der Herr der Weltenbewohner."
ref: When he drew near, a voice called out to him from the tree on the blessed spot on the right side of the valley: "O Moses, I am verily God, the Lord of all the worlds.
draft: When he arrived there, he was called by a voice from the tree on the blessed spot (land) to the right bank of the valley: "O Moses, verily, I am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds."
hil: And when he arrived there, a voice called to him from the tree on the blessed spot (land) on the right bank of the valley: "O Musa, verily, I am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds."
compare: And when he arrived there, a voice called to him from the tree on the blessed spot (land) on the right bank of the valley: "O Musa, verily, I am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds."

src: Bringt sie nicht heraus aus ihren Wohnstätten! Und sie gehen nicht weg, außer wenn sie eine bewiesene Abscheulichkeit begehen.
ref: Do not expel them from their houses, nor should they go away themselves, unless they are openly guilty of adultery.
draft: Do not bring them out of their dwellings! And they do not leave unless they commit a proven abomination.
hil: Do not bring them out of their dwellings! And they do not leave except when they commit a proven abomination.
compare: Do not bring them out of their dwellings! And they do not leave unless they commit a proven abomination.

src: Allah hat Wohlgefallen an ihnen, und sie haben Wohlgefallen an Ihm. Jene sind Allahs Gruppierung.
ref: Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of Allah.
draft: Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. They are the group of Allah.
hil: Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. They are the group of God.
compare: Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. They are the group of Allah.

src: Und haltet nicht am Eheband mit den ungläubigen Frauen fest, sondern verlangt das zurück, was ihr (für sie) ausgegeben habt, und lasset (die Ungläubigen) das zurückverlangen, was sie (für sie) ausgegeben haben.
ref: Do not retain your (marriage) ties with unbelieving women. Ask for the return of what you have spent (on them); and the unbelievers should ask for the return of what they have spent.
draft: And do not hold fast to the marriage bond with unbelieving women, but demand the return of what you have spent (on them) and let (the unbelievers) demand the return of what they have spent (on their spouses).
hil: And do not hold on to the marriage bond with unbelieving women, but demand back what you have spent (for them) and let (the unbelievers) demand back what they have spent (for their spouses).
compare: And do not hold on to the marriage bond with unbelieving women, but demand back what you have spent (for them) and let (the unbelievers) demand back what they have spent (for their spouses).

src: Da empfing Adam von seinem Herrn Worte, und darauf nahm Er seine Reue an. Er ist ja der Reue-Annehmende und Barmherzige.
ref: Then his Lord sent commands to Adam and turned towards him: Indeed He is compassionate and kind.
draft: Adam received words from his Lord, and then He accepted his repentance. He is indeed the Accepter of repentance, the Merciful.
hil: Adam received words from his Lord, and then He accepted his repentance. He is indeed the Accepter of repentance, the Merciful.
compare: Adam received words from his Lord, and then He accepted his repentance. He is indeed the Accepter of repentance, the Merciful.

src: Wahrlich, Wir haben dich mit der Wahrheit als Bringer froher Botschaft und als Warner entsandt; und es gibt kein Volk, in dem es nicht einmal schon Warner gegeben hätte.
ref: We have sent you with the truth, to give glad tidings and to warn. Never has there been a community to which an admonisher was not sent.
draft: Truly, We have sent you with the truth as a bearer of good news and a warner; and there is no community where a warner has not passed.
hil: Truly, We have sent you as a messenger of truth, a bearer of happy news, and a warner; and there is no community where a warner has not passed before.
compare: Truly, We have sent you as a messenger of truth, a bearer of happy news, and a warner; and there is no community where a warner has not passed before.

src: Gott hat sich Abraham ja zum Vertrauten genommen.
ref: And God chose Abraham as friend.
draft: God did take Abraham as a confidant.
hil: God has indeed taken Abraham as a confidant.
compare: God did take Abraham as a confidant.

src: "Stelle Panzerhemden her und füge die Ringe nach Maß ineinander."
ref: Saying: Make thou long coats of mail and measure the links (thereof).
draft: "Make armored shirts and fit the rings together to measure."
hil: "Make large coats of armor and keep proper measure while making; join the armor rings together in the right measure and perform good deeds, for I am indeed seeing your deeds."
compare: "Make armored shirts and fit the rings together to measure."

src: Wie wog er ab!
ref: How moliciously he devised!
draft: How he weighed it!
hil: How he weighed it!
compare: How he weighed it!

src: Denen, die ungläubig sind, werden weder ihr Vermögen noch ihre Kinder vor Gott etwas nützen. Das sind die Gefährten des Feuers; sie werden darin ewig weilen.
ref: Indeed those who disbelieve – neither their wealth nor their offspring will help save them in the least, from Allah; and they are the people of fire; remaining in it forever.
draft: To those who are unbelievers, neither their possessions nor their children will benefit them before God. These are the companions of the Fire; they will dwell therein eternally.
hil: Those who disbelieve, neither their wealth nor their offspring will help to save them in the least from Allah; they are fuel for the fire, wherein they will dwell eternally.
compare: Those who disbelieve, neither their wealth nor their offspring will help to save them in the least from Allah; they are fuel for the fire, wherein they will dwell eternally.

src: Allah hat ein Siegel auf ihre Herzen gelegt, so daß sie kein Wissen haben.
ref: Allah hath sealed up their hearts, so they know not.
draft: "Allah has set a seal on their hearts so that they have no knowledge."
hil: But Allah has set a seal over their hearts so that they do not have knowledge.
compare: But Allah has set a seal over their hearts so that they do not have knowledge.

src: Zeigt mir, was sie von der Erde erschaffen haben.
ref: What have they created of the earth?
draft: Show me what they have created on Earth.
hil: Show me what they have created on Earth.
compare: Show me what they have created on Earth.

src: Oder denken sie etwa, daß WIR ihr Geheimnis und ihre heimliche Unterredung nicht hören?! Doch, mit Sicherheit!
ref: Or do they think that We do not hear what they conceal and their secret discourses?
draft: Or do they think that we do not hear their secret and clandestine conversation?! But we do, for sure!
hil: Or do they think that we do not hear their secret and clandestine conversation?! But we do, for sure!
compare: Or do they think that we do not hear their secret and clandestine conversation?! But we do, for sure!

src: Und wenn sie den Weg der Besonnenheit sehen, nehmen sie ihn sich nicht zum Weg. Wenn sie aber den Weg der Verirrung sehen, nehmen sie ihn sich zum Weg.
ref: Even if they see every sign, they will not believe in it; and if they see the path of rectitude, they will not adopt it for a path; and if they see the path of error, they will adopt it for a path.
draft: And if they see the path of prudence, they do not take it as their path. But if they see the path of error, they take it as their path.
hil: And if they see the path of prudence, they do not take it as their path. But if they see the path of error, they take it as their path.
compare: And if they see the path of prudence, they do not take it as their path. But if they see the path of error, they take it as their path.

src: Er sagte: «Wenn du gewollt hättest, hättest du dafür einen Lohn nehmen können.»
ref: He said, “If you wanted, you could have obtained a payment for it.”
draft: He said, "If you had wanted to, you could have taken a salary for that."
hil: He said, 'If you had wanted to, you could have taken a wage for it.'
compare: He said, "If you had wanted to, you could have taken a salary for that."

src: (Gewähre uns) Deine Vergebung, unser Herr!
ref: Your forgiveness, our Lord.
draft: (Give us) Your forgiveness, our Lord!
hil: Grant us Your forgiveness, our Lord!
compare: Grant us Your forgiveness, our Lord!

src: Gewiß, sie widersetzten sich mir und folgten demjenigen, dessen Vermögen und Kinder ihn nur am Verlust mehrten.
ref: They have disobeyed me, and they follow the one whose wealth and children increase nothing for him except ruin.”
draft: Certainly, they opposed me and followed the one whose wealth and children only increased his loss.
hil: "They were certainly oppositing me and following the one whose wealth and children only increased his loss."
compare: Certainly, they opposed me and followed the one whose wealth and children only increased his loss.

src: So verlasse dich auf Allah, denn du verfährst nach der offenkundigen Wahrheit.
ref: So you place your trust in God. Certainly you stand on positive truth.
draft: So rely on Allah, for you are proceeding according to the manifest truth.
hil: So rely upon Allah, for you act according to the manifest truth.
compare: So rely on Allah, for you are proceeding according to the manifest truth.

src: Gesandter! Verkünde, was dir von deinem HERRN hinabgesandt wurde! Und solltest du dies nicht tun, dann hast du Seine Botschaft nicht verkündet. Und ALLAH schützt dich vor den Menschen. Gewiß, ALLAH leitet die kufrbetreibende Gemeinschaft nicht recht.
ref: O Noble Messenger (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him)! Convey all what has been sent down upon you from your Lord; and if you do not, then you have not conveyed any of His messages; and Allah will protect you from the people; indeed Allah does not guide the disbelievers.
draft: "Messenger! Proclaim what has been sent down to you from your Lord! And if you do not do so, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving community aright."
hil: O Messenger! Proclaim what has been sent down to you from your Lord! And if you do not do so, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving community aright.
compare: "Messenger! Proclaim what has been sent down to you from your Lord! And if you do not do so, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving community aright."

src: Da erhörte sie ihr Herr (und sprach): "Seht, Ich lasse kein Werk der Wirkenden unter euch verlorengehen, sei es von Mann oder Frau; die einen von euch sind von den anderen.
ref: The Lord heard their prayer and answered: "I suffer not the good deeds of any to go waste, be he a man or a woman: The one of you is of the other.
draft: Then her Lord heard her and said, "Indeed, I will not allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you, whether male or female; you are of one another.
hil: Then her Lord listened to her and said: `Look, I will not allow the work of any of the doers among you to be lost, be they male or female; they are of one another.'
compare: Then her Lord heard her and said, "Indeed, I will not allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you, whether male or female; you are of one another.

src: Wo auch immer ihr seid, der Tod ereilt euch doch, und wäret ihr in hohen Burgen. Und wenn ihnen Gutes begegnet, sagen sie: "Das ist von Allah"; und wenn ihnen Schlimmes begegnet, sagen sie: "Das ist von dir."
ref: Wherever you are, death will overtake you, though you are in lofty towers, and if a benefit comes to them, they say: This is from Allah; and if a misfortune befalls them, they say: This is from you.
draft: Wherever you are, death will come to you, even if you are in high castles. And if good fortune comes to them, they say, "This is from Allah"; and if evil befalls them, they say, "This is from you."
hil: Wherever you are, death will come to you, even if you are in high castles. And if good fortune comes to them, they say,"This is from Allah"; and if evil befalls them, they say,"This is from you." But Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection, and Allah will not provide the disbelievers any way over the Muslims.
compare: Wherever you are, death will come to you, even if you are in high castles. And if good fortune comes to them, they say, "This is from Allah"; and if evil befalls them, they say, "This is from you."

src: So waret ihr einst, dann aber hat Allah euch Seine Huld erwiesen; darum stellt erst gehörig Nachforschungen an. Seht, Allah ist eures Tuns wohl kundig.
ref: So you were aforetime; but God has been gracious to you. So be discriminating; surely God is aware of the things you do.
draft: So you once were, but then Allah has shown you His grace; therefore investigate properly first. Behold, Allah is well aware of your deeds.
hil: Thus were you once, but Allah has shown you his grace; therefore, investigate properly first. Behold, Allah is well aware of your deeds.
compare: Thus were you once, but Allah has shown you his grace; therefore, investigate properly first. Behold, Allah is well aware of your deeds.

src: Da stritten sie untereinander über ihre Angelegenheit und führten insgeheim vertrauliche Gespräche.
ref: So they discussed their strategy among themselves and conferred privately,
draft: They argued among themselves about their matter and secretly held confidential conversations.
hil: They argued among themselves about their matter and held confidential conversations in secret.
compare: They argued among themselves about their matter and held confidential conversations in secret.

src: Sie sagten: "Bist du etwa zu uns gekommen, damit wir ALLAH alleine dienen und von dem ablassen, dem unsere Ahnen dienten?! Also lasse uns das zuteil werden, wovor du uns warnst, solltest du von den Wahrhaftigen sein."
ref: They said: "Comest thou to us, that we may worship Allah alone, and give up the cult of our fathers? bring us what thou threatenest us with, if so be that thou tellest the truth!"
draft: They said, "Have you come to us only to worship Allah alone and to abandon what our ancestors worshiped?! So let us have what you promise us, if you are truthful."
hil: They said, 'Have you come to us only to worship Allah alone and to abandon what our ancestors worshiped?! Then let us experience what you are warning us against, if you are truthful.'
compare: They said, 'Have you come to us only to worship Allah alone and to abandon what our ancestors worshiped?! Then let us experience what you are warning us against, if you are truthful.'

src: Sie waren einverstanden, mit den Zurückgebliebenen zu sein.
ref: They are content to be with those (the women) who sit behind (at home).
draft: They agreed to be with the remaining ones.
hil: They were pleased to be with the sitters-at-home.
compare: They agreed to be with the remaining ones.

src: Und ich bin dafür einer der Zeugen.
ref: It was He who created them and I testify to this fact".
draft: And I am one of the witnesses for it.
hil: And I am one of the witnesses for it.
compare: And I am one of the witnesses for it.

src: Sprich: Der Kampf in ihm ist schwerwiegend; aber (die Menschen) vom Wege Gottes abweisen, an Ihn nicht glauben, den Zugang zur heiligen Moschee verwehren und deren Anwohner daraus vertreiben, (all das) wiegt bei Gott schwerer. Verführen wiegt schwerer als Töten.
ref: Tell them: "To fight in that month is a great sin. But a greater sin in the eyes of God is to hinder people from the way of God, and not to believe in Him, and to bar access to the Holy Mosque and turn people out of its precincts; and oppression is worse than killing.
draft: Speak: The struggle within him is serious; but to divert people from the path of God, to make them not believe in Him, to prevent access to the sacred mosque and to drive out its inhabitants, all this weighs more heavily with God. Tempting weighs heavier than killing.
hil: The struggle within him is severe, but diverting people from the path of God, making them not believe in Him, preventing access to the holy mosque, and driving out its inhabitants weighs more heavily with God. Tempting weighs heavier than killing.
compare: Speak: The struggle within him is serious; but to divert people from the path of God, to make them not believe in Him, to prevent access to the sacred mosque and to drive out its inhabitants, all this weighs more heavily with God. Tempting weighs heavier than killing.

src: Und würden sie die Tora und das Evangelium und das, was zu ihnen von ihrem Herrn herabgesandt wurde, einhalten, sie würden von oben und unter ihren Füßen zu essen bekommen. Unter ihnen gibt es eine Gemeinde mit maßvollem Wandel.
ref: Had the People of the Book observed the Torah and the Gospel, and all that had been revealed to them from their Lord, sustenance would have been showered over them from above and risen from beneath their feet.
draft: And if they were to uphold the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would have been given to eat from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them is a moderate community.
hil: And had they performed the Torah, the Gospel, and what was sent down to them from their Lord, they would have eaten both what was above them and what was beneath their feet. Among them, there is a moderate community.
compare: And if they were to uphold the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would have been given to eat from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them is a moderate community.

src: Für sie ist eine schmerzhafte Pein bestimmt.
ref: For them there is painful punishment.
draft: For her, a painful agony is determined.
hil: For them, a painful agony is destined.
compare: For her, a painful agony is determined.

src: Er ist der beste Versorger.
ref: He is the Best of providers.
draft: He is the best provider.
hil: He is the best provider.
compare: He is the best provider.

src: ER fügt der Schöpfung hinzu, was ER will. Gewiß, ALLAH ist über alles allmächtig.
ref: He addeth in creation what soever He listeth Verily Allah is over everything Potent.
draft: He adds to creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is Almighty over all.
hil: He adds to creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is all-powerful.
compare: He adds to creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is all-powerful.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Nehmt euch nicht Leute alsWali, über die ALLAH erzürnt ist.
ref: O ye who believe! befriend not a people against whom Allah is Wroth.
draft: Your, who have internalized the faith! Do not take people as guardians over whom ALLAH is angry.
hil: O you who believe, do not make friends with those who have suffered the anger of God by becoming despondent of the life to come like those unbelievers who are despondent of those who are in graves.
compare: Your, who have internalized the faith! Do not take people as guardians over whom ALLAH is angry.

src: Und wenn er ihnen verlesen wird, sagen sie: "Wir glauben an ihn.
ref: And when it is read out to them, say: "We believe in it.
draft: "We believe in him," they say when it is read to them.
hil: When it is read to them, they say, "We believe in him."
compare: "We believe in him," they say when it is read to them.

src: Das sind Insassen des (Höllen)feuers.
ref: They are the dwellers of the Fire, therein they will abide.
draft: These are occupants of the (hell)fire.
hil: Those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, they are rightful Peoples of the Fire.
compare: These are occupants of the (hell)fire.

src: Aber diejenigen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, werden in Gärten geführt, unter denen Bäche fließen; darin werden sie ewig weilen, mit der Erlaubnis ihres Herrn.
ref: And those who believed (in the Oneness of Allah and His Messengers and whatever they brought) and did righteous deeds, will be made to enter Gardens under which rivers flow, - to dwell therein forever (i.e. in Paradise), with the permission of their Lord.
draft: But those who believe and do good deeds will be led to gardens beneath which rivers flow; therein they shall abide forever, by the leave of their Lord.
hil: But those who believed and did good deeds, We shall soon admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding in them forever and ever; a true promise from Allah, whose Words are more true than those of Allah (Allah does not lie).
compare: But those who believe and do good deeds will be led to gardens beneath which rivers flow; therein they shall abide forever, by the leave of their Lord.

src: Wie lasset ihr euch da (von Ihm) abwenden?
ref: How then can you turn away?
draft: How do you let yourselves turn away (from Him) there?
hil: How do you [who allegedly worship Him] turn yourselves away [from Him] there?
compare: How do you let yourselves turn away (from Him) there?

src: Dabei sind sie demütig gegen Allah und verkaufen Seine Zeichen nicht gegen einen winzigen Preis. Jene haben ihren Lohn bei ihrem Herrn.
ref: They do not sell the Verses of Allah for a little price, for them is a reward with their Lord.
draft: They are humble towards Allah and do not sell His signs for a tiny price. Those will have their reward with their Lord.
hil: They are humble before Allah and do not sell His signs for an abject price. Those who do so have their reward with their Lord. Indeed, Allah is swift at taking account.
compare: They are humble towards Allah and do not sell His signs for a tiny price. Those will have their reward with their Lord.

src: Sprich: "Mein Herr kennt ihre Zahl am besten.
ref: They will say, 'Seven; and their dog was the eighth of them.'
draft: Speak: "My Lord knows their number best."
hil: Say: 'Verily, my Lord knows best their number'.
compare: Say: 'Verily, my Lord knows best their number'.

src: Dann machte Er seine Nachkommenschaft aus dem Erguß eines verächtlichen Wassers.
ref: Then made his offspring from the extract of base fluid,
draft: Then he made his offspring from the flowing of a contemptible water.
hil: He then made his offspring from the flowing of a contemptible water.
compare: He then made his offspring from the flowing of a contemptible water.

src: Abweisen werde Ich von meinen Zeichen diejenigen, die sich auf der Erde zu Unrecht hochmütig verhalten. Wenn sie auch jedes Zeichen sehen, glauben sie nicht daran.
ref: I will turn away from My revelations those who behave proudly on earth without justification.
draft: I will reject those who behave unjustly arrogant on earth from my signs. Even if they see every sign, they do not believe in it.
hil: Those who behave unjustly arrogant on earth will be turned away from my signs. Even if they see every sign, they do not believe in it.
compare: Those who behave unjustly arrogant on earth will be turned away from my signs. Even if they see every sign, they do not believe in it.

src: Bereits brachten wir dir eine Aya von deinem HERRN.
ref: We have come to you with a token from your Lord.
draft: We have already brought you an Aya from your Lord.
hil: We have already brought you a sign from your Lord.
compare: We have already brought you a sign from your Lord.

src: Euch wird nicht schaden, wer irregeht, wenn ihr der Rechtleitung folgt. Zu ALLAH ist eure Rückkehr allesamt, dann wird ER euch darüber in Kenntnis setzen, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
ref: Fear for your own souls; he who has strayed cannot harm you in the least if you are on guidance; towards Allah only you will all return – He will then inform you of what you used to do.
draft: You will not be harmed by those who go astray if you follow the guidance. To Allah is your return all, then He will inform you about what you used to do.
hil: You will not be harmed by those who go astray if you follow the guidance. To Allah is your return all, then He who knows the unknown and the known will inform you about what you used to do.
compare: You will not be harmed by those who go astray if you follow the guidance. To Allah is your return all, then He who knows the unknown and the known will inform you about what you used to do.

src: Behaltet sie aber nicht aus Schadenslust, um Übertretungen zu begehen.
ref: But do not take them back to hurt them, and whoever does that, then he has wronged himself.
draft: Keep them not out of malice, in order to commit transgressions.
hil: Keep them not out of malice to commit transgressions, but treat them kindly and release them graciously if they have reached the end of their waiting period.
compare: Keep them not out of malice, in order to commit transgressions.

src: ER erschuf die Himmel und die Erde in Gesetzmäßigkeit und gestaltete euch, dann machte eure Gestalten schön.
ref: He created the heavens and the earth with Truth and shaped you, giving you excellent shapes.
draft: He created the heavens and the earth in regularity and shaped you, then made your forms beautiful.
hil: He created the heavens and the earth in accordance with truth and shaped you, then made your forms beautiful.
compare: He created the heavens and the earth in regularity and shaped you, then made your forms beautiful.

src: Sag: "Ist dies besser oder die Dschanna der Ewigkeit, die den Muttaqi versprochen wurde?!"
ref: Ask them: "Is this better or a garden for everlasting abode which has been promised the pious and devout?
draft: Say, "Is this better or the Jannah of eternity that was promised to the Muttaqi?!"
hil: Say: "Is this better or the paradise of eternity promised to the Muttaqi?"
compare: Say, "Is this better or the Jannah of eternity that was promised to the Muttaqi?!"

src: Allah will für euch Erleichterung; Er will für euch nicht Erschwernis, - damit ihr die Anzahl vollendet und Allah als den Größten preist, dafür, daß Er euch rechtgeleitet hat, auf daß ihr dankbar sein möget.
ref: Allah intendeth for you ease, and intendeth not for you hardship; so ye shall fulfil the number and shall magnify Allah for His having guided you, and haply ye may give thanks.
draft: Allah wants to give you relief; He does not want to burden you - so that you may complete the prescribed period (of fasting) and glorify Allah for having guided you, and so that you may be thankful.
hil: Allah wants to give you relief; He does not want to burden you - so that you may complete the prescribed period (of worship) and glorify Allah as the Greatest, for He has guided you on the right path, so that you may be grateful.
compare: Allah wants to give you relief; He does not want to burden you - so that you may complete the prescribed period (of fasting) and glorify Allah for having guided you, and so that you may be thankful.

src: Ich habe Dir das gelobt, was ich in meinem Bauch trage - nur für den Gottesdienst (zu weihen), so nimm es von mir an!
ref: I have vowed to You what (the child that) is in my womb to be dedicated for Your services (free from all worldly work; to serve Your Place of worship), so accept this, from me.
draft: I have praised to you what I carry in my stomach - only for the purpose of sanctifying it in the service of God, so please accept it from me!
hil: I have vowed to You what is in my womb, consecrated for the service of God, so accept this from me.
compare: I have vowed to You what is in my womb, consecrated for the service of God, so accept this from me.

src: Also welche von beiden Gruppen ist mehr berechtigt, sich sicher zu fühlen, solltet ihr es wissen?
ref: Tell me, whose way is the way of peace, if you have the knowledge?
draft: So which of the two groups is more entitled to feel safe, should you know?
hil: So, which of the two groups has more right to feel secure, if you should know?
compare: So, which of the two groups has more right to feel secure, if you should know?

src: Dann bezichtigten sie ihn der Lüge, dann richteten WIR sie zugrunde.
ref: Then they accused him of lies; so We annihilated them.
draft: Then they accused him of lying, then WE destroyed them.
hil: Then they accused him of lying, and WE destroyed them.
compare: Then they accused him of lying, and WE destroyed them.

src: Und sie sagen: "O du, dem (angeblich) die Ermahnung offenbart worden ist, du bist ja fürwahr besessen.
ref: And yet they say: "You, to whom this Exposition has been sent are surely possessed of the Devil.
draft: And they say: "O you to whom (allegedly) the admonition has been revealed, you are indeed possessed.
hil: And they said, 'O you to whom (allegedly) the admonition has been revealed, you are indeed possessed.'
compare: And they say: "O you to whom (allegedly) the admonition has been revealed, you are indeed possessed.

src: Bereits sehen WIR das Schweifen deines Gesichts himmelwärts. So werden WIR dich gewiß eine Gebetsrichtung einnehmen lassen, an der du Wohlgefallen findest. So wende dich mit dem Gesicht in Richtung von Almasdschidil-haram, und allerorts, wo ihr seid, wendet euch mit dem Gesicht in seine Richtung! Auch sicher, diejenigen, denen die Schrift zuteil wurde, wissen zweifellos, daß es doch die Wahrheit von ihrem HERRN ist. Und ALLAH ist gewiß nicht achtlos dem gegenüber, was ihr tut.
ref: We observe you turning your face, several times towards heaven (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him); so We will definitely make you turn (for prayer) towards a qiblah which pleases you; therefore now turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque (in Mecca); and O Muslims, wherever you may be, turn your faces (for prayer) towards it only; and those who have received the Book surely know that this is the truth from their Lord; and Allah is not unaware of their deeds. (Allah seeks to please the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.)
draft: We already see the wandering of your face towards heaven. So we will surely take you in a prayer direction that you find pleasing. So turn your face towards Al-Masjid al-Haram, and wherever you are, turn your face towards its direction!
