ref: and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them.
draft: As well as the inhabitants of Madyan, Musa was also accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, then I destroyed them.
hil: As well as the residents of Madyan, Musa was also accused of lying, so I granted the disbelievers more time, then I destroyed them.
compare: As well as the residents of Madyan, Musa was also accused of lying, so I granted the disbelievers more time, then I destroyed them.

src: Sie waren gegen den Gesandten ihres Herrn ungehorsam. I) a ergriff Er sie mit einem sich steigernden heftigen Griff.
ref: When they disobeyed the apostle of their Lord He seized them with an overwhelming punishment.
draft: They were disobedient to the messenger of their Lord. I) he seized her with an increasingly violent grip.
hil: They disobeyed the messenger of their Lord. I) He seized them with an increasingly intense grip.
compare: They disobeyed the messenger of their Lord. I) He seized them with an increasingly intense grip.

src: Sollte euch ALLAHs Peinigung unerwartet oder voraussehbar überkommen, werden etwa andere damit zugrunde gerichtet außer den unrecht-begehenden Leuten?"
ref: If God's chastisement comes upon you, suddenly or openly, shall any be destroyed, except the people of the evildoers?'
draft: "If Allah's punishment should come upon you unexpectedly or predictably, will anyone be destroyed except the wrongdoers?"
hil: "If Allah's punishment should come upon you unexpectedly or predictably, will anyone be destroyed except the wrongdoers?"
compare: "If Allah's punishment should come upon you unexpectedly or predictably, will anyone be destroyed except the wrongdoers?"

src: Als sie deren Zusammenfluß erreicht hatten, vergaßen sie ihren Fisch, so nahm er seinen Weg ins Meer wie einen Tauchpfad.
ref: When they reached the confluence they forgot the fish (they had brought as food) which swiftly made its way into the sea.
draft: When they reached its confluence, they forgot their fish, so it took its path into the sea like a diving path.
hil: When they reached the confluence, they forgot about their fish, so it took its path into the sea like a diving path.
compare: When they reached the confluence, they forgot about their fish, so it took its path into the sea like a diving path.

src: Und (ER gebietet euch), daß ihr eure Verantwortung den Waisen gegenüber in gerechter Weise erfüllt."
ref: Allah directs you to treat the orphans with justice.
draft: "And (HE commands you) that you fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner."
hil: And whatever good you do, Allah is Ever All-Aware of it.
compare: "And (HE commands you) that you fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner."

src: Und wenn ihr krank oder auf Reisen seid, oder wenn einer von euch vom Abort kommt, oder wenn ihr die Frauen berührt habt und ihr kein Wasser findet, dann sucht einen sauberen Boden und streicht euch davon über das Gesicht und die Hände. Gott will euch keine Bedrängnis auferlegen, sondern Er will euch rein machen und seine Gnade an euch vollenden, auf daß ihr dankbar seid.
ref: When you wish to stand up for prayer, wash your faces, and your hands up to the elbows, and pass wet palms over your heads and wash your feet up to the ankles; and if you need a bath, clean yourselves thoroughly; and if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you returns from answering the call of nature, or you have cohabited with women, and you do not find water, then cleanse (yourself) with clean soil – therefore stroke your soiled palms over your faces and your hands with it; Allah does not will to place you in hardship, but He wills to fully purify you and complete His favour upon you, so that you may be grateful.
draft: And if you are sick or traveling, or if one of you comes from the toilet, or if you have touched the women and cannot find water, then find clean ground and wipe your face and hands with it. God does not want to impose hardship on you, but He wants to purify you and complete His grace upon you, that you may be grateful.
hil: If you are ill or traveling, or if one of you comes from the toilet, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then look for a clean ground and wipe your face and hands with it. God does not want to impose hardship on you, but wants to purify you and complete His grace upon you, so that you may be thankful.
compare: And if you are sick or traveling, or if one of you comes from the toilet, or if you have touched the women and cannot find water, then find clean ground and wipe your face and hands with it. God does not want to impose hardship on you, but He wants to purify you and complete His grace upon you, that you may be grateful.

src: ER ist Derjenige, Der Herzensruhe in die Herzen der Mumin hinabsandte, damit sie mehr Iman zu ihrem Iman gewinnen. Und ALLAH gehören die Gehilfen der Himmel und der Erde. Und ALLAH ist immer allwissend, allweise.
ref: It is He who sent down the sense of security into the hearts of believers so that their faith may increase with belief, -- God's are the armies of the heavens and the earth; and God is all-knowing and all-wise; --
draft: HE is the one who sent tranquility into the hearts of the Mumin, so that they may increase in their Iman. And to ALLAH belong the assistants of the heavens and the earth. And ALLAH is always all-knowing, all-wise.
hil: HE is the one who sent tranquility into the hearts of the Mumin, so that they may gain more Iman to their Iman. And Allah's are the hosts of the heavens and the earth and Allah is ever-knowing, wise.
compare: HE is the one who sent tranquility into the hearts of the Mumin, so that they may increase in their Iman. And to ALLAH belong the assistants of the heavens and the earth. And ALLAH is always all-knowing, all-wise.

src: Esset von ihren Früchten, wenn sie Früchte tragen, doch gebet davon am Tage der Ernte (dem Armen) seinen Anteil, seid (dabei aber) nicht verschwenderisch! Wahrlich, Er liebt diejenigen nicht, die nicht maßhalten.
ref: So eat of their fruit when they are in fruit, and give on the day of harvesting His due, and do not be extravagant, for God does not love those who are prodigal.
draft: Eat from their fruits when they bear fruit, but give him his share on the day of harvest (to the poor), and do not be wasteful! Truly, He does not love those who do not restrain themselves.
hil: Eat of their fruits, when they bear fruit, and (give) to the poor on the day of harvest. Do not be wasteful, surely He does not love those who do not restrain themselves. Behold, in these things there are signs for people who believe.
compare: Eat from their fruits when they bear fruit, but give him his share on the day of harvest (to the poor), and do not be wasteful! Truly, He does not love those who do not restrain themselves.

src: (Alles) Lob gehört Allah, dem Herrn der Weltenbewohner!
ref: All praise be to God, the Lord of all the worlds.
draft: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the worlds!
hil: All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds!
compare: All praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the worlds!

src: Ihr meintet, daß der Gesandte und die Gläubigen niemals mehr zu ihren Angehörigen zurückkehren würden, und das ist euch in euren Herzen ausgeschmückt worden.
ref: You had imagined that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this notion was embellished in your hearts.
draft: "You believed that the messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this has been embellished in your hearts."
hil: "Previously, you thought that the messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this thought was embellished in your hearts."
compare: "You believed that the messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this has been embellished in your hearts."

src: Und gehorcht ALLAH und gehorcht dem Gesandten!
ref: Obey God and obey His Apostle.
draft: And obey ALLAH and obey the Messenger!
hil: Say: 'Obey Allah and obey the Apostle.'
compare: And obey ALLAH and obey the Messenger!

src: Als der Prophet einer seiner Gattinnen eine Mitteilung im geheimen anvertraute.
ref: The Prophet told something in confidence to one of his wives.
draft: When the prophet confided a message in secret to one of his wives.
hil: When the prophet commanded one of his wives with a message in secret.
compare: When the prophet confided a message in secret to one of his wives.

src: Sie haben außer Ihm keinen Freund.
ref: How well does He hear!
draft: They have no friend besides him.
hil: They will find no friend besides Him.
compare: They have no friend besides him.

src: Demjenigen von beiden, von dem er dachte, daß er doch gerettet wird, sagte er dann: "Erwähne mich vor deinem Gebieter!"
ref: Then he said to the one he deemed should be saved of the two, 'Mention me in thy lord's presence.'
draft: To the one of both, whom he thought would still be saved, he said then: "Mention me in front of your master!"
hil: To the man he knew would be released, Joseph said, "Remember me to your lord!" But Satan made him forget to mention this to his lord, so Joseph remained in prison for a number of years.
compare: To the one of both, whom he thought would still be saved, he said then: "Mention me in front of your master!"

src: Und (Wir sandten) zu Tamud ihren Bruder Salih. Er sagte: "O mein Volk, dient Allah! Keinen Gott habt ihr außer Ihm. Er hat euch aus der Erde entstehen lassen und sie euch zu besiedeln gegeben. So bittet Ihn um Vergebung, hierauf bereut vor Ihm. Mein Herr ist nahe und erhört (die Gebete)."
ref: And to the Thamud tribe, We sent their fellow man Saleh; he said, “O my people! Worship Allah, there is no other True God except Him; He created you from the earth and established you in it, so seek forgiveness from Him and incline towards Him in repentance; indeed my Lord is Close, Acceptor of Prayer.”
draft: And (We sent) to Thamud their brother Salih. He said: "O my people, worship Allah! You have no deity other than Him. He has brought you forth from the earth and made it habitable for you. So seek His forgiveness, then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive to [the] supplication."
hil: And (We sent) to Thamud their brother Salih. He said: "O my people, worship Allah! You have no deity other than Him. He produced you from the earth and has given you to live therein. So ask forgiveness of Him, then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is Near, Answers (the) prayer."
compare: And (We sent) to Thamud their brother Salih. He said: "O my people, worship Allah! You have no deity other than Him. He has brought you forth from the earth and made it habitable for you. So seek His forgiveness, then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive to [the] supplication."

src: So macht Allah euch Seine Zeichen klar, auf daß ihr begreifen möget.
ref: So does God pronounce His decrees that you may understand.
draft: So Allah makes clear His signs to you, that you may understand.
hil: Thus does Allah clarify His signs to you that you may understand.
compare: So Allah makes clear His signs to you, that you may understand.

src: Richte deine Augen nicht auf das, was WIR manchen von ihnen an vergänglichen Verbrauchsgütern zur Verfügung stellten. Und trauere nicht um sie, und behandle die Mumin milde!
ref: So covet not things We have bestowed on a portion of them to enjoy, and do not grieve for them, and protect those who believe;
draft: Do not focus on what WE provided some of them with perishable consumer goods. And do not mourn them and treat the Mumin kindly!
hil: Do not set your eyes on what We have provided some of them with perishable consumer goods. And do not mourn for them, and treat the Mumin kindly!
compare: Do not focus on what WE provided some of them with perishable consumer goods. And do not mourn them and treat the Mumin kindly!

src: Und diejenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht und gottgefällig Gutes getan haben, werden WIR in Dschannat eintreten lassen, die von Flüssen durchflossen sind, darin werden sie für immer und ewig bleiben. Dies ist ALLAHs Versprechen, ein Wahrhaftiges.
ref: And those who believed and did good deeds – We shall soon admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding in them for ever and ever; a true promise from Allah; and whose Words are more true than those of Allah?
draft: And those who have internalized the faith and done good deeds that are pleasing to God, We will admit them to gardens [Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they shall abide forever. This is the promise of Allah, which is surely true.
hil: And those who have believed and done what is right and pleasing to God, We will admit them to gardens [Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they shall abide forever. This is the true promise of Allah.
compare: And those who have internalized the faith and done good deeds that are pleasing to God, We will admit them to gardens [Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they shall abide forever. This is the promise of Allah, which is surely true.

src: Auf Gott sollen die Gläubigen vertrauen.
ref: The believers should only place their trust in God.
draft: "Believers should trust in God."
hil: "Believers shall trust in God."
compare: "Believers should trust in God."

src: Alsdann wird jeder Seele nach ihrem Verdienst vergolten werden, und es soll ihnen kein Unrecht geschehen.
ref: Then every person shall be paid in full what he has earned, - and they shall not be dealt with unjustly.
draft: Then each soul shall be repaid according to its deserts, and there shall be no wrong done to them.
hil: Then every soul will be repaid according to its deserts, and they will not be treated unjustly.
compare: Then every soul will be repaid according to its deserts, and they will not be treated unjustly.

src: Als Mose zu unserem Termin kam und sein Herr zu ihm sprach, sagte er: «Mein Herr, zeige (Dich) mir, daß ich zu Dir schaue.»
ref: When Moses arrived at the appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said: "O Lord, reveal Yourself to me that I may behold You."
draft: When Moses came to our appointment and his master spoke to him, he said: "My Lord, show (Yourself) to me so that I may look at You."
hil: When Moses came to our appointment and his master spoke to him, he said: 'My Lord, reveal Yourself to me so that I may behold You.'
compare: When Moses came to our appointment and his master spoke to him, he said: 'My Lord, reveal Yourself to me so that I may behold You.'

src: Ist die Ermahnung unter uns nur zu ihm allein gekommen?" Nein, sie hegen Zweifel über Meine Er mahnung. Nein, sie haben Meine Strafe nicht gekostet.
ref: What, out of all of us, has the Remembrance been sent down to him (Prophet Muhammad)' No, they are doubtful about My Remembrance, no, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
draft: "Has the rebuke only come to him alone among us?" No, they have doubts about my admonition. No, they have not tasted my punishment."
hil: Has the admonition only come to him alone among us? No, they have doubts about my admonition. No, they have not tasted my punishment.
compare: Has the admonition only come to him alone among us? No, they have doubts about my admonition. No, they have not tasted my punishment.

src: Dann lächelte er doch wegen ihrer Aussage und sagte: "Mein HERR!
ref: So he [Sulaiman (Solomon)] smiled, amused at her speech and said: "My Lord!
draft: Then he smiled because of her statement and said: "My LORD!
hil: "Then he smiled because of her statement and said, \"My LORD!\""
compare: "Then he smiled because of her statement and said, \"My LORD!\""

src: Ihr Menschen! Bereits kam zu euch doch eine Ermahnung von eurem HERRN, eine Heilung von dem, was in den Brüsten (an Zweifel) ist, eine Rechtleitung und eine Gnade für die Mumin.
ref: O men, a warning has come to you from your Lord, a remedy for the (doubts) of the heart, and a guidance and grace for those who believe.
draft: Oh people! Indeed, there has come to you an admonition from your Lord, a cure for what is in the hearts (doubts), a guidance and a mercy for the believers.
hil: O mankind! There has come to you a reminder from your Lord, a healing for what is in the hearts (doubts), a guidance, and a mercy for the believers.
compare: O mankind! There has come to you a reminder from your Lord, a healing for what is in the hearts (doubts), a guidance, and a mercy for the believers.

src: Übertreibt nicht in eurem Din (und sagt nichts) außer der Wahrheit und folgt nicht den Neigungen von Leuten, die bereits vorher irregegangen sind, viele in die Irre verleitet haben und vom rechten Weg abgekommen sind."
ref: Do not wrongfully commit injustice in your religion, and do not follow the people who earlier went astray, and led many others astray, and wandered away from the Straight Path.”
draft: Do not exceed the limits in your religion (and say nothing) except the truth and do not follow the inclinations of people who have already gone astray, led many astray, and deviated from the right path.
hil: Do not exceed the limits in your religion (and say nothing) except the truth and do not follow the inclinations of people who have already gone astray, led many astray, and deviated from the right path.
compare: Do not exceed the limits in your religion (and say nothing) except the truth and do not follow the inclinations of people who have already gone astray, led many astray, and deviated from the right path.

src: Lasse die Kinder Isra'ils mit uns gehen, und strafe sie nicht.
ref: So let the children of Israel come with us, and do not oppress them.
draft: Let the children of Israel go with us and do not punish them.
hil: Let the Descendants of Israel go with us and do not punish them.
compare: Let the children of Israel go with us and do not punish them.

src: O ihr, die ihr glaubt, kehrt zu Gott um in aufrichtiger Umkehr. Möge Gott euch eure Missetaten sühnen und euch in Gärten eingehen lassen, unter denen Bäche fließen, am Tag, da Gott den Propheten und die, die mit ihm gläubig sind, nicht zuschanden macht!
ref: O ye who believe! Turn to Allah with sincere repentance: In the hope that your Lord will remove from you your ills and admit you to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow,- the Day that Allah will not permit to be humiliated the Prophet and those who believe with him.
draft: O you who believe, turn to God in sincere repentance. May God atone for your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the day when God does not put to shame the Prophet and those who believe with him!
hil: O you who believe, turn to God in sincere repentance. May God atone for your sins and admit you to Gardens beneath which rivers flow -  the Day that God will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believe with him!
compare: O you who believe, turn to God in sincere repentance. May God atone for your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the day when God does not put to shame the Prophet and those who believe with him!

src: Und die Himmel sind zusammengerollt mit Seiner Allmacht. Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER und immer höher über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Hallowed be He and Exalted above that which they associate.
draft: And the heavens have been rolled up with His might. Exalted is He and always higher above what they associate with Him.
hil: And the heavens are rolled up with His might. Exalted is He and always higher above what they associate with Him.
compare: And the heavens have been rolled up with His might. Exalted is He and always higher above what they associate with Him.

src: (Erinnere daran), als er zum voll beladenen Schiff floh.
ref: When he fled on the laden ship,
draft: (Remember) when he fled to the fully loaded ship.
hil: Remember when he fled to the fully loaded ship.
compare: (Remember) when he fled to the fully loaded ship.

src: Das bewirkt es eher, daß ihr euch vor Ungerechtigkeit bewahrt.
ref: This is better than being iniquitous.
draft: It rather causes you to protect yourself from injustice.
hil: This rather leads to you protecting yourself from injustice.
compare: This rather leads to you protecting yourself from injustice.

src: Darum esset davon und speist den Notleidenden, den Bedürftigen.
ref: So eat thereof, and feed the hungry poor.
draft: Therefore eat from it and feed the needy, the destitute.
hil: Therefore eat from it and feed the needy, the destitute.
compare: Therefore eat from it and feed the needy, the destitute.

src: Und pflegt keinen Verkehr mit ihnen, während ihr euch in die Moscheen zurückgezogen habt.
ref: And do not have sexual relations with them (your wives) while you are in I'tikaf (i.e. confining oneself in a mosque for prayers and invocations leaving the worldly activities) in the mosques.
draft: And do not have any dealings with them while you have withdrawn into the mosques.
hil: Do not have any dealings with them while you have withdrawn into the mosques.
compare: And do not have any dealings with them while you have withdrawn into the mosques.

src: Die bittere Armut und die Krankheit suchten sie heim und sie wurden erschüttert, bis der Gesandte und diejenigen mit ihm, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben, sagten: "Wann kommt ALLAHs Beistand?" Ja!
ref: Hardship and adversity befell them and they were shaken, to the extent that the Noble Messenger and the believers along with him said, “When will the help of Allah come?”; pay heed!
draft: The bitter poverty and sickness befell them and they were shaken, until the messenger and those with him who have internalized the faith said, "When will Allah's help come?" Yes!
hil: The bitter poverty and sickness befell them and they were shaken until the messenger and those with him who believed said: 'When will Allah's help come?' yes!
compare: The bitter poverty and sickness befell them and they were shaken, until the messenger and those with him who have internalized the faith said, "When will Allah's help come?" Yes!

src: Sie werden, wenn sie die Pein sehen, zu wissen bekommen, wer weiter vom Weg abgeirrt ist.
ref: They will know soon who is farther away from the path when they see the punishment!
draft: You will know who has wandered further from the path when they see the pain.
hil: When they see the torment, they will come to know who has strayed further from the path.
compare: When they see the torment, they will come to know who has strayed further from the path.

src: Diejenigen, die nicht umkehren, sind die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: Those who do not repent behave wickedly.
draft: Those who do not repent are the ones who do wrong.
hil: "Those who do not repent are the ones who do wrong."
compare: Those who do not repent are the ones who do wrong.

src: Bereits ALLAH hat uns von euren Begebenheiten kundgetan. Und ALLAH wird eure Taten sehen sowie Sein Gesandter, dann werdet ihr zum Allwissenden über das Verborgene und das Sichtbare zurückgebracht, dann wird ER euch das kundtun, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
ref: And God will watch your actions, and so will the Messenger; then you will be returned to the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, and He will inform you of what you used to do.”
draft: Already ALLAH has informed us about your affairs. And ALLAH will see your deeds as well as His messenger, then you will be brought back to the All-Knowing about the hidden and the visible, then HE will inform you of what you used to do.
hil: Tell us: Already ALLAH has informed us about your affairs, and ALLAH will see your deeds as well as His messenger, then you will be returned back to Him who knows the unknown and the known, who will tell you what you used to do.
compare: Already ALLAH has informed us about your affairs. And ALLAH will see your deeds as well as His messenger, then you will be brought back to the All-Knowing about the hidden and the visible, then HE will inform you of what you used to do.

src: Das ist die Rede eines edlen Gesandten,
ref: That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger,
draft: This is the speech of a noble envoy,".
hil: This is the speech of a noble envoy.
compare: This is the speech of a noble envoy,".

src: Und ihnen wurde kein Aufschub gewährt.
ref: They were granted no respite.
draft: And no extension was granted to them.
hil: No delay was granted to them.
compare: And no extension was granted to them.

src: Und sie riefen: "Malik! Laß deinen HERRN uns vernichten!" Er sagte: "Gewiß, ihr müsst bleiben."
ref: And they shall call, 'O
draft: And they cried out, "Malik! Let your Lord destroy us!" He said, "Certainly, you must remain."
hil: And they will cry out, 'O Malik (Keeper of Hell)! Let your Lord destroy us!' He said, 'Certainly, you must remain.'
compare: And they cried out, "Malik! Let your Lord destroy us!" He said, "Certainly, you must remain."

src: Alif Lam Ra. Dies sind die Zeichen des weisen Buches.
ref: Alif-Lam-Ra*; these are verses of the Book of wisdom. (*alphabets of the Arabic language; Allah and to whomever He reveals, know their precise meanings.)
draft: Alif Lam Ra. These are the signs of the wise book.
hil: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the authoritative Book.
compare: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the authoritative Book.

src: Diese sind unsere Leute, sie nahmen sich anstelle von Ihm Götter. Würden sie doch dafür eine klare Bestätigung vorlegen! Und keiner begeht noch mehr Unrecht als derjenige, der im Namen ALLAHs Lügen erfindet!
ref: These, our people, have taken for themselves gods beside Him - wherefore bring they not for them an authority manifest? --and who doth greater wrong than he who fabricateth against God a lie?
draft: These are our people, they took gods instead of Him. If only they could present a clear confirmation for that! And no one commits more injustice than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah!
hil: These are our people who took gods instead of Him. If only they could provide clear proof for it! And who is more wicked than the one who fabricates a lie against God?
compare: These are our people who took gods instead of Him. If only they could provide clear proof for it! And who is more wicked than the one who fabricates a lie against God?

src: Da sprach Pharao: "Bringt mir einen jeden kundigen Zauberer herbei."
ref: "Bring the cleverest magicians to me," said the Pharaoh.
draft: Pharaoh said: "Bring me every knowledgeable magician."
hil: Then Pharaoh said:"Bring me every skilled magician."
compare: Pharaoh said: "Bring me every knowledgeable magician."

src: Ja! Nieder mit Madyan, wie es nieder mit Thamud war.
ref: Lo! a far removal for Madyan, even as Thamud were removed afar!
draft: Yes! Down with Madyan, as it was down with Thamud.
hil: Yes! Away with Madyan, as it was away with Thamud!
compare: Yes! Away with Madyan, as it was away with Thamud!

src: Verzeihe uns, vergib uns und erbarme Dich unser!
ref: Pardon us and grant us Forgiveness.
draft: Forgive us, pardon us, and have mercy on us!
hil: Forgive us, pardon us, and have mercy on us!
compare: Forgive us, pardon us, and have mercy on us!

src: So war es.
ref: Thus it was.
draft: So it was.
hil: So it was.
compare: So it was.

src: Bring du sie vom Westen.»
ref: You make it come from the West."
draft: "Bring them from the west."
hil: Bring them from the west.
compare: Bring them from the west.

src: Erbärmlich ist der Fisq-Name nach dem Iman. Und wer nicht bereut, so sind diese die Unrecht-Begehenden.
ref: And whoever does not repent – then it is they who are unjust.
draft: The Fisq name after the Imam is pathetic. And those who do not repent are the wrongdoers.
hil: The name of Fisq after Imam is pathetic. And those who do not repent, are the ones committing injustice.
compare: The Fisq name after the Imam is pathetic. And those who do not repent are the wrongdoers.

src: ER ist unser Maula!"
ref: He is our Maula (Lord, Helper and Protector)."
draft: "He is our boss!"
hil: He is our boss!
compare: "He is our boss!"

src: Ihr habt doch keine Gottheit außer Ihm und mindert nicht das Maß und das Wiegen. Ich sehe doch, daß es euch gut geht, auch gewiß, ich fürchte um euch die Peinigung eines alles umfassenden Tages.
ref: Worship Allah, you have no other Ilah (God) but Him, and give not short measure or weight, I see you in prosperity; and verily I fear for you the torment of a Day encompassing.
draft: You have no deity other than Him, and do not decrease the measure and the balance. I see that things are going well for you, and I am certainly afraid of the punishment of an encompassing Day for you.
hil: There is no deity but Him, and do not diminish the measure and the balance. I see that things are going well for you, but surely, I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing Day.
compare: You have no deity other than Him, and do not decrease the measure and the balance. I see that things are going well for you, and I am certainly afraid of the punishment of an encompassing Day for you.

src: Er sagte: "Kann ich ihn euch etwa anders anvertrauen, als ich euch seinen Bruder vorher anvertraut habe? Doch ALLAH ist Der beste Beschützer und ER ist Der Allgnädigste der Gnade-Erweisenden."
ref: He said: I intrust you with him only as I intrusted you with his brother aforetime; Allah is the best Guard, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.
draft: He said: "Can I entrust him to you in a different way than I entrusted his brother to you before? But ALLAH is the best protector and HE is the Most Merciful of the Merciful."
hil: He said: "Can I entrust him to you in a different way than I entrusted his brother to you before? But ALLAH is the best protector, and HE is the Most Merciful of the Merciful."
compare: He said: "Can I entrust him to you in a different way than I entrusted his brother to you before? But ALLAH is the best protector, and HE is the Most Merciful of the Merciful."

src: Diejenigen, die ungläubig waren, sagten zu ihren Gesandten: "Wir werden euch ganz gewiß aus unserem Land vertreiben, oder aber ihr kehrt zu unserem Glaubensbekenntnis zurück!"
ref: The unbelievers said to their apostles: "We shall drive you out of our land, or else you come back to our fold."
draft: "Those who disbelieved said to their messengers: 'We will certainly drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion!'"
hil: "Those who disbelieved said to their messengers: 'We will certainly drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion!'"
compare: "Those who disbelieved said to their messengers: 'We will certainly drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion!'"

src: Als sie kam, da wurde gesprochen: "Ist dein Thron wie dieser?" Sie sagte: "Es ist, als wäre er ein und derselbe." Und uns wurde (davon) Wissen, schon vor ihr, verliehen; und wir hatten uns bereits (Allah) ergeben.
ref: And when she came she was asked: 'Is your throne like this' And she replied: 'It looks like it' And we were given the knowledge before her, and wereMuslims.
draft: When she arrived, it was said, "Is your throne like this?" She said: "It is as if it is the same." And we were given knowledge before her and we had already submitted [to Allah].
hil: When she arrived, it was spoken: "Is your throne like this?" She said, "It is as if it is the same." And knowledge was already given to us before her, and we had already submitted (to Allah).
compare: When she arrived, it was said, "Is your throne like this?" She said: "It is as if it is the same." And we were given knowledge before her and we had already submitted [to Allah].

src: Und wenn ihr Schwierigkeiten miteinander habt, so wird für ihn eine andere stillen.
ref: But if you find this difficult, let some other woman suckle (the child) for her.
draft: And if you have difficulties with each other, another (person) will calm him.
hil: And if you have difficulties with each other, let another woman give suck for him (the father of the child).
compare: And if you have difficulties with each other, another (person) will calm him.

src: Am Tag, an dem Wir den Himmel zusammenfalten, wie das Urkundenbuch die Schriftstücke zusammenfaltet. Wie Wir eine erste Schöpfung am Anfang gemacht haben, wiederholen Wir sie.
ref: The day We shall roll up the heavens like a written scroll, We shall revert it (to nothing) as it was before We first created it.
draft: On the day when we fold the sky together, as the charters fold the documents. As we made a first creation at the beginning, we repeat it.
hil: On the day when We shall fold up the heavens like the folding of a register; We shall make him like the making We made at the first time; this is a promise upon Us; We will certainly do it.
compare: On the day when We shall fold up the heavens like the folding of a register; We shall make him like the making We made at the first time; this is a promise upon Us; We will certainly do it.

src: Und den Juden haben Wir alles Getier untersagt, das Krallen hat; und von den Rindern und vom Kleinvieh haben Wir ihnen das Fett verboten, ausgenommen das, was an ihrem Rücken sitzt oder in den Eingeweiden oder mit den Knochen verwachsen ist. Damit haben Wir ihnen ihre Auflehnung vergolten. Und siehe, Wir sind Wahrhaftig.
ref: And for the Jews We forbade all animals with claws; and forbade them the fat of oxen and sheep except which is on their backs or joined to their intestines or to the bone; We awarded this to them for their rebellion; and indeed, surely, We are truthful.
draft: And We have forbidden to the Jews all beasts that have claws, and the fat of cattle and sheep except what adheres to their backs or entrails or is joined to bone. [By] that We repaid them for their injustice. And indeed, We are truthful.
hil: We have made unlawful for the Jews all animals with claws and the fat of the oxen and sheep, except that on their backs or in their intestines or that which is attached to their bones. By doing so, We have repaid them for their rebellion. And behold, We are truthful.
compare: And We have forbidden to the Jews all beasts that have claws, and the fat of cattle and sheep except what adheres to their backs or entrails or is joined to bone. [By] that We repaid them for their injustice. And indeed, We are truthful.

src: Sind diese (Mumin) etwa diejenigen, von denen ihr geschworen habt, daß ALLAH ihnen keinerlei Gnade erweisen würde?!
ref: “Are these the people (Muslims) regarding whom you swore that Allah would not have mercy on them at all?
draft: Are these (Moomin) the ones of whom you swore that Allah would not show them any mercy?!
hil: Are these the ones of whom you had sworn and said that God will not have mercy on them?!
compare: Are these (Moomin) the ones of whom you swore that Allah would not show them any mercy?!

src: Und ermahne damit diejenigen, die fürchten, zu ihrem HERRN versammelt zu werden, während es für sie (dabei) anstelle von Ihm weder Wali noch Fürbittenden gibt, damit sie Taqwa gemäß handeln.
ref: Warn those who fear, through this (Qur'an), that they will be gathered before their Lord, and they will have none to protect or intercede for them apart from Him. They may haply take heed for themselves.
draft: And thereby remind those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there is no ally or intercessor apart from Him, that they might act in accordance with Taqwa.
hil: And remind those who fear to be gathered to their Lord, that for them there is no ally or intercessor apart from Him, so that they may act in accordance with Taqwa.
compare: And thereby remind those who fear to be gathered to their Lord that for them there is no ally or intercessor apart from Him, that they might act in accordance with Taqwa.

src: Und gewiß, wir sind doch wahrhaftig."
ref: We are verily speaking the truth.'"
draft: And surely, we are truly."
hil: And surely, we are truly.
compare: And surely, we are truly."

src: Wenn euch Gutes trifft, werden sie traurig. Wenn euch jedoch Übel überkommt, freuen sie sich darüber. Doch wenn ihr euch in Geduld übt und Taqwa gemäß handelt, wird ihre Heimtücke euch nicht im Geringsten schaden. Gewiß, ALLAH ist dessen, was sie tun, (mit Seinem Wissen) allumfassend.
ref: If good comes your way, they are vexed; but if evil befalls you they are pleased and rejoice; yet if you are patient and guard yourselves against evil, their cunning will not harm you in the least, for whatsoever they do is well within the reach of God.
draft: If good befalls you, it grieves them, but if calamity overtakes you, they rejoice at it. But if you are steadfast and mindful of Allah, their scheming will not harm you in the least: Allah encompasses all they do in His knowledge.
hil: If good befalls you, it grieves them, but if calamity overtakes you, they rejoice at it. But if you are steadfast and mindful of Allah, their scheming will not harm you in the least: Allah encompasses all they do in His knowledge.
compare: If good befalls you, it grieves them, but if calamity overtakes you, they rejoice at it. But if you are steadfast and mindful of Allah, their scheming will not harm you in the least: Allah encompasses all they do in His knowledge.

src: Darin werden sie auf immer ewig weilen.
ref: Which they will enjoy for ever.
draft: They will dwell there forever and ever.
hil: Those who believe and do good deeds, We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever and ever. That is the promise of Allah, truthfully, and who is more truthful than Allah in statement.
compare: They will dwell there forever and ever.

src: Dies ist für das, was ihr euch erworben habt. Und gewiß ist ALLAH den Dienern in keiner Weise ein Unrecht- Zufügender."
ref: “This is the recompense of what your own hands have sent ahead, and Allah does not oppress His bondmen.”
draft: This is for what you have acquired for yourselves. And verily, Allah does not wrong His servants in any way.
hil: This is for what you have acquired for yourselves. And verily, Allah does not wrong His servants in any way.
compare: This is for what you have acquired for yourselves. And verily, Allah does not wrong His servants in any way.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Nehmt kein Riba in vervielfacht verdoppelter Höhe ein, und handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, damit ihr erfolgreich seid.
ref: O you who believe, do not practice usury, charging doubled and redoubled (interest); but have fear of God: you may well attain your goal.
draft: You who have internalized the iman! Do not take riba multiplied in double height and act according to Taqwa towards ALLAH, so that you may be successful.
hil: Believers, do not take riba multiplied in double height, and act with Taqwa towards Allah, so that you may be successful.
compare: Believers, do not take riba multiplied in double height, and act with Taqwa towards Allah, so that you may be successful.

src: denjenigen, deren Leben die Engel beenden, während sie rein sind. Sie (die Engel) sagen: "Salam sei mit euch, tretet in Dschanna ein wegen dem, was ihr zu tun pflegtet."
ref: When the angels receive the souls of those who are blameless they will say: "Peace on you. Enter Paradise as recompense for what you did."
draft: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. They (the angels) say: "Salam be upon you, enter Jannah because of what you used to do."
hil: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. Enter Paradise for that you were doing.
compare: Those whose lives the angels end while they are pure. They (the angels) say: "Salam be upon you, enter Jannah because of what you used to do."

src: Und wenn ihr krank oder auf Reisen seid oder der eine von euch von der Notdurft kommt oder ihr die Frauen (intim) berührt habt und kein Wasser finden könnt, dann sucht reine Erdoberfläche und streicht euch über eure Gesichter und Hände (bis zu den Ellbogen).
ref: And if you are ill, or on a journey, or one of you comes after answering the call of nature, or you have been in contact with women (by sexual relations) and you find no water, perform Tayammum with clean earth and rub therewith your faces and hands (Tayammum).
draft: And if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you comes from the restroom, or you have touched the women (intimately) and cannot find water, then look for clean ground and wipe your faces and hands (up to the elbows).
hil: And if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you comes from the restroom, or you have touched the women (intimately) and cannot find water, then seek clean ground and wipe your faces and hands (up to the elbows).
compare: And if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you comes from the restroom, or you have touched the women (intimately) and cannot find water, then seek clean ground and wipe your faces and hands (up to the elbows).

src: Sag: "Ich suche Schutz bei Dem HERRN des Morgengrauens
ref: SAY: "I SEEK refuge with the Lord of rising day
draft: Say: "I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn."
hil: Say: 'I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn.'
compare: Say: "I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn."

src: Durch sie gewinnt ihr Wärme und (andere) Produkte. Und ihr ernährt euch von ihnen.
ref: He hath created them. For you in them there is warmth and other profits and of them ye eat.
draft: Through them, you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.
hil: Through them, you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.
compare: Through them, you gain warmth and (other) products. And you nourish yourselves from them.

src: Und wenn ihr den Iman und Taqwa verinnerlicht, läßt er euch eure Belohnung zuteil werden und verlangt von euch nicht euer Vermögen.
ref: If you believe and fear God, he will give you your reward, and will not ask for your possessions.
draft: And if you internalize the iman and taqwa, it will grant you your reward and will not demand your wealth from you.
hil: And if you internalize iman and taqwa, it will grant you your reward and will not demand your wealth from you.
compare: And if you internalize iman and taqwa, it will grant you your reward and will not demand your wealth from you.

src: Diejenigen von den Leuten des Buches und von den Polytheisten, die nicht glauben, mögen es nicht gern, daß auf euch etwas Gutes von eurem Herrn herabgesandt wird. Gott aber schenkt seine Barmherzigkeit in besonderer Weise, wem Er will. Und Gott besitzt große Huld.
ref: Those who disbelieve – the People given the Book(s) or the polytheists – do not wish that any good be sent down upon you from your Lord; and Allah chooses whomever He wills by His Mercy; and Allah is the Most Munificent.
draft: Those among the people of the Book and the polytheists who disbelieve do not like to have any good sent down to you from your Lord. But God selects for His mercy whom He wills. And God is the possessor of great bounty.
hil: Those without faith among the people of the Book and those who worship idols do not wish that good should come to you from your Lord. But God chooses whom He likes for His grace, and God's bounty is infinite.
compare: Those among the people of the Book and the polytheists who disbelieve do not like to have any good sent down to you from your Lord. But God selects for His mercy whom He wills. And God is the possessor of great bounty.

src: Also manche von ihnen sind rechtgeleitet, und viele von ihnen sind Fasiq.
ref: Then of them some are guided ones, and many of them are transgressors.
draft: Some of them are guided aright, but many of them are iniquitous.
hil: So, We guided some of them to the right path, but most of them are disobedient.
compare: So, We guided some of them to the right path, but most of them are disobedient.

src: Und gewiß, bereits vor dir wurden Gesandte der Lüge bezichtigt, so haben sie sich in Geduld geübt für das, weswegen sie der Lüge bezichtigt wurden und ihnen Schaden zugefügt wurde, bis Unser Sieg ihnen zuteil wurde. Und es gibt keinen, der ALLAHs Versprechen abändern kann.
ref: Rejected were the messengers before thee: with patience and constancy they bore their rejection and their wrongs, until Our aid did reach them: there is none that can alter the words (and decrees) of Allah.
draft: And certainly, messengers before you were also accused of falsehood, and they endured patiently for the sake of what they were accused of, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can alter Allah's promise.
hil: Yet they bore with fortitude the falsehoods and the hurt for the sake of what they were accused of, until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can alter Allah's promise.
compare: And certainly, messengers before you were also accused of falsehood, and they endured patiently for the sake of what they were accused of, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And there is no one who can alter Allah's promise.

src: So (war es).
ref: Thus (it was)!
draft: So (it was).
hil: So (it was).
compare: So (it was).

src: Sprich: Ob ihr das geheimhaltet, was in eurem Inneren ist, oder es offenlegt, Gott weiß es.
ref: Say: 'Whether you hide what is in your breasts or publish it, God knows it.
draft: Speak: Whether you keep hidden what is inside you or reveal it, God knows it.
hil: Say, whether you keep hidden what is inside you or reveal it, God knows it.
compare: Speak: Whether you keep hidden what is inside you or reveal it, God knows it.

src: Aber dann, am Tag der Auferstehung verleugnet ihr einander und verflucht ihr einander.
ref: But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will disown one another, and curse one another.
draft: But then, on the day of resurrection, you deny each other and curse each other.
hil: But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will deny and curse one another.
compare: But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will deny and curse one another.

src: Und WIR schmückten den untersten Himmel mit Lampen und Bewahrendem.
ref: And We adorned the nearest (lowest) heaven with lamps (stars) to be an adornment as well as to guard (from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils).
draft: And WE adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and preservatives.
hil: And We adorned the lowest heaven with lamps (stars) to be an adornment as well as to guard (against the devils by using them as missiles). Such is the Decree of Him the All-Mighty, the All-Knower.
compare: And We adorned the lowest heaven with lamps (stars) to be an adornment as well as to guard (against the devils by using them as missiles). Such is the Decree of Him the All-Mighty, the All-Knower.

src: So ertrage geduldig, was sie sagen, und lobpreise deinen Herrn vor dem Aufgang der Sonne und vor dem (Sonnen-)untergang
ref: So you bear with patience what they say, and sing the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun and its setting,
draft: So bear patiently what they say, and glorify your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting.
hil: So bear patiently what they say, and glorify your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting.
compare: So bear patiently what they say, and glorify your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting.

src: O die ihr glaubt, berauschender Trank, Glücksspiel, Opfersteine und Lospfeile sind nur ein Greuel vom Werk des Satans.
ref: O believers, this wine and gambling, these idols, and these arrows you use for divination, are all acts of Satan; so keep away from them.
draft: O you who believe, intoxicating drinks, gambling, altars of sacrifice, and divining arrows are but a defilement from the work of Satan.
hil: O you who believe, intoxicating drinks, games of chance, idols, and divining arrows are a filthy work of Satan.
compare: O you who believe, intoxicating drinks, gambling, altars of sacrifice, and divining arrows are but a defilement from the work of Satan.

src: Diese jedoch lehrten niemanden, ohne zu sagen: «Wir sind nur eine Versuchung, so werde nicht ungläubig.»
ref: They learnt what led to discord between husband and wife.
draft: However, they taught no one without saying: "We are only a temptation, so do not be unbelieving."
hil: However, they taught no one without saying: 'We are just a temptation, so do not become unbelieving.'
compare: However, they taught no one without saying: "We are only a temptation, so do not be unbelieving."

src: Und wer dies tut, der fügt sich selbst Unrecht zu.
ref: He who does so will wrong himself.
draft: And whoever does this wrongs oneself.
hil: And whoever does this, does wrong to oneself.
compare: And whoever does this wrongs oneself.

src: Sie sagen: «Die Wahrheit.» Und Er ist der Erhabene, der Große.
ref: They say, “All that He has proclaimed is the Truth; and He is the Supreme, the Great.”
draft: They say, "The truth." And He is the Exalted, the Great.
hil: They say, "The truth." And He is the Exalted, the Great.
compare: They say, "The truth." And He is the Exalted, the Great.

src: Und WIR prüften sie mit gottgefälligen guten Taten und mit den gottmißfälligen Taten, damit sie umkehren.
ref: And We tried them with good (blessings) and evil (calamities) in order that they might turn (to Allah's Obedience).
draft: And WE tested them with good deeds acceptable to God and with the displeasing deeds, so that they would repent.
hil: And when We tried them with deeds pleasing to Allah and with deeds displeasing to Him, so that they would turn back.
compare: And WE tested them with good deeds acceptable to God and with the displeasing deeds, so that they would repent.

src: Wenn Er damit die von seinen Dienern, die Er will, trifft, da sind sie froh,
ref: Then, when He makes it fall upon whom He wills of His servants, behold, they rejoice.
draft: If He thus hits those of His servants whom He wants, they are happy.
hil: If He hits those of His servants whom He wants in this way, they are happy.
compare: If He thus hits those of His servants whom He wants, they are happy.

src: Für die Ungläubigen nicht leicht.
ref: Dolorous for the unbelievers.
draft: For the unbelievers not easy.
hil: Not easy for the unbelievers.
compare: For the unbelievers not easy.

src: Und sie schreien darin laut: "Unser Herr, bringe uns heraus, so werden wir rechtschaffen handeln, anders als das, was wir zu tun pflegten." - "Haben Wir euch nicht ein so langes Leben gewährt, daß jeder, der hätte bedenken wollen, darin hätte bedenken können? Und ist nicht der Warner zu euch gekommen?
ref: And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you?
draft: And they cry out loudly in it: "Our Lord, bring us out, so we will act righteously, differently from what we used to do." - "Did We not grant you such a long life that whoever wanted to ponder, could have pondered therein? And has not the Warner come to you?
hil: And they cry out loudly in it: 'Our Lord, bring us out, so we will act righteously, differently from what we used to do.' 'Did We not grant you such a long life that whoever wanted to ponder, could have pondered therein? And has not the Warner come to you?'
compare: And they cry out loudly in it: "Our Lord, bring us out, so we will act righteously, differently from what we used to do." - "Did We not grant you such a long life that whoever wanted to ponder, could have pondered therein? And has not the Warner come to you?

src: Bringt mir Eisenstücke!" Als er dann (die Lücke) zwischen den beiden Wallabhängen auf gleicher Höhe zuschütten ließ, sagte er: "Blast!"
ref: Bring me ingots of iron," (which they did) until the space between two mountain sides was filled up.
draft: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then filled in (the gap) between the two walls at the same height, he said, "Blow!"
hil: "Bring me pieces of iron! When he had then filled in (the gap) between the two wall slopes at the same height, he said: \"Blow!\""
compare: "Bring me pieces of iron!" When he then filled in (the gap) between the two walls at the same height, he said, "Blow!"

src: Und verrichtet das Gebet und entrichtet die Abgabe.
ref: Fulfil your devotional obligations and pay the zakat.
draft: And perform the prayer and pay the alms.
hil: And perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and give Zakat.
compare: And perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and give Zakat.

src: Also hinsichtlich des Schaums, so wird er beiseite geworfen, doch hinsichtlich dessen, das den Menschen nützt, so verbleibt es in der Erde.
ref: The scum disappears like the foam on the bank, and that which is useful to man remains on the earth.
draft: Regarding the foam, it is discarded, but regarding that which benefits people, it remains in the earth.
hil: Therefore, concerning the foam, it is cast away, but as for that which benefits people, it remains on earth.
compare: Regarding the foam, it is discarded, but regarding that which benefits people, it remains in the earth.

src: Darin hören sie nichts Unnützes - (sie hören) nur den Salam-Gruß! Und ihnen ist ihre Versorgung darin morgens und abends gesichert!
ref: They will hear no vain talk there, but only salutations of peace, and they will have their sustenance morning and evening."
draft: They hear nothing useless in it - (they hear) only the Salam greeting! And their provisions are secured for them in it in the morning and evening.
hil: They hear nothing unnecessary in it - only the Salam greeting! And their provisions are secured in it in the morning and evening.
compare: They hear nothing unnecessary in it - only the Salam greeting! And their provisions are secured in it in the morning and evening.

src: Gewiß, bereits haben WIR Nuh zu seinen Leuten entsandt, dann sagte er: "Meine Leute!
ref: Indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people and he said: "O my people!
draft: Certainly, we have already sent Noah to his people, then he said: "My people!
hil: Certainly, We had sent Noah to his people, then he said: 'My people!
compare: Certainly, we have already sent Noah to his people, then he said: "My people!

src: Sie sagten: "Salih! Bereits hast du unter uns Vertrauen vor dieser (Aufforderung) genossen.
ref: They said, 'Salih, thou hast hitherto been a source of hope among us.
draft: They said: "Salih! You have already gained our trust before this (request) among us.
hil: They said, 'Salih! You have already gained our trust before this (request) among us.'
compare: They said: "Salih! You have already gained our trust before this (request) among us.

src: Und wer Kufr betreibt ALLAH, Seinen Engeln, Seinen Schriften, Seinen Gesandten und dem Jüngsten Tag gegenüber, der ist bereits weit in die Irre gegangen.
ref: But he who believes not in God and His angels and the Books and the prophets and the Last Day, has wandered far away.
draft: And whoever practices disbelief, Allah, His angels, His scriptures, His messengers, and the Last Day have already gone far astray.
hil: And whoever disbelieves in Allah, His angels, His scriptures, His messengers, and the Last Day, has undoubtedly wandered far astray.
compare: And whoever disbelieves in Allah, His angels, His scriptures, His messengers, and the Last Day, has undoubtedly wandered far astray.

src: Gewiß, Wir haben um ihre Hälse Fesseln gelegt.
ref: We have enchained their necks up to their chins.
draft: Sure, we have placed nooses around their necks.
hil: Surely, We have placed chains around their necks.
compare: Surely, We have placed chains around their necks.

src: Das sind die, für die es die guten Dinge geben wird, und das sind diejenigen, denen es wohl ergeht.
ref: These are they for whom are goods, and these: they are the blissful.
draft: These are the ones for whom there will be good things, and these are those who will fare well.
hil: "These are the ones for whom good things will be given, and these are those whom will fare well."
compare: These are the ones for whom there will be good things, and these are those who will fare well.

src: und ehrerbietig gegen meine Mutter (zu sein); Er hat mich nicht gewalttätig und unselig gemacht.
ref: And be dutiful to my mother. He has not made me haughty or rebellious.
draft: And to be respectful towards my mother; He did not make me violent and unhappy.
hil: And to be respectful towards my mother; He did not make me violent and unhappy.
compare: And to be respectful towards my mother; He did not make me violent and unhappy.

src: Dies ist besser für euch und reiner. Und wenn ihr (es) nicht vermögt, also gewiß, ALLAH ist allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: Yet if you find not means, God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
draft: This is better for you and purer. And if you are not able, then surely Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: This is better for you and purer. And if you cannot [do it], then surely Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
compare: This is better for you and purer. And if you are not able, then surely Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

src: Bei Gott steht ein großartiger Lohn bereit.
ref: Indeed God has greater rewards with Him.
draft: A great reward awaits with God.
hil: With Him is a great reward (Paradise).
compare: With Him is a great reward (Paradise).

src: Dann gaben Wir ihn seiner Mutter zurück, damit ihr Auge mit Freude erfüllt würde und damit sie sich nicht grämte und damit sie wüßte, daß Allahs Verheißung wahr sei. Jedoch die meisten von ihnen wissen es nicht.
ref: Thus We restored him to his mother that she may be tranquil and not grieve, and know that the promise of God is true, though most men do not know.
draft: Then We returned him to his mother so that her eye may be satisfied and that she might not grieve and that she would know that Allah's promise is true. But most of them do not know.
hil: We then restored him to his mother, so that she might be comforted and not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of God is true. But most of them do not know it.
compare: Then We returned him to his mother so that her eye may be satisfied and that she might not grieve and that she would know that Allah's promise is true. But most of them do not know.

src: Doch wahrlich, er (Jesus) ist ein Vorzeichen der Stunde.
ref: He is certainly the sign of the Hour (of change).
draft: But verily, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour.
hil: "Verily, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour."
compare: But verily, he (Jesus) is a sign of the Hour.

src: Aber nein! Ihr werdet es bald erfahren.
ref: But you will come to know soon; --
draft: But no! You will soon find out.
hil: "No! you will soon find out."
compare: But no! You will soon find out.

src: Und sie haben gesagt: .Verlaßt doch nicht eure Götter; verlaßt doch nicht Wadd, noch Suwa", noch Yagut,Ya'uq und Nasr.'
ref: And said: 'Do not abandon your gods, and do not abandon Wadda or Suwa', or Yaghuth, Ya'uq or Nasr.'
draft: They said: "Do not abandon your gods; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yagut, Ya'uq and Nasr."
hil: And they said: "Do not abandon your gods; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yagut, Ya\'uq and Nasr."
compare: They said: "Do not abandon your gods; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yagut, Ya'uq and Nasr."

src: "Unser Herr, belange uns nicht, wenn wir (etwas) vergessen oder einen Fehler begehen. Unser Herr, lege uns keine Bürde auf, wie Du sie denjenigen vor uns auferlegt hast.
ref: Do not seize us if we forget or are mistaken; our Lord!
draft: "Our Lord, do not hold us responsible if we forget or make a mistake. Our Lord, do not burden us as You have burdened those before us."
hil: Our Lord, burden us not if we forget or make a mistake. And do not lay upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us.
compare: "Our Lord, do not hold us responsible if we forget or make a mistake. Our Lord, do not burden us as You have burdened those before us."

src: Und so erweckten Wir sie auf, damit sie sich gegenseitig fragten. Einer von ihnen sagte: "Wie lange habt ihr verweilt?" Sie sagten: "Verweilt haben wir einen Tag oder den Teil eines Tages." Sie sagten: "Euer Herr weiß am besten, wie (lange) ihr verweilt habt. So schickt einen von euch mit diesen euren Silbermünzen in die Stadt; er soll sehen, welche ihre reinste Speise ist, und euch davon eine Versorgung bringen. Er soll behutsam sein und ja niemanden etwas von euch merken lassen.
ref: And similarly We awakened them so that they may enquire about each other; a speaker among them said, “How long have you stayed here?” Some among them said, “We have stayed a day or part of a day”; the others said, “Your Lord well knows how long you have stayed; therefore send one of you to the city with this silver coin – he may then check which food available there is purer, in order to bring some of it for you to eat – and he must be courteous and not inform anyone about you.”
draft: And so We awakened them that they might question one another. One of them asked: "How long have you remained (here)?" They said: "We have remained (perhaps) a day, or part of a day." (At length) they (all) said: "Allah (alone) knows best how long ye have remained here.... Now send ye then one of you with this money of yours to the town: let him find out which is the best food (to be had) and bring some to you, that (ye may) satisfy your hunger therewith: And let him behave with care and courtesy, and let him not inform any one about you.
hil: And so we awakened them that they might question one another. One of them said, 'I stayed for a day or a part of a day.' They said, 'Allah knows best how long you stayed. So send one of you with these silver coins of yours to the city. Let him look for the purest food in there, and let him bring a supply of it to you. And let him be cautious and let no one know about you.'
compare: And so we awakened them that they might question one another. One of them said, 'I stayed for a day or a part of a day.' They said, 'Allah knows best how long you stayed. So send one of you with these silver coins of yours to the city. Let him look for the purest food in there, and let him bring a supply of it to you. And let him be cautious and let no one know about you.'

src: An jenem Tag gehört die Königsherrschaft Gott (allein). Er wird zwischen ihnen urteilen. Dann werden diejenigen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, in den Gärten der Wonne sein.
ref: For Allah only is the kingship on that day; He will judge between them; so those who believed and did good deeds are in Gardens of content.
draft: On that day, the kingship will belong to God (alone). He will judge between them. Then those who believe and do good deeds will be in the gardens of bliss.
hil: On that day, the sovereignty will belong to God alone. He will judge between them. Then We shall admit those who believed and did good deeds to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever and ever. That is the promise of Allah, truthfully, and whose words are truer than Allah's? (Allah does not lie.)
compare: On that day, the kingship will belong to God (alone). He will judge between them. Then those who believe and do good deeds will be in the gardens of bliss.

src: Und wäre nicht über euch Allahs Huld und Seine Barmherzigkeit, nicht einer von euch wäre rein geworden; doch Allah macht rein, wen Er will.
ref: Were it not for God’s grace towards you, and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever. But God purifies whomever He wills.
draft: And if it were not for Allah's grace and mercy upon you, not one of you would have become pure; but Allah purifies whom He wills.
hil: " And were it not for Allah's munificence and His mercy upon you, none of you would ever become pure – but Allah purifies whomever He wills."
compare: And if it were not for Allah's grace and mercy upon you, not one of you would have become pure; but Allah purifies whom He wills.

src: Und ALLAH ist immer über alles allmächtig.
ref: God is powerful over everything.
draft: And Allah is always almighty over everything.
hil: And God is always omnipotent over everything.
compare: And Allah is always almighty over everything.

src: Auch kennt ER, was auf dem Festland und was im Meer ist.
ref: He knows what is in land and sea; not a leaf falls, but He knows it.
draft: Also, HE knows what is on the mainland and what is in the sea.
hil: He knows what is on the land and in the sea.
compare: He knows what is on the land and in the sea.

src: Sagen sie: "Wir teilten Dir mit, keiner von uns ist Zeuge."
ref: They will answer: "We profess to You not one of us can vouch for them."
draft: They say: "We informed you that none of us is a witness."
hil: They said, 'We informed you that none of us is a witness.'
compare: They said, 'We informed you that none of us is a witness.'

src: Und er sagte: «O meine Söhne, geht nicht durch ein einziges Tor hinein.
ref: And he said: O my sons!
draft: And he said, "Oh my sons, do not enter through a single gate."
hil: And he said, "O my sons," do not enter through a single gate.
compare: And he said, "Oh my sons, do not enter through a single gate."

src: Auch der Warner kam zu euch. Also erfahrt (die Peinigung)!
ref: To you the warner came; taste you now!
draft: Even the Warner came to you. So (learn of the torment)!
hil: The Warner has also come to you. So learn (about the punishment)!
compare: The Warner has also come to you. So learn (about the punishment)!

src: (Dies ist) eine Offenbarung von Ihm, Der die Erde und die hohen Himmel erschuf.
ref: A revelation from Him who created the earth and the high ascending skies,
draft: This is a revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens.
hil: This is a revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens.
compare: This is a revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens.

src: Und gebt ihnen etwas vom Vermögen Gottes, das Er euch gegeben hat. Und zwingt nicht eure Sklavinnen, wenn sie sich unter Schutz stellen wollen, zur Hurerei im Trachten nach den Gütern des diesseitigen Lebens.
ref: And constrain not your slave-girls to prostitution, if they desire to live in chastity, that you may seek the chance goods of the present life.
draft: And give them something from the wealth of God that He has given to you. And do not force your slave girls, when they seek to protect themselves, into prostitution in their desire for the goods of this world.
hil: And provide them with something from the wealth of Allah that He has given you. And do not force your slave women, when they seek protection, into prostitution in pursuit of the amenities of worldly life. And if anyone should coerce them, Allah is certainly after that, All-Forgiving, Merciful.
compare: And provide them with something from the wealth of Allah that He has given you. And do not force your slave women, when they seek protection, into prostitution in pursuit of the amenities of worldly life. And if anyone should coerce them, Allah is certainly after that, All-Forgiving, Merciful.

src: Er hört alles und ist nahe.
ref: He is all-hearing and all-too-near."
draft: He hears everything and is nearby.
hil: He hears everything and is nearby.
compare: He hears everything and is nearby.

src: Und in der Morgendämmerung baten sie um Vergebung,
ref: And every morning asked forgiveness,
draft: And at dawn they asked for forgiveness.
hil: "And at dawn they asked for forgiveness."
compare: And at dawn they asked for forgiveness.

src: Weder darf die Sonne den Mond einholen, noch kommt die Nacht dem Tag zuvor.
ref: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor does the night outstrip the day.
draft: Neither may the sun catch up with the moon, nor does the night arrive before the day.
hil: Neither may the sun overtake the moon, nor does the night arrive before the day.
compare: Neither may the sun catch up with the moon, nor does the night arrive before the day.

src: Ihr dient anstatt Allahs nur Götzen und schafft (dabei nur) ungeheuerliche Lüge.
ref: You worship idols in place of God and invent lies.
draft: You only serve idols instead of Allah and (thus) create only monstrous lies.
hil: You only serve idols instead of Allah and thereby create only monstrous lies.
compare: You only serve idols instead of Allah and thereby create only monstrous lies.

src: (Erlaubt sind) auch die unter Schutz gestellten gläubigen Frauen und die unter Schutz gestellten Frauen aus den Reihen derer, denen vor euch das Buch zugekommen ist, wenn ihr ihnen ihren Lohn zukommen laßt und mit ihnen in der Absicht lebt, (sie) unter Schutz zu stellen, nicht Unzucht zu treiben und (sie) nicht als heimliche Konkubinen zu nehmen.
ref: The food (slaughtered cattle, eatable animals, etc.) of the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) is lawful to you and yours is lawful to them. (Lawful to you in marriage) are chaste women from the believers and chaste women from those who were given the Scripture (Jews and Christians) before your time, when you have given their due Mahr (bridal money given by the husband to his wife at the time of marriage), desiring chastity (i.e. taking them in legal wedlock) not committing illegal sexual intercourse, nor taking them as girl-friends.
draft: (Allowed are) also the faithful women who are under the protection and those women who are under protection from among those who were given the Book before you, as long as you give them their dowries and live with them in honor, not in fornication, nor taking them as secret concubines.
hil: And (also) permissible are the chaste women who are under protection and those women from among the People of the Book who have been given to you (in marriage) if you give them their due compensation, and desire chastity, not illicit intercourse or taking [secret] lovers.
compare: (Allowed are) also the faithful women who are under the protection and those women who are under protection from among those who were given the Book before you, as long as you give them their dowries and live with them in honor, not in fornication, nor taking them as secret concubines.

src: Und Wir ließen ihn all unsere Zeichen schauen, aber er erklärte (sie) für Lüge und weigerte sich.
ref: So We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused,
draft: And We showed him all Our signs, but he rejected them as lies and refused.
hil: And We showed him all Our signs, but he rejected them as lies and refused.
compare: And We showed him all Our signs, but he rejected them as lies and refused.

src: An jenem Tag trifft (die Stunde) ein, die eintreffen wird,
ref: On that Day will come what is to come.
draft: On that day arrives (the hour) which will arrive.
hil: "On that day arrives (the hour) which will arrive."
compare: On that day arrives (the hour) which will arrive.

src: Er (David) sagte: "Wahrlich, er hat ein Unrecht an dir verübt, als er dein Mutterschaf zu seinen eigenen Mutterschafen hinzu verlangte. Und gewiß, viele Teilhaber vergehen sich gegeneinander; nur die (sind davon) ausgenommen, die glauben und gute Werke tun; und das sind wenige." Und David merkte, daß Wir ihn auf die Probe gestellt hatten; also bat er seinen Herrn um Verzeihung und fiel betend nieder und bekehrte sich.
ref: He said: Surely he has been unjust to you in demanding your ewe (to add) to his own ewes; and most surely most of the partners act wrongfully towards one another, save those who believe and do good, and very few are they; and Dawood was sure that We had tried him, so he sought the protection of his Lord and he fell down bowing and turned time after time (to Him).
draft: He (David) said, "Truly, he has wronged you when he asked to include your ewe with his own ewes. And surely many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do good deeds; and they are few." And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked his Lord for forgiveness and fell down bowing in worship and repented.
hil: He (David) said: "Verily, he wronged you when he demanded your ewe to be added to his own ewes. And indeed, many partners wrong each other, except those who believe and do good deeds; and they are few." And David realized that We had tested him, so he asked his Lord for forgiveness and fell down in prayer and repented.
compare: He (David) said, "Truly, he has wronged you when he asked to include your ewe with his own ewes. And surely many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do good deeds; and they are few." And David realized that We had tried him, so he asked his Lord for forgiveness and fell down bowing in worship and repented.

src: Sag: "Gibt es unter den von euch (ALLAH) beigesellten Partnern einen, der zur Wahrheit rechtleitet?" Sag: "ALLAH leitet zur Wahrheit recht!"
ref: Say: 'Do any of your partners guide you to the truth' Say: 'Allah, He guides to the truth.
draft: Say: "Is there among those associated with you (ALLAH) any who guides to the truth?" Say: "ALLAH guides to the truth!"
hil: Say, 'Is there among those associated with you (ALLAH) any who guides to the truth?' Say, 'Allah guides to the truth!'
compare: Say: "Is there among those associated with you (ALLAH) any who guides to the truth?" Say: "ALLAH guides to the truth!"

src: Und wer krank oder auf Reisen war, (fastet) an anderen Tagen die gleiche Anzahl.
ref: Whoever of you witnesses the month, shall fast it.
draft: And whoever was ill or traveling, (fasts) on other days the same number.
hil: And whoever was ill or traveling, shall (fast) the same number on other days.
compare: And whoever was ill or traveling, shall (fast) the same number on other days.

src: ER wird sie doch in einen Eingang eingehen lassen, an dem sie Wohlgefallen finden werden. Und gewiß, ALLAH ist zweifelsohne allwissend, allnachsichtig.
ref: He will certainly admit them to a place they will love; and indeed Allah is All Knowing, Most Forbearing.
draft: He will indeed lead them into an entrance where they will find pleasure, and certainly, Allah is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.
hil: He will certainly allow them to enter a gate where they will find pleasure. And surely, Allah is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.
compare: He will indeed lead them into an entrance where they will find pleasure, and certainly, Allah is undoubtedly all-knowing, all-forgiving.

src: Da ergriff Ich sie.
ref: Then I seized them.
draft: I grabbed her.
hil: I grabbed her.
compare: I grabbed her.

src: Habt ihr das Was ser betrachtet, das ihr trinkt?
ref: Consider the water that you drink.
draft: Have you considered the water you are drinking?
hil: Have you considered the water you drink?
compare: Have you considered the water you drink?

src: enn sie so glauben, wie ihr glaubt, dann werden sie rechtgeleitet sein; wenn sie sich aber abwenden, so sind sie nur in Abspaltung geraten.
ref: So if they believe in the like of that which ye believe in, surely they are guided; but if they turn away, then they are but in Cleavage.
draft: "If they believe as you believe, they will be guided right; but if they turn away, they are only in schism."
hil: "If they believe as you believe, they will be guided right; but if they turn away, they are only in schism."
compare: "If they believe as you believe, they will be guided right; but if they turn away, they are only in schism."

src: Sie sagten: "Wir ahnen Böses von dir und von denen, die mit dir sind." Er sagte: "Euer Unheil ist bereits bei Allah. Nein, ihr seid ein Volk, das geprüft wird."
ref: They said, “We consider you an evil omen, and your companions”; he said, “Your evil omen is with Allah – in fact you people have fallen into trial.”
draft: They said, "We suspect evil from you and those who are with you." He said, "Your misfortune is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested."
hil: They said, 'We suspect evil from you and those who are with you.' He said, 'Your misfortune is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested.'
compare: They said, "We suspect evil from you and those who are with you." He said, "Your misfortune is already with Allah. No, you are a people who are being tested."

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Entsinnt euch der Gabe ALLAHs euch gegenüber, als ein Volk euch Schaden zufügen wollte und ER sie von euch abgehalten hat. Und handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber. Und ALLAH gegenüber sollen die Mumin Tawakkul üben!
ref: O believers, remember God's blessing upon you, when a certain people purposed to stretch against you their hands, and He restrained their hands from you; and fear God; and in God let the believers put all their trust.
draft: You who have internalized the imam! Remember the gift of Allah to you when a nation tried to harm you and He prevented them from doing so. And act according to taqwa towards Allah. And the believers should exercise tawakkul towards Allah!
hil: Believers, remember the gift of Allah to you when a nation tried to harm you and He prevented them from doing so. Do Taqwa towards Allah, and believers should have tawakkul towards Allah.
compare: You who have internalized the imam! Remember the gift of Allah to you when a nation tried to harm you and He prevented them from doing so. And act according to taqwa towards Allah. And the believers should exercise tawakkul towards Allah!

src: Auch vor dir schickten Wir keine Gesandten, die keine Speise aßen oder nicht auf den Märkten umhergingen. Allein, Wir machen die einen unter euch zur Prüfung für die anderen.
ref: And all the Noble Messengers We sent before you were like this – eating food and walking in the markets; and We have made some of you a test for others; so will you, O people, patiently endure?
draft: Even before you, We did not send any messengers who did not eat food or did not walk in the markets. However, We make some of you a test for others.
hil: Indeed, We have sent Noble Messengers before you to their respective nations. They came to them with clear signs. We have made some among you a test for others. It is Our mercy's duty to help the Muslims.
compare: Even before you, We did not send any messengers who did not eat food or did not walk in the markets. However, We make some of you a test for others.

src: So ließen WIR die 'Alaqa zu einer Mudgha werden, und WIR ließen die Mudgha zu Knochen werden, und die Knochen bedeckten WIR mit Fleisch, dann ließen WIR ihn als eine andere Schöpfung entstehen.
ref: Then We developed the lump into bones. Then We clothed the bones with flesh.
draft: So we allowed the 'Alaqa to become a Mudgha, and we allowed the Mudgha to become bones, and we covered the bones with flesh, then we caused him to emerge as a different creation.
hil: We allowed the 'Alaqa to become a Mudgha, and we allowed the Mudgha to become bones, and we covered the bones with flesh, then we caused him to emerge as a different creation.
compare: So we allowed the 'Alaqa to become a Mudgha, and we allowed the Mudgha to become bones, and we covered the bones with flesh, then we caused him to emerge as a different creation.

src: Und ALLAH vergibt den Mumin-Männern und den Mumin-Frauen. Und ALLAH ist immer allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: But Allah pardoneth believing men and believing women, and Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
draft: And Allah forgives the believing men and the believing women. And Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
hil: And to ALLAH belong the forgiveness of believing men and believing women. And ALLAH is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
compare: And to ALLAH belong the forgiveness of believing men and believing women. And ALLAH is ever Forgiving, Merciful.

src: Dann hat er (Schu'aib) sich von ihnen abgewendet und sagte: "Meine Leute! Gewiß, bereits habe ich euch die Botschaft meines HERRN verkündet und euch Ratschläge gemacht, also weshalb soll ich kufr-betreibenden Leuten nachtrauern?!
