ref: So he turned his back on them, and said, 'O my people, I have delivered to you the Messages of my Lord, and advised you sincerely; how should I grieve for a people of unbelievers?'
draft: Then he (Shu'aib) turned away from them and said: "My people, indeed I have conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and given you good advice, so why should I grieve for a disbelieving people?"
hil: Then he (Shu'aib) turned away from them and said: "My people, I have already advised you, so why should I grieve for those who do not believe?"
compare: Then he (Shu'aib) turned away from them and said: "My people, indeed I have conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and given you good advice, so why should I grieve for a disbelieving people?"

src: Ihr, die den Iman bekundet habt! Verinnerlicht den Iman an ALLAH, an Seinen Gesandten, an die Schrift, die ER Seinem Gesandten nach und nach hinabsandte und an die Schrift, die ER vorher hinabsandte.
ref: O believers, believe in God and His Messenger and the Book He has revealed to His Apostle, and the Books revealed before.
draft: You who have declared the faith! Internalize the faith in ALLAH, in His Messenger, in the Scripture that He sent down to His Messenger gradually, and in the Scripture that He sent down before.
hil: Believers, have faith in Allah and His Messenger, in the book He sent down upon this noble messenger of His, and the book He sent down before. And whoever does not accept faith in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day, has undoubtedly wandered far astray.
compare: You who have declared the faith! Internalize the faith in ALLAH, in His Messenger, in the Scripture that He sent down to His Messenger gradually, and in the Scripture that He sent down before.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir sind zu einem Volk von Übeltätern gesandt,
ref: "We have been sent," they said, "to (punish) a sinful people,
draft: "They said, 'We are sent to a people of evildoers,"
hil: "They said, 'We are sent to a people of evildoers"
compare: "They said, 'We are sent to a people of evildoers,"

src: Und was euch an Dingen zuteil wurde, ist nur Verbrauchsgut des Diesseits und dessen Schmuck.
ref: Whatsoever has been given you is the stuff this life is made of, and only its embellishment.
draft: And what happened to you in terms of things is only a consumable of this world and its decoration.
hil: Whatever has been given to you is a usage in the life of this world and its adornment; and what is with Allah is better and more lasting. Do you not have sense?
compare: Whatever has been given to you is a usage in the life of this world and its adornment; and what is with Allah is better and more lasting. Do you not have sense?

src: Aber sie möchten nicht an das glauben, was sie zuvor geleugnet hatten. So versiegelt Allah die Herzen der Ungläubigen.
ref: Thus it is that Allah seals the hearts of those who deny the truth.
draft: But they do not want to believe in what they had previously denied. So Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.
hil: But they do not want to believe in what they had previously denied. Thus, Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.
compare: But they do not want to believe in what they had previously denied. So Allah seals the hearts of the disbelievers.

src: Gewiß, Wir haben die Tora hinabgesandt, in der Rechtleitung und Licht sind, womit die Propheten, die sich (Allah) ergeben hatten, für diejenigen, die dem Judentum angehören, walten, und so auch die Leute des Herrn und die Gelehrten, nach dem, was ihnen von der Schrift Allahs anvertraut worden war und worüber sie Zeugen waren. So fürchtet nicht die Menschen, sondern fürchtet Mich.
ref: Verily We sent down the Taurat wherein was a guidance and a light. By it the prophets who submitted themselves judged those who were judaised, and so did the divines and the priests by that wherewith they were entrusted of the Book of Allah and they had become witnesses thereof.
draft: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, by which the Prophets who had submitted themselves to Allah judged for the Jews, as did the Lord's people and the scholars, according to that which they were entrusted with of Allah's Scripture and to which they were witnesses. So fear not mankind, but fear Me.
hil: Verily, We have sent down the Torah with guidance and light, by which the Prophets who had submitted themselves to Allah judged for the Jews, as did the Lord's people and the scholars, based on what was entrusted to them from Allah's Scripture and of which they are witnesses. Therefore, fear not mankind, but fear Me.
compare: Certainly, We have sent down the Torah, in which there is guidance and light, by which the Prophets who had submitted themselves to Allah judged for the Jews, as did the Lord's people and the scholars, according to that which they were entrusted with of Allah's Scripture and to which they were witnesses. So fear not mankind, but fear Me.

src: Und diejenigen, denen Wissen und Glauben zugekommen sind, sagen: «Nach dem Buch Gottes habt ihr bis zum Tag der Auferweckung verweilt. Und das ist der Tag der Auferweckung.
ref: Those who have received knowledge and have faith will say, "By the decree of God, you have remained for the exact period which was mentioned in the Book of God about the Day of Resurrection.
draft: And those who have been given knowledge and faith say, "According to the book of God you have stayed until the day of resurrection. And this is the day of resurrection."
hil: And those who have been given knowledge and faith say, "According to the book of God you have stayed until the day of resurrection. And this is the day of resurrection."
compare: And those who have been given knowledge and faith say, "According to the book of God you have stayed until the day of resurrection. And this is the day of resurrection."

src: Diejenigen von euch, die sie zu Freunden nehmen, das sind die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: Whosoever of you then befriendeth them then those! they are the wrong-doers.
draft: Those of you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.
hil: Those of you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.
compare: Those of you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.

src: Fir'aun hatte sein Volk in die Irre geführt und nicht rechtgeleitet.
ref: The Pharaoh had led his people astray, and did not rightly guide them.
draft: Pharaoh had led his people astray and not guided them rightly.
hil: "Pharaoh had led his people astray and not guided them rightly."
compare: Pharaoh had led his people astray and not guided them rightly.

src: Gewiß, dieser ist ein Feind für dich und für deine Gattin. Also lasst ihn nicht euch beide aus der Dschanna herausbringen, sonst mußt du dich mühen.
ref: This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.
draft: Certainly, he is an enemy to you and your wife. So do not let him bring you both out of paradise, otherwise you will have to labor.
hil: Certainly, he is an enemy to you and your wife. So do not let him bring you both out of paradise, then you will have to toil.
compare: Certainly, he is an enemy to you and your wife. So do not let him bring you both out of paradise, otherwise you will have to labor.

src: ER vergibt, wem ER will, und peinigt, wen ER will.
ref: No: You are only mortals, of His creation."
draft: "He forgives whom He wills and torments whom He wills."
hil: He may forgive whosoever He pleases, and afflict whosoever He will.
compare: "He forgives whom He wills and torments whom He wills."

src: Das sind die Parteien.
ref: These were the hordes.
draft: These are the parties.
hil: These are the parties.
compare: These are the parties.

src: Und sie pflegten zu sagen: "Wie?
ref: And said: "What!
draft: And they used to say: "How?
hil: And they used to say, 'How?'
compare: And they used to say: "How?

src: Das ist der Genuß im diesseitigen Leben. Doch bei Allah ist die schöne Heimstatt.
ref: That is the enjoyment of the present life; but God -- with Him is the fairest resort.
draft: "This is the enjoyment in this life on earth. But with Allah is the beautiful abode."
hil: "This is the enjoyment in the worldly life, but the beautiful abode is with Allah."
compare: "This is the enjoyment in the worldly life, but the beautiful abode is with Allah."

src: So legen Wir die Zeichen ausführlich dar, - auf daß sie umkehren mögen.
ref: That is how We explain Our signs distinctly so that they may come back (to the right path).
draft: Therefore, we explain the signs in detail, so that they may turn back.
hil: That is how We explain Our signs so that they may turn back.
compare: That is how We explain Our signs so that they may turn back.

src: Das ist die Frohbotschaft, die Gott seinen Dienern, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, verkündet. Sprich: Ich verlange von euch keinen Lohn dafür, es sei denn die Liebe wie zu den Verwandten.
ref: That is that whereof Allah giveth the glad tidings Unto His bondmen who believe and work righteous works, Say thou: I ask of you no hire therefor save affection in respect of kinship.
draft: This is the good news that God proclaims to his servants who believe and do good works. Say: I do not ask you for any payment for this, except for love like that of relatives.
hil: "This is the good news that God gives to his creatures who believe and do good. Say: I do not ask you for any payment for this, except for love like that of relatives."
compare: This is the good news that God proclaims to his servants who believe and do good works. Say: I do not ask you for any payment for this, except for love like that of relatives.

src: Und vor Mir (allein) sollt ihr Ehrfurcht haben.
ref: Me, you must fear.
draft: And before Me (alone) shall you have reverence.
hil: And on Me alone you should have reverence.
compare: And before Me (alone) shall you have reverence.

src: Und Wir haben ihn als Koran in Abschnitte geteilt, damit du ihn den Menschen ohne Hast verliest. Und Wir haben ihn nach und nach hinabgesandt.
ref: And We sent down the Qur’an in parts, that you may gradually recite it to the people, and We sent it down slowly in stages.
draft: And We have divided him into sections as the Quran, that you may recite it to the people at intervals. And We have sent him down gradually.
hil: And We have divided it into sections as the Quran, so that you may recite it to the people at intervals without haste, and We have sent it down gradually.
compare: And We have divided it into sections as the Quran, so that you may recite it to the people at intervals without haste, and We have sent it down gradually.

src: Sollte Der Allgnade Erweisende mir Schaden zufügen, würden weder ihre Fürbitte mir etwas nützen, noch würden sie mich erretten.
ref: So that if the Most Gracious should wish me any harm, their intercession would be of no use to me, nor would they be able to save me?”
draft: If the merciful one were to inflict harm on me, neither their intercession would benefit me nor would they save me.
hil: If the Most Gracious were to inflict harm on me, neither their intercession would benefit me nor would they be able to save me.
compare: If the Most Gracious were to inflict harm on me, neither their intercession would benefit me nor would they be able to save me.

src: Und (einen Teil) der Nacht, verbringe ihn damit, zusätzlich für dich.
ref: And in some parts of the night (also) offer the Salat (prayer) with it (i.e. recite the Quran in the prayer), as an additional prayer (Tahajjud optional prayer Nawafil) for you (O Muhammad SAW).
draft: And (part of) the night, spend it additionally for yourself.
hil: And (part of) the night, spend it in addition for yourself.
compare: And (part of) the night, spend it in addition for yourself.

src: Ein anderer Teil sorgte sich jedoch nur um sich selbst, sie dachten von ALLAH alles andere als das Wahre, eben das Denken der unwissenden Gemeinschaft, sie sagten: "Haben wir in dieser Angelegenheit irgendwelchen Einfluß?!"
ref: Slumber overtook a party of you, while another party was thinking about themselves (as how to save their ownselves, ignoring the others and the Prophet SAW) and thought wrongly of Allah - the thought of ignorance.
draft: Another part, however, was only concerned with themselves, they thought of ALLAH anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"
hil: But another part was only concerned with themselves, they thought of Allah anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"
compare: But another part was only concerned with themselves, they thought of Allah anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"

src: Handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, strebt nach dem, womit ihr Sein Wohlgefallen erreicht und leistet Dschihad fi-sabilillah, damit ihr erfolgreich werdet.
ref: Fear Allah, and seek the means towards Him, and strive in His cause, in the hope of attaining success.
draft: Act Taqwa in accordance with Allah, strive for what pleases Him and engage in Jihad for the sake of Allah, so that you may be successful.
hil: O you who believe, follow the path shown to you by God, seek the way of proximity to Him and struggle in His way, so you may have success.
compare: Act Taqwa in accordance with Allah, strive for what pleases Him and engage in Jihad for the sake of Allah, so that you may be successful.

src: (Dies), außer das Wort Ibrahims zu seinem Vater: "Ich werde ganz gewiß für dich um Vergebung bitten; doch vermag ich für dich vor Allah gar nichts auszurichten.
ref: (Except that Abraham said unto his father, 'Certainly I shall ask pardon for thee; but I have no power to do aught for thee against God.')
draft: "This apart from Ibrahim's word to his father: 'I will certainly pray for your forgiveness, but I cannot do anything for you before Allah.'
hil: Apart from Abraham's words to his father: 'I will certainly ask for your forgiveness, but I am unable to do anything for you before Allah.'
compare: "This apart from Ibrahim's word to his father: 'I will certainly pray for your forgiveness, but I cannot do anything for you before Allah.'

src: Also manche von ihnen haben den Iman verinnerlicht und manche von ihnen haben Kufr betrieben. Und hätte ALLAH es gewollt, hätten sie den bewaffneten Kampf gegenseitig nicht geführt, doch ALLAH macht, was ER will.
ref: If Allah had willed, they would not have fought against one another, but Allah does what He likes.
draft: Some of them have internalized the faith, and some of them have committed disbelief. And if ALLAH had willed, they would not have fought against each other in armed combat, but ALLAH does what HE wills.
hil: Some of them have internalized the faith, and some of them have committed disbelief. And if it had willed, they would not have fought against each other in armed combat, but it does what it wills.
compare: Some of them have internalized the faith, and some of them have committed disbelief. And if ALLAH had willed, they would not have fought against each other in armed combat, but ALLAH does what HE wills.

src: Er sagte: "Gewiß, bereits tat er dir Unrecht mit seiner Forderung zur Überlassung deines Schafsweibchen zu seinen Schafsweibchen. Und gewiß, die meisten der Beteiligten begehen doch Übertretungen die einen von ihnen gegen die anderen außer denjenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht und gottgefällig Gutes getan haben. Doch diese sind wenige." Und Dawud dachte, daß WIR ihn nur einer Fitna unterzogen haben. Dann bat er seinen HERRN um Vergebung, fiel in Ruku' nieder und war umkehrend.
ref: Said he, 'Assuredly he has wronged thee in asking for thy ewe in addition to his sheep; and indeed many intermixers do injury one against the other, save those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- and how few they are!' And David thought that We had only tried him; therefore he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down, bowing, and he repented.
draft: He said, "Certainly, he did you wrong by demanding your female sheep for his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other except for those who have internalized faith and do good deeds pleasing to God. But those are few." And Dawud thought that We had only subjected him to a trial. Then he asked his Lord for forgiveness, fell into Ruku' and repented.
hil: He said, "Certainly, he did you wrong by demanding your female sheep for his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other except for those who believed and did the right. But those are few." And Dawud thought that We had only subjected him to a trial. Then he asked his Lord for forgiveness, fell into Ruku' and repented.
compare: He said, "Certainly, he did you wrong by demanding your female sheep for his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other except for those who have internalized faith and do good deeds pleasing to God. But those are few." And Dawud thought that We had only subjected him to a trial. Then he asked his Lord for forgiveness, fell into Ruku' and repented.

src: Dies (geschah deshalb), weil sie immer wieder die Zeichen Allahs leugneten und die Propheten zu Unrecht töteten; dies (geschah), weil sie sich auflehnten und immer wieder übertraten.
ref: This, because they were ever disbelieving in the signs of Allah and slaying the prophets without justice. This, because they disobeyed and were ever trespassing.
draft: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.
hil: This happened because they disbelieved the word of God and slayed the prophets unjustly, for they transgressed and rebelled.
compare: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.

src: (Hätten Wir dich nicht entsandt), würden sie sagen, wenn sie ein Unglück trifft wegen dessen, was ihre Hände vorausgeschickt haben: "Unser Herr, hättest Du doch einen Gesandten zu uns gesandt, so daß wir Deinen Zeichen hätten folgen können und zu den Gläubigen'hätten gehören können!"
ref: And in case disaster comes upon them for what they have done themselves, they should say: "O Lord, why did You not send an apostle to us that we should have followed Your commands, and been with those who are believers;"
draft: "If We had not sent you," they would say, "and disaster struck us because of what our hands have sent forth, then they would say, "Our Lord, why did you not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?".
hil: "Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your verses and been among the believers!" They would say, if We had not sent you, and disaster struck them because of what their hands have sent forth, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so that we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"
compare: "If We had not sent you," they would say, "and disaster struck us because of what our hands have sent forth, then they would say, "Our Lord, why did you not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?".

src: An dem Tag, wenn ER sie allesamt erweckt, werden sie Ihm schwören, wie sie euch schwören, und sie denken, sie verfügen über etwas (Nützliches).
ref: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all together (for their account), then they will swear to Him as they swear to you (O Muslims).
draft: On the day when HE awakens all of them, they will swear to HIM, as they swear to you, and they think they have something useful.
hil: On the day when God resurrects all of them together, they will swear to Him as they swore to you, and they think they have something (useful), but indeed, they are liars.
compare: On the day when God resurrects all of them together, they will swear to Him as they swore to you, and they think they have something (useful), but indeed, they are liars.

src: Vielleicht tue ich Gutes in dem, was ich hinterlassen habe.» Nein, das ist nur ein Wort, das er (so) sagt.
ref: "In order that I may work righteousness in the things I neglected." - "By no means!
draft: "Maybe I am doing good with what I have left behind." "No, that's just a word he says."
hil: Maybe I am doing good in what I have left behind. No, that's just a word he says.
compare: "Maybe I am doing good with what I have left behind." "No, that's just a word he says."

src: Dann konnten sie weder aufstehen, noch wurde ihnen beigestanden.
ref: And neither stand up nor defend themselves.
draft: Then they could neither get up, nor were they assisted.
hil: Then they could neither stand up nor were they assisted.
compare: Then they could neither get up, nor were they assisted.

src: Ich bitte euch nicht um eine Belohnung dafür. Meine Belohnung obliegt doch nur Demjenigen, Der mich erschuf.
ref: “O my people, I ask you no wage for it; my wage lies with Him who originated me.
draft: I am not asking you for a reward for this. My reward lies only with the One who created me.
hil: I seek no reward from you for my work. My reward lies only with the One who created me.
compare: I seek no reward from you for my work. My reward lies only with the One who created me.

src: Dann entsandten Wir nach ihnen Mose mit unseren Zeichen zu Pharao und seinen Vornehmen.
ref: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite, but they wronged them.
draft: Then We sent Moses to them with our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles.
hil: Then indeed We sent Moses with Our signs to Firaun and his chieftains. He said, 'indeed I am a Noble Messenger of the Lord of the Creation.'
compare: Then We sent Moses to them with our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles.

src: Und Al'ahrsch von deinem HERRN tragen über ihnen an diesem Tag acht.
ref: And on that Day, eight (of them) will carry the Throne of your Lord above them.
draft: And on this day, the angels of your Lord will carry over them eight.
hil: And on this day, eight will be carried by the angels of your Lord over them.
compare: And on this day, the angels of your Lord will carry over them eight.

src: Wenn die Heuchler und diejenigen, in deren Herzen Krankheit ist, und diejenigen, die beunruhigende Falschmeldungen in der Stadt verbreiten, (damit) nicht aufhören, werden Wir dich bestimmt gegen sie antreiben.
ref: If the hypocrites and those who have a disease in their hearts, and those who make a commotion in the City do not desist, We will surely urge you against them.
draft: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease and those who spread disturbing rumors in the city do not quit, We will certainly urge you against them.
hil: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts there is sickness, and those who spread disturbing rumors in the town don't stop, We will certainly urge you against them.
compare: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease and those who spread disturbing rumors in the city do not quit, We will certainly urge you against them.

src: Und die weiblichen Guten sind für die männlichen Guten, und die männlichen Guten sind für die weiblichen Guten bestimmt, diese sind unschuldig hinsichtlich dessen, was sie (die anderen an Ifk-Lüge) sagen. Für sie ist Vergebung und edles Rizq bestimmt.
ref: Good statements are for good people (or good women for good men) and good people for good statements (or good men for good women), such (good people) are innocent of (each and every) bad statement which they say, for them is Forgiveness, and Rizqun Karim (generous provision i.e. Paradise).
draft: And the female virtuous ones are intended for the male virtuous ones, and the male virtuous ones are intended for the female virtuous ones; these are innocent of what the others say (about the lie of Ifk). Forgiveness and an honorable provision are for them (the virtuous ones).
hil: And good women are intended for good men, and good men are intended for good women; they are innocent of what people say. Forgiveness and noble provision are destined for them.
compare: And the female virtuous ones are intended for the male virtuous ones, and the male virtuous ones are intended for the female virtuous ones; these are innocent of what the others say (about the lie of Ifk). Forgiveness and an honorable provision are for them (the virtuous ones).

src: (Es gilt) schöne Geduld (zu üben). Gott ist der, der um Hilfe gebeten wird gegen das, was ihr beschreibt.»
ref: He said: nay! your selves have embellished for you an affair; so seemly patience! and Allah is to be implored for help in that which ye ascribe
draft: Practice beautiful patience. God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe.
hil: Practice beautiful patience. They will be asked, 'Where are the partners you took as allies besides God and worshiped?' God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe.
compare: Practice beautiful patience. God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe.

src: Doch es ist nichts als eine Ermahnung für die Weltenbewohner.
ref: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
draft: But it is nothing but a admonition for the inhabitants of the worlds.
hil: But it is nothing but a reminder for the inhabitants of the worlds.
compare: But it is nothing but a reminder for the inhabitants of the worlds.

src: Oder glaubt ihr in Sicherheit davor zu sein, daß Er euch ein anderes Mal aufs Meer zurückbringt und einen verheerenden Wind gegen euch sendet und euch ertrinken läßt, weil ihr ungläubig seid, und (daß) ihr dann für euch keinen Gefolgsmann findet, der Uns deswegen belangen könnte?
ref: Or you feel so secure that He will not send you back (to sea) again or send a gravel-hurtling storm against you, and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will not find any avenger against Us.
draft: Or do you believe to be safe from Him returning you to the sea and sending a devastating wind against you, causing you to drown because you are unbelievers, and (that) you will not find any defender for yourselves who could do something about it?
hil: Or do you believe to be safe from Him returning you to the sea and sending a devastating wind against you, causing you to drown because you are unbelievers, and (that) you will not find any defender for yourselves who could do something about it?
compare: Or do you believe to be safe from Him returning you to the sea and sending a devastating wind against you, causing you to drown because you are unbelievers, and (that) you will not find any defender for yourselves who could do something about it?

src: Doch WIR sehen mit euch nicht eure Fürbittenden, die ihr unter euch als Partner (für ALLAH) angenommen habt.
ref: We do not see your intercessors with you who, you imagined, had partnership with you.
draft: But WE do not see with you your intercessors, those whom you have taken as partners (for ALLAH) among yourselves.
hil: And now ye have come to us singly even as We created you for the first time, and ye have left behind your backs that which We had granted unto you, and We do not see with you those whom ye fancied were our associates in respect of you, as ye asserted.
compare: But WE do not see with you your intercessors, those whom you have taken as partners (for ALLAH) among yourselves.

src: Seht ihr denn nicht?
ref: Can you not perceive?
draft: Can't you see?
hil: Have you not seen?
compare: Can't you see?

src: Sie sagte: "Ihr Entscheidungsträger!
draft: She said: "You decision maker!
hil: "She said, 'You decision maker!'"
compare: "She said, 'You decision maker!'"

src: Und die Ungläubigen sagen von den Gläubigen: "Wäre er (der Quran) etwas Gutes, hätten sie ihn nicht vor uns erlangt." Und da sie sich nicht von ihm leiten lassen, sagen sie: "Dies ist eine alte Lüge."
ref: And the disbelievers said regarding the Muslims, “If there were any good in it, the Muslims would not have surpassed us in achieving it!”; and since they did not receive guidance with it, they will now say, “This is an old slander.”
draft: And the unbelievers say of the believers: "If he (the Quran) were anything good, they would not have obtained it before us." And since they do not let themselves be guided by it, they say: "This is an old lie."
hil: And the unbelievers say of the believers: "If it were something good (the Quran), they would not have obtained it before us." And since they do not let themselves be guided by it, they say: "This is an old lie."
compare: And the unbelievers say of the believers: "If he (the Quran) were anything good, they would not have obtained it before us." And since they do not let themselves be guided by it, they say: "This is an old lie."

src: Er hat die Schlüssel der Himmel und der Erde. Diejenigen, die die Zeichen Gottes verleugnen, das sind die Verlierer.
ref: He has the keys of the heavens and the earth; and those who deny the revelations of God will be losers.
draft: He has the keys to the heaven and the earth. Those who deny the signs of God are the losers.
hil: He holds the keys to the heavens and the earth. Those who deny the signs of God, they are the losers. They shall face a severe punishment, for God is powerful and His requital is great.
compare: He has the keys to the heaven and the earth. Those who deny the signs of God are the losers.

src: Ihre Gesandten sagten: "Existiert etwa ein Zweifel über Allah, den Schöpfer der Himmel und der Erde?
ref: Said their apostles: "Can there be doubt about God, the originator of the heavens and the earth?
draft: Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?
hil: Their messengers said, 'Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?'
compare: Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?

src: Jene sind (überhaupt) die Unachtsamen.
ref: They are the heedless ones.
draft: Those are (altogether) the careless ones.
hil: Those are the inattentive ones altogether.
compare: Those are the inattentive ones altogether.

src: Einen Teil tötetet ihr, und einen Teil nahmt ihr gefangen.
ref: Some of them you killed, and others you took captive.
draft: You killed a part and captured a part.
hil: You killed some and captured some.
compare: You killed a part and captured a part.

src: Allah hat gesagt: Nehmt euch nicht zwei Götter. Er ist nur ein Einziger Gott. Vor Mir (allein) sollt ihr Ehrfurcht haben.
ref: And Allah has proclaimed, “Do not ascribe two Gods; indeed He is the only One God; therefore fear Me alone.”
draft: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is only one single god. You should have reverence before Me (alone).
hil: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is only one single God. You should have reverence before Me (alone).
compare: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is only one single god. You should have reverence before Me (alone).

src: Ehefrauen des Propheten! Welche von euch eine bewiesene Abscheulichkeit vollbringt, für diese wird die Peinigung verzweifacht. Und dies ist für ALLAH immer ein Leichtes.
ref: Wives of the Prophet, whosoever among you commits a flagrant indecency, for her the chastisement shall be doubled; that is easy for God.
draft: Wives of the Prophet! For any of you who commits a proven immorality, her punishment will be doubled. And that is easy for Allah to do.
hil: O wives of the Prophet! Whoever of you commits a clear immorality - for her, the punishment will be doubled, and that is easy for Allah.
compare: O wives of the Prophet! Whoever of you commits a clear immorality - for her, the punishment will be doubled, and that is easy for Allah.

src: Und hätte dein HERR es gewollt, hätte ER doch die Menschen zu einer einzigen Umma gemacht - sie aber bleiben uneins
ref: But if your Lord had pleased He could have made all human beings into one community of belief. But they would still have differed from one another,
draft: "And if your LORD had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ."
hil: "And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they continue to differ."
compare: "And if your LORD had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ."

src: Und seid nicht wie diejenigen, die sich gespalten haben und uneins geworden sind, nachdem die deutlichen Zeichen zu ihnen gekommen waren.
ref: So be not like those who became disunited and differed among themselves after clear proofs had come to them.
draft: And do not be like those who have split and become divided after the clear signs have come to them.
hil: Do not be like the people who have become divided and discordant among themselves after being evident among themselves.
compare: And do not be like those who have split and become divided after the clear signs have come to them.

src: Sie sagten: "Fürchte dich nicht!" Und sie überbrachten ihm frohe Botschaft über einen äußerst wissenden Jungen.
ref: They said, “Do not fear,” and they announced to him the good news of a knowledgeable boy.
draft: They said "Do not be afraid!" and brought him good news about an extremely knowledgeable boy.
hil: They said, "Do not fear - we convey to you the glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy."
compare: They said "Do not be afraid!" and brought him good news about an extremely knowledgeable boy.

src: Dies (ist deshalb so), weil jene, die ungläubig sind, dem Trügerischen folgen, und weil diejenigen, die gläubig sind, der Wahrheit ihres Herrn folgen. So beschreibt Allah den Menschen ihre Lage.
ref: This is because the disbelievers followed falsehood and the believers followed the Truth which is from their Lord; this is how Allah illustrates the examples of people to them.
draft: This is so because those who are unbelievers follow the deceptive and those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. Thus Allah describes to people their situation.
hil: This is because those who are disbelievers follow the deceitful, and those who believe follow the truth of their Lord. Thus Allah describes people's situation.
compare: This is so because those who are unbelievers follow the deceptive and those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. Thus Allah describes to people their situation.

src: Als die Nacht über ihn hereinbrach, sah er einen Himmelskörper. Er sagte: "Das ist mein Herr."
ref: When the night came with her covering of darkness he saw a star, and (Azar, his father) said: "This is my Lord."
draft: As the night fell on him, he saw a celestial body. He said, "That is my Lord."
hil: "As night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body. He said, \"This is my Lord.\""
compare: "As night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body. He said, \"This is my Lord.\""

src: Aber Allah ist voll Huld gegen die Weltenbewohner.
ref: But gracious is God to the people of the world.
draft: But Allah is full of grace towards the inhabitants of the worlds.
hil: "But Allah is full of grace towards the inhabitants of the worlds."
compare: But Allah is full of grace towards the inhabitants of the worlds.

src: Und Wir haben den untersten Himmel mit Leuchten geschmückt und haben sie zu Wurfsteinen gegen die Satane gemacht.
ref: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans.
draft: And We have adorned the lowest heaven with lights and made them as missiles against the devils.
hil: "And We adorned the nearest heaven with stars to be an adornment as well as to guard (from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils). Such is the decree of Him, the All-Mighty, the All-Knower."
compare: "And We adorned the nearest heaven with stars to be an adornment as well as to guard (from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils). Such is the decree of Him, the All-Mighty, the All-Knower."

src: Ihr könnt auf der Erde nichts vereiteln. Und ihr habt außer Gott weder Freund noch Helfer.
ref: You cannot thwart Him on the earth, and have no friend or helper apart from Him.
draft: You can't thwart anything on Earth. And you have neither friend nor helper except God.
hil: You cannot frustrate anything on earth, and you have neither friend nor helper except God.
compare: You can't thwart anything on Earth. And you have neither friend nor helper except God.

src: "Aber jetzt erst! Wo du dich doch zuvor widersetztest und zu den Unheilstiftern gehörtest?
ref: "Yes, now" (was the answer), "though before this you were disobedient and rebellious.
draft: But now at last! Where previously you resisted and belonged to the troublemakers?
hil: But now at last! Where previously you resisted and belonged to the troublemakers?
compare: But now at last! Where previously you resisted and belonged to the troublemakers?

src: Und euch wird nur für das vergolten, was ihr zu tun pflegtet,
ref: And be rewarded but only for what you had done,
draft: And you will only be rewarded for what you used to do.
hil: You shall be recompensed according to your deeds.
compare: You shall be recompensed according to your deeds.

src: Du bist aber nur ein Warner.
ref: (Muhammad), you are only a warner.
draft: You are only a Warner.
hil: You are but only a Warner.
compare: You are only a Warner.

src: Sag: Wollt ihr mit uns über Allah streiten, wo Er doch unser und euer Herr ist?
ref: Say: "Why do you dispute with us about God when He is equally your Lord and our Lord?
draft: Say: Do you want to argue with us about Allah, when He is our Lord and your Lord?
hil: Say: contend ye with us regarding Allah, whereas He is our Lord even as He is Your Lord? Unto us our works, and unto you your works, and we are His devotees.
compare: Say: Do you want to argue with us about Allah, when He is our Lord and your Lord?

src: Und derjenige (Mann) aus Ägypten, der ihn gekauft hatte, sagte zu seiner Frau: "Nimm ihn freundlich auf.
ref: The Egyptian who bought him instructed his wife: "House him honourably.
draft: And the (man) from Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Receive him kindly.
hil: And he that bought him from Egypt said to his wife, 'Give him goodly lodging, it may be that he will profit us or we may take him for our own son.'
compare: And the (man) from Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Receive him kindly.

src: So richte dein Antlitz in aufrichtiger Weise auf den Glauben; (dies entspricht) der natürlichen Veranlagung, mit der Allah die Menschen geschaffen hat.
ref: So keep yourself exclusively on the true way, the creational law of God according to which He created man with the quality of choosing right or wrong.
draft: So turn your face sincerely towards faith; (this corresponds to) the natural disposition with which Allah has created people."
hil: O believers, turn your faces in sincere devotion towards faith; this is the natural disposition which Allah has instilled in people.
compare: O believers, turn your faces in sincere devotion towards faith; this is the natural disposition which Allah has instilled in people.

src: Hast du nicht jene gesehen, denen ein Teil der Schrift gegeben wurde?
ref: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture?
draft: Have you not seen those to whom a portion of the Scripture was given?
hil: Have you not seen those to whom a portion of the Scripture was given?
compare: Have you not seen those to whom a portion of the Scripture was given?

src: Und jedesmal wenn du den Quran rezitiert hast, errichteten WIR zwischen dir und denjenigen, die keinen Iman an das Jenseits verinnerlichen, einen unsichtbaren Vorhang.
ref: When you recite the Qur'an, We place a hidden veil between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter;
draft: And every time you recited the Quran, we erected an invisible barrier between you and those who do not internalize faith in the hereafter.
hil: And every time you recited the Quran, we erected an invisible barrier between you and those who do not internalize faith in the hereafter.
compare: And every time you recited the Quran, we erected an invisible barrier between you and those who do not internalize faith in the hereafter.

src: Und bitte um Vergebung für deine Sünde und lobpreise deinen Herrn am Abend und am frühen Morgen.
ref: And ask forgiveness for thy sin, and proclaim the praise of thy Lord at evening and dawn.
draft: And ask for forgiveness for your sin and praise your Lord in the evening and in the early morning.
hil: And pardon them thou, and ask thou forgiveness for them and praise thy Lord in the evening and in the early morning.
compare: And ask for forgiveness for your sin and praise your Lord in the evening and in the early morning.

src: Für diejenigen von euch, die sich von ihren Frauen durch den Rückenspruch scheiden...
ref: Those among you who make their wives unlawful (Az-Zihar) to them by saying to them "You are like my mother's back."
draft: "For those of you who divorce from their wives through the saying of 'I divorce you' behind their backs..."
hil: For those of you who call your wives your mothers and then revoke what they said, they should free a slave before having physical contact with them.
compare: "For those of you who divorce from their wives through the saying of 'I divorce you' behind their backs..."

src: Es wird dir nichts gesagt außer dem, was den Gesandten vor dir gesagt wurde.
ref: Nothing is said to you which had not been said to other apostles before you.
draft: You will not be told anything except what was told to the messengers before you.
hil: You will not be told anything except what was told to the messengers before you.
compare: You will not be told anything except what was told to the messengers before you.

src: Dann trifft ihn das Alter, während er (noch) schwache Nachkommen hat. Nun trifft ihn ein Wirbelsturm mit Feuer, er verbrennt.
ref: But he is afflicted with old age and has weak offspring, and it is hit by a whirlwind containing fire and is burned.
draft: Then old age reaches him while he still has weak offspring. Now a tornado with fire strikes him, he burns.
hil: Then old age reaches him while he still has weak offspring. Now a tornado with fire strikes him, he burns.
compare: Then old age reaches him while he still has weak offspring. Now a tornado with fire strikes him, he burns.

src: Und sie wurden zum Guten des Gesagten rechtgeleitet.
ref: They were guided to purity of speech.
draft: And they were guided to the good of what was said.
hil: And they were guided to the good of what was said.
compare: And they were guided to the good of what was said.

src: Es ist nur eine Ermahnung für die ganze Schöpfung.
ref: It is only a warning for all mankind.
draft: It is just an exhortation for the whole creation.
hil: It is only a reminder for the entire creation.
compare: It is just an exhortation for the whole creation.

src: Und urteile zwischen ihnen nach dem, was Gott herabgesandt hat, und folge nicht ihren Neigungen.
ref: And judge between them according to what God revealed, and do not follow their desires.
draft: And judge between them by what God has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations.
hil: "And judge between them by what God has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations."
compare: And judge between them by what God has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH liebt nicht die Freudenerregten.
ref: God does not like those who exult.
draft: Certainly, Allah does not love those who are elated with joy.
hil: Indeed, Allah does not love those who are elated with joy.
compare: Certainly, Allah does not love those who are elated with joy.

src: Und wenn eine jede Seele, die Unrecht begangen hat, alles besäße, was auf Erden ist, würde sie versuchen, sich damit (von der Strafe) loszukaufen.
ref: And if every one that hath wronged had all that is in the earth, surely he would ransom himself therewith.
draft: And if every soul that has committed injustice possessed everything that is on earth, it would try to redeem itself with it (from punishment).
hil: And if each unjust soul owned everything on earth, it would certainly have given it to redeem itself; and they secretly felt repentant when they saw the punishment, and it has been judged between them with fairness, and they will not be wronged.
compare: And if every soul that has committed injustice possessed everything that is on earth, it would try to redeem itself with it (from punishment).

src: Und auch die in Erfahrung bringe, die heucheln.
ref: And that he might know those who played the hypocrite.
draft: And also find out those who pretend.
hil: And also learn about those who pretend.
compare: And also learn about those who pretend.

src: Und das Wasser begann zu sinken, und die Angelegenheit war entschieden. Und das Schiff kam auf dem Güdyy zur Rast.
ref: Withhold (your rain)." And the water was diminished (made to subside) and the Decree (of Allah) was fulfilled (i.e. the destruction of the people of Nuh (Noah).
draft: And the water began to sink, and the matter was decided. And the ship came to a stop on the Güdyy.
hil: And the water began to sink, and the matter was decided. And the ship came to rest on the Güdyy.
compare: And the water began to sink, and the matter was decided. And the ship came to rest on the Güdyy.

src: Er ist es, Der in Seiner Barmherzigkeit die Winde als frohe Botschaft schickt, bis daß Wir sie, wenn sie eine schwere Wolke tragen, zu einem toten Ort treiben; dann lassen Wir Wasser aus ihr herab, mit dem Wir Früchte von jeglicher Art hervorbringen. So bringen Wir auch die Toten hervor, auf daß ihr dessen eingedenk sein möget.
ref: And it is He Who sends the winds giving glad tidings, ahead of His mercy; until when they come bearing heavy clouds, We drove it towards a city devoid of vegetation, and then rained water upon it, then produced fruits of various kinds from it; this is how We will bring forth the dead, so that you may heed advice.
draft: He is the one who, in his mercy, sends the winds as glad tidings until we drive them to a dead place when they carry a heavy cloud; then We let water descend from it, with which We bring forth fruits of every kind. Thus, We also bring forth the dead so that you may remember.
hil: He is the One who sends the winds as glad tidings by His mercy until We drive them to a dead place when they carry a heavy cloud; then We let water descend from it, with which We bring forth fruits of every kind. Thus We also bring forth the dead so that you may remember.
compare: He is the one who, in his mercy, sends the winds as glad tidings until we drive them to a dead place when they carry a heavy cloud; then We let water descend from it, with which We bring forth fruits of every kind. Thus, We also bring forth the dead so that you may remember.

src: Gewiß, sie sind ein Volk von Frevlern."
ref: They are certainly a rebellious people."
draft: Certainly, they are a people of sinners.
hil: "Certainly, they are a people of sinners."
compare: Certainly, they are a people of sinners.

src: Gewiß, WIR haben dir die Schrift mit der Wahrheit hinabgesandt, damit du zwischen den Menschen richtest mit dem, was ALLAH dir erklärt hat.
ref: Surely We have sent down to thee the Book with the truth, so that thou mayest judge between the people by that God has shown thee.
draft: Certainly, we have sent down to you the scripture with the truth so that you may judge between people by what Allah has shown you.
hil: Certainly, We have sent down to you the scripture with the truth so that you may judge between people by what Allah has explained to you.
compare: Certainly, We have sent down to you the scripture with the truth so that you may judge between people by what Allah has explained to you.

src: Dafür werdet ihr dann Uns gegenüber keinen Rächer für euch finden.
ref: Then you will not find any avenger against Us.
draft: For this, you will not find any avenger for yourself against us.
hil: Then you will not find any avenger for yourselves against us.
compare: Then you will not find any avenger for yourselves against us.

src: Und es gibt keinen unter euch, der nicht dahin wie zur Tränke gehen würde?
ref: There is not one among you who will not reach it.
draft: And there is none among you who would not go there as if to a drink?
hil: And there is none among you who wouldn't go there as if drinking?
compare: And there is none among you who wouldn't go there as if drinking?

src: Dann wird Er euch eure Sünden vergeben und euch eingehen lassen in Gärten, unter denen Bäche fließen, und in angenehme Wohnungen in den Gärten von Eden. Das ist der großartige Erfolg.
ref: He will forgive you your sins and admit you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, and superb dwellings in everlasting Gardens of Eden; this is the greatest success.
draft: Then He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and to beautiful dwellings in the gardens of Eden. That is the great success.
hil: Then He will forgive your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, and to pleasant dwellings in the gardens of Eden. That is the great success.
compare: Then He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and to beautiful dwellings in the gardens of Eden. That is the great success.

src: Da zogen sie beide weiter, bis, als sie dann zu den Bewohnern einer Stadt kamen, sie ihre Bewohner um etwas zu essen baten; diese aber weigerten sich, sie gastlich aufzunehmen. Da fanden sie in ihr eine Mauer, die einzustürzen drohte, und so richtete er sie auf. Er (Musa) sagte: "Wenn du wolltest, hättest du dafür wahrlich Lohn nehmen können."
ref: So they both set out again; until they came to the people of a dwelling – they asked its people for food – they refused to invite them – then in the village they both found a wall about to collapse, and the chosen bondman straightened it; said Moosa, “If you wished, you could have taken some wages for it!”
draft: They both continued on until they came to the inhabitants of a town and asked them for food, but they refused to accommodate them hospitably. Then they found a wall in the town which was about to collapse, and he (Musa) set it up straight. He said, "If you had wished, you could certainly have taken a wage for that."
hil: They continued on until they came to the inhabitants of a town and asked them for food, but they refused to accommodate them hospitably. Then they found a wall in the town which was about to collapse, and he (Musa) set it up straight. He said, 'If you had wished, you could certainly have taken a wage for that.'
compare: They both continued on until they came to the inhabitants of a town and asked them for food, but they refused to accommodate them hospitably. Then they found a wall in the town which was about to collapse, and he (Musa) set it up straight. He said, "If you had wished, you could certainly have taken a wage for that."

src: Dann werden diese ihnen die Rede erwidern: "Gewiß, ihr seid zweifelsohne Lügner."
ref: They will fling back at them the saying, 'Surely, you are truly liars.'
draft: Then they will answer them: "Certainly, you are undoubtedly liars."
hil: Then those people will reply to them, 'Surely, you are undoubtedly liars.'
compare: Then they will answer them: "Certainly, you are undoubtedly liars."

src: Ist es denn für die Menschen verwunderlich, daß Wir einem Mann von ihnen (als Offenbarung) eingegeben haben: "Warne die Menschen und verkünde denen, die glauben, die frohe Botschaft, daß sie bei ihrem Herrn einen wahrhaftigen Stand haben"? Die Ungläubigen sagen: "Das ist wahrlich ein deutlicher Zauberer.3"
ref: Are people amazed that We have sent to a man among them, the divine revelation that “Warn the people and convey glad tidings to the believers that for them with their Lord is the place* of truth”? The disbelievers say, “Indeed he is an open magician.” (* Positions of honour on the Day of Resurrection or in heaven.)
draft: Is it surprising for people that We have revealed to a man from among them, "Warn the people and give good news to those who believe that they have a true rank with their Lord"?" The unbelievers say, "This is clearly a magician."
hil: Is it surprising for people that We have revealed to a man from among them, 'Warn the people and give glad tidings to those who believe that they have a true rank with their Lord'?' The disbelievers say, 'This is clearly a magician.'
compare: Is it surprising for people that We have revealed to a man from among them, "Warn the people and give good news to those who believe that they have a true rank with their Lord"?" The unbelievers say, "This is clearly a magician."

src: Allah weiß besser über ihren Glauben Bescheid. Wenn ihr sie dann als gläubig erkennt, dann schickt sie nicht zu den Ungläubigen zurück.
ref: When believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them, Allah knows best as to their Faith, then if you ascertain that they are true believers, send them not back to the disbelievers, they are not lawful (wives) for the disbelievers nor are the disbelievers lawful (husbands) for them.
draft: Allah knows better about their faith. If you then recognize them as believers, do not send them back to the unbelievers.
hil: Oh ye who believe, when believing individuals come to you, test them. Allah knows best about their faith. If you then recognize them as believers, do not send them back to the unbelievers.
compare: Allah knows better about their faith. If you then recognize them as believers, do not send them back to the unbelievers.

src: ALLAH erlegt einer Seele nichts auf, außer was sie vermag. Ihr gebührt, was sie erworben, und ihr obliegt, was sie sich angeeignet hat.
ref: Allah does not burden anyone, except with something within its capacity; beneficial for it is the virtue it earned, and harmful for it is the evil it earned; “Our Lord!
draft: ALLAH does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear. It shall have the rewards it has earned, and it shall be responsible for the consequences of its deeds.
hil: ALLAH does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear. It shall receive what it has earned, and it shall be responsible for what it has gained.
compare: ALLAH does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear. It shall have the rewards it has earned, and it shall be responsible for the consequences of its deeds.

src: ER sagte: "Du wirst Mich nicht sehen!
ref: "You cannot behold Me," He said.
draft: He said: "You will not see me!"
hil: He said, "You cannot behold Me!"
compare: He said: "You will not see me!"

src: Er sprach: "O Noah, er gehört nicht zu deiner Familie; siehe, dies ist kein rechtschaffenes Benehmen. So frage Mich nicht nach dem, von dem du keine Kenntnis hast.
ref: He said: "O Nuh (Noah)! Surely, he is not of your family; verily, his work is unrighteous, so ask not of Me that of which you have no knowledge!
draft: He said: "O Noah, he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] conduct was other than righteous. So do not ask Me about that of which you have no knowledge.
hil: He said: "O Noah, he does not belong to your family; behold, this is not righteous behavior. Do not question Me about something which you have no knowledge. I warn you lest you become like an ignorant man."
compare: He said: "O Noah, he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] conduct was other than righteous. So do not ask Me about that of which you have no knowledge.

src: Auch hat Er die Herdentiere erschaffen.
ref: And the cattle! He hath created them.
draft: Also, He created the herding animals.
hil: He created the herding animals, for which He has shown mercy.
compare: Also, He created the herding animals.

src: Er sagte zu seinen Angehörigen: "Bleibt hier.
ref: "Wait here," he said to his family; "I have seen a fire.
draft: He said to his relatives: "Stay here."
hil: He told his relatives, "Stay here."
compare: He said to his relatives: "Stay here."

src: Und wir erklärten den Tag des Gerichtes für Lüge,
ref: And rejected the Day of Judgement as a lie
draft: And we declared the Day of Judgment to be a lie.
hil: We have denied the Day of Judgment as a lie.
compare: And we declared the Day of Judgment to be a lie.

src: Und gewähre ihnen Einblick, denn sie werden den Einblick haben.
ref: And wait; they will come to know soon.
draft: And grant them insight, for they will have the insight.
hil: Grant them insight, for they will possess the insight.
compare: Grant them insight, for they will possess the insight.

src: Dem das Königreich der Himmel und der Erde gehört; und Allah ist Zeuge von allem.
ref: Whose kingdom spreads over the heavens and the earth. God is witness over everything.
draft: "To whom belongs the kingdom of heaven and earth; and Allah is witness to everything."
hil: To Him only belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is a witness over all things.
compare: To Him only belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is a witness over all things.

src: Sie möchten gern die Worte Gottes abändern. Sprich: «Ihr dürft uns nicht folgen.
ref: They want to change God's word, but tell them, "You shall not follow us.
draft: They would like to modify the words of God. Say: "You must not follow us."
hil: They would like to modify the words of God. Say, 'You must not follow us.'
compare: They would like to modify the words of God. Say: "You must not follow us."

src: Sag: "Wie seht ihr eure beigesellten Partner, an die ihr anstelle von ALLAH Bittgebete richtet? Zeigt mir, was sie von der Erde erschufen!
ref: Proclaim, “Just show me your partners (false deities) whom you worship other than Allah; show me which part of the earth have they created – or do they have any share in the heavens?”
draft: Say: "How do you see your associated partners, to whom you direct supplications instead of Allah? Show me what they created from the earth!
hil: Say: "How do you view your associated partners to whom you direct supplications instead of Allah? Show me what they created from the earth!"
compare: Say: "How do you view your associated partners to whom you direct supplications instead of Allah? Show me what they created from the earth!"

src: Dann erretten WIR Unsere Gesandten und diejenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben. Solcherart obliegt es Uns, die Mumin zu erretten.
ref: Then We shall save Our Noble Messengers and the believers – this is it; it is incumbent upon Our mercy to save the Muslims.
draft: Then we shall save our messengers and those who have internalized the faith. Thus, it is upon us to save the believers.
hil: Then we save our messengers and those who have internalized faith. Thus, it is upon us to save the believers.
compare: Then we shall save our messengers and those who have internalized the faith. Thus, it is upon us to save the believers.

src: Allah ist mit den Standhaften.
ref: Truly! Allah is with As-Sabirin (the patient ones, etc.).
draft: Allah is with the steadfast.
hil: God is with those who are determined.
compare: Allah is with the steadfast.

src: Die die Engel abberufen, während sie gute (Menschen) gewesen sind.
ref: Those whom the angels cause to die (when they are) good.
draft: "The angels are recalled, while they have been good (people)".
hil: "The angels do not recall those who have been good (people)."
compare: "The angels are recalled, while they have been good (people)".

src: Und wer von euch krank ist oder an seinem Haupt ein Leiden hat, der soll Ersatz leisten durch Fasten, Mildtätigkeit oder Darbringen eines Schlachtopfers.
ref: But if you are sick or have ailment of the scalp (preventing the shaving of hair), then offer expiation by fasting or else giving alms or a sacrificial offering.
draft: And whoever among you is sick or has suffering in his head, let him make up for it by fasting, giving charity or offering a sacrifice.
hil: Whoever among you are sick or have ailment of the scalp (preventing shaving of hair), shall offer expiation by fasting, giving charity or offering a sacrificial animal.
compare: And whoever among you is sick or has suffering in his head, let him make up for it by fasting, giving charity or offering a sacrifice.

src: O die ihr glaubt, wenn ihr gläubige Frauen heiratet und euch hierauf von ihnen scheidet, bevor ihr sie berührt habt, dann dürft ihr für sie keine von euch berechnete Wartezeit aussetzen; gewährt ihnen eine Abfindung und gebt sie auf schöne Weise frei.
ref: O you who believe, when you marry believing women then divorce them before having (sexual) contact with them, you have no right to demand observance of the 'waiting period' of them. But provide suitably for them, and let them go with honour.
draft: O you who believe, if you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, you have no right to delay them an appointed term, so give them a gift and release them in a graceful way.
hil: O you who have believed, if you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, you have no right to delay them an appointed term, so give them a gift and release them in a graceful way.
compare: O you who believe, if you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, you have no right to delay them an appointed term, so give them a gift and release them in a graceful way.

src: Sag: "Wie seht ihr es? Wenn ALLAH mich und diejenigen mit mir zugrunde richtet oder Gnade erweist, wer gewährt den Kafir einen Schutz vor einer qualvollen Peinigung?"
ref: Say: "Just think: If God destroys me and those with me, or is benevolent to us, who will then protect the unbelievers from a painful doom?"
draft: Say: "How do you see it? If ALLAH destroys me and those with me or shows mercy, who will protect the Kafir from a painful punishment?"
hil: Say: 'Have you ever considered, if Allah were to destroy me and those with me or extend mercy, who would grant the infidels protection from a painful punishment?'
compare: Say: 'Have you ever considered, if Allah were to destroy me and those with me or extend mercy, who would grant the infidels protection from a painful punishment?'

src: Es ist die Gemeinschaft eures Vaters Ibrahim. ER nannte euch Muslime vorher und in diesem (Quran), damit der Gesandte Zeuge über euch wird und ihr Zeugen über die Menschen werdet.
ref: He hath named you Muslims of old time and in this (Scripture), that the messenger may be a witness against you, and that ye may be witnesses against mankind. So establish worship, pay the poor-due, and hold fast to Allah.
draft: It is the community of your father Ibrahim. He named you Muslims before and in this (Quran), so that the Messenger may bear witness over you and you may bear witness over the people.
hil: It is the community of your father Ibrahim. He appointed you a midmost nation that you might be witnesses to the people, and that the Messenger might be a witness to you. He named you Muslims before and in this (Quran), that We might know who followed the Messenger from who turned on his heels, though it were a grave thing save for those whom God has guided. And God would never leave your faith to waste – truly, God is with the people, All-compassionate.
compare: It is the community of your father Ibrahim. He appointed you a midmost nation that you might be witnesses to the people, and that the Messenger might be a witness to you. He named you Muslims before and in this (Quran), that We might know who followed the Messenger from who turned on his heels, though it were a grave thing save for those whom God has guided. And God would never leave your faith to waste – truly, God is with the people, All-compassionate.

src: Den Herrn von Mose und Aaron.»
ref: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
draft: "To Mr. Moses and Aaron."
hil: "To Mr. Moses and Aaron."
compare: "To Mr. Moses and Aaron."

src: Und sie sagten: "Was ist los mit diesem Gesandten, er ißt die Speisen und geht zu den Märkten, würde zu ihm doch ein Engel herabgesandt, damit er mit ihm einWarner wird!
ref: But they say: "What sort of prophet is this who eats food and walks the market places? Why was no angel sent to him to act as admonisher with him?
draft: And they said, "What's wrong with this messenger, he eats the food and goes to the markets, if only an angel were sent down to him, so he could be a warner with him!
hil: "They said, \"What's wrong with this messenger, he eats the food and goes to the markets, if only an angel were sent down to him, so he could be a warner with him!\""
compare: And they said, "What's wrong with this messenger, he eats the food and goes to the markets, if only an angel were sent down to him, so he could be a warner with him!

src: Er ist es, Der euch bei Nacht abberuft und weiß, was ihr bei Tag begangen habt, und euch hierauf an ihm auferweckt, damit eine festgesetzte Frist erfüllt wird.
ref: It is He indeed who sends you to death at night, and knows what you do in the day, then makes you rise with it again in order that the fixed term of life be fulfilled.
draft: He is the one who calls you at night and knows what you have done during the day, and then awakens you to fulfill a set term.
hil: He is the one who calls you at night and knows what you have done during the day, and then awakens you to fulfill a set term.
compare: He is the one who calls you at night and knows what you have done during the day, and then awakens you to fulfill a set term.

src: Und hütet ja eure Eide. So macht euch Allah Seine Zeichen klar, auf daß ihr dankbar sein möget.
ref: So God makes clear to you His signs; haply you will be thankful.
draft: And guard your oaths. Thus Allah makes His signs clear to you, that you may be grateful.
hil: And guard your oaths. Then Allah helps you to strength and provides you with good things, so that you may be grateful.
compare: And guard your oaths. Thus Allah makes His signs clear to you, that you may be grateful.

src: Sie sagten: "Verbrennt ihn und helft euren Göttern, wenn ihr etwas tun wollt."
ref: They said: "Burn him, and save your gods, if you are men of action."
draft: They said, "Burn him and help your gods if you want to do something."
hil: They said, 'Burn him and help your gods if you want to do something.'
compare: They said, "Burn him and help your gods if you want to do something."

src: Gewiß, ALLAH bleibt immer allwissend, allkundig.
ref: Indeed Allah is Ever All-Knower, Well-Acquainted with all things.
draft: Certainly, ALLAH always remains omniscient, all-knowing.
hil: Verily, ALLAH remains all-knowing, of everything knower.
compare: Certainly, ALLAH always remains omniscient, all-knowing.

src: Ihr werdet (noch) erfahren, über wen eine Strafe kommen wird, die ihn in Schande stürzt, und wer ein Lügner ist.
ref: You will come to know who it is on whom descends the torment that will cover him with ignominy, and who is a liar!
draft: You will (still) learn who will receive a punishment that will cause him to fall into disgrace, and who is a liar.
hil: You will (still) learn who will be punished and fall into disgrace, and who is a liar.
compare: You will (still) learn who will receive a punishment that will cause him to fall into disgrace, and who is a liar.

src: Aber diejenigen, die böse Taten begehen und danach bereuen und glauben-, gewiß, dein Herr ist danach wahrlich Allvergebend und Barmherzig.
ref: Yet those who do wrong, then repent and believe, are forgiven, for your Lord is forgiving and kind.
draft: But those who commit evil deeds and then repent and believe - surely, your Lord is thereafter truly forgiving and merciful.
hil: But those who commit evil deeds and then repent and believe - Surely, your Lord is thereafter truly forgiving and merciful.
compare: But those who commit evil deeds and then repent and believe - surely, your Lord is thereafter truly forgiving and merciful.

src: Sie sind doch nicht ihre Mütter. Ihre Mütter sind die, die sie geboren haben.
ref: Their mothers are none else but those who gave birth to them.
draft: You are not their mothers. Their mothers are the ones who gave birth to them.
hil: Those are not their mothers. Their mothers are the ones who gave birth to them.
compare: You are not their mothers. Their mothers are the ones who gave birth to them.

src: Als ob sie wohlverwahrte Eier wären.
ref: Like sheltered eggs in a nest.
draft: As if they were well-guarded eggs.
hil: As if they were well-guarded eggs.
compare: As if they were well-guarded eggs.

src: Reisende kamen vorbei. Sie sandten ihren Wasserschöpfer, und er ließ seinen Eimer hinunter.
ref: A caravan happened to pass, and sent the water-carrier to bring water from the well.
draft: Travelers passed by. They sent down their water dipper and he lowered his bucket.
hil: Travelers passed by. They sent down their water dipper and lowered their bucket.
compare: Travelers passed by. They sent down their water dipper and lowered their bucket.

src: Er ist zweifelsohne dieWahrheit von unserem HERRN! Wir waren doch vor ihm Muslime."
ref: Indeed even before it we have been from those who submit themselves to Allah in Islam as Muslims (like 'Abdullah bin Salam and Salman Al-Farisi, etc.).
draft: He is undoubtedly the truth of our Lord! We were Muslims before him.
hil: Undoubtedly, He is the truth from our Lord! We were Muslims before him.
compare: He is undoubtedly the truth of our Lord! We were Muslims before him.

src: 'Ain-sin-qaf.
ref: 'Am Sin Qaf.
draft: Ain-sin-qaf.
hil: "Ain-sin-qaf."
compare: Ain-sin-qaf.

src: Und Wir wollen euch sicherlich prüfen, bis Wir diejenigen von euch ausscheiden, die kämpfen und standhaft sind.
ref: We shall certainly test you until We know those who strive hard for the cause of God and those who exercise patience.
draft: And We certainly test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient. (
hil: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.
compare: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.

src: ALLAH gewährt viel Rizq, wem ER will, und läßt es wenig sein.
ref: God outspreads and straitens His provision unto whomsoever He will.
draft: ALLAH grants much Rizq to whom HE wills, and makes it little.
hil: Verily, Allah increases or restricts the provision of any of His creatures as He wills and spares whom He wills. And whatsoever is spent, He recompenses it.
compare: Verily, Allah increases or restricts the provision of any of His creatures as He wills and spares whom He wills. And whatsoever is spent, He recompenses it.

src: Du brichst das Versprechen nicht.»
ref: Verily Thou failest not the tryst.
draft: "You do not break the promise."
hil: You do not break the promise.
compare: "You do not break the promise."

src: Und diejenigen, die weder neben ALLAH an einen anderen Gott Bittgebete richten, noch den Menschen töten, den ALLAH für haram erklärte, außer mit Berechtigung, noch Zina begehen.
ref: And those who call not unto anot her god along with Allah and slay not any soul which Allah hath forbidden, save in justification, and commit not fornication.
draft: And those who do not make supplication with Allah to any other god, nor kill a person that Allah has declared inviolable, except with due cause, nor commit adultery.
hil: And those who do not direct supplication to any other god alongside Allah, neither kill a person whom Allah has forbidden, except with due cause, nor commit adultery.
compare: And those who do not direct supplication to any other god alongside Allah, neither kill a person whom Allah has forbidden, except with due cause, nor commit adultery.

src: (Sei nicht traurig,) denn du kannst nicht die Toten hören lassen noch die Tauben den Ruf hören lassen, wenn sie den Rücken kehren.
ref: You cannot make the dead to listen nor the deaf hear the call when they have turned back and retreated,
draft: (Do not be sad,) because you cannot make the dead hear or make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs.
hil: (Don't be sad), because you can't make the dead hear or make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs.
compare: (Do not be sad,) because you cannot make the dead hear or make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs.

src: Diese sind die Weggenossen des Feuers. Darin werden sie ewig sein.
ref: Those are the dwellers of the Fire, and they will abide therein forever.
draft: These are the companions of fire. Therein they will be eternal.
hil: These are the companions of fire, where they will be eternal.
compare: These are the companions of fire. Therein they will be eternal.

src: Darum führe uns unter den Bezeugenden auf."
ref: Enroll us among the witnesses."
draft: "Therefore lead us among the witnesses."
hil: Therefore lead us among the witnesses.
compare: Therefore lead us among the witnesses.

src: Also lasse uns das zuteil werden, wovor du uns warnst, solltest du von den Wahrhaftigen sein."
ref: If so, bring on us what you threaten us with, if what you say is true."
draft: "Also let us have what you warn us against, should you be from the truthful."
hil: "Let us also experience what you warn us of, if you are one of the truthful."
compare: "Let us also experience what you warn us of, if you are one of the truthful."

src: O Prophet, mühe dich gegen die Ungläubigen und Heuchler ab und sei hart gegen sie! Ihr Zufluchtsort wird die Hölle sein - ein schlimmer Ausgang!
ref: O Herald of the Hidden! Fight against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be stern with them; and their destination hell; and what an evil place to return!
draft: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and hypocrites and be firm against them! Their refuge will be Hell - a wretched destination.
hil: O Prophet, struggle with the unbelievers and hypocrites, and be harsh with them! Their refuge will be Gehenna -- an evil homecoming!
compare: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and hypocrites and be firm against them! Their refuge will be Hell - a wretched destination.

src: Es sind Finsternisse, die einen über den anderen, wenn er seine Hand ausstreckt, beinahe sieht er sie nicht.
ref: If you stretch your hand, you could hardly see it.
draft: There are eclipses, one above the other, when he reaches out his hand he almost can’t see them.
hil: Layers of darkness upon darkness, one over the other. When he stretches out his hand, he can hardly see them; and for whom Allah provides no light, there is no light.
compare: Layers of darkness upon darkness, one over the other. When he stretches out his hand, he can hardly see them; and for whom Allah provides no light, there is no light.

src: Darin bleiben sie ewig, wie die Himmel und die Erde (des Jenseits) bleiben - außer was dein HERR will. Gewiß, dein HERR macht, was ER will.
ref: Remaining in it as long as the heavens and the earth remain, except as much as your Lord willed*; indeed your Lord may do whatever, whenever, He wills. (* Remaining forever even after the heavens and the earth are destroyed.)
draft: "They shall abide therein forever, as the heavens and the earth (of the Hereafter) abide, except as your Lord wills. Verily, your Lord is Doer of what He wills."
hil: They shall abide therein forever, as the heavens and the earth (of the Hereafter) abide, except as your Lord wills. Verily, your Lord does what He wills.
compare: "They shall abide therein forever, as the heavens and the earth (of the Hereafter) abide, except as your Lord wills. Verily, your Lord is Doer of what He wills."

src: Zwei Männer von denjenigen, die Ehrfurcht haben und denen ALLAH von Seinen Gaben gewährte, sagten: "Tretet zu ihnen durch das Tor ein! Und wenn ihr es durchschritten habt, werdet ihr dann doch Sieger sein.
ref: Two men of those who feared, but whom God had blessed, said, “Go at them by the gate; and when you have entered it, you will prevail.
draft: Two men from among those who have awe (of God) and whom Allah has graced said, "Enter upon them through the gate. And when you have entered it, you will indeed be victorious.
hil: Two men from among those who have awe (of God) and whom Allah has graced said, 'Enter through the portal to them! And when you have entered it, you will indeed be victorious.'
compare: Two men from among those who have awe (of God) and whom Allah has graced said, 'Enter through the portal to them! And when you have entered it, you will indeed be victorious.'

src: Am Tag, da Allah sie alle auferweckt, da werden sie Ihm schwören, wie sie euch schwören, und meinen, sie hätten eine Grundlage.
ref: On the day that God will raise them together, they will swear before Him as they swear before you, and imagine they are on the right path.
draft: On the day when Allah resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they have a basis.
hil: On the day when God will resurrect them all together, they will swear to Him as they swore to you and they will think that they have a good case but they are certainly liars.
compare: On the day when Allah resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they have a basis.

src: Aber trefft nicht heimlich eine Abmachung mit ihnen, außer ihr sagt geziemende Worte.
ref: And do not consummate the marriage until the term prescribed is fulfilled.
draft: But do not secretly make an agreement with them unless you speak appropriate words.
hil: But do not promise them secretly unless you speak kind words.
compare: But do not secretly make an agreement with them unless you speak appropriate words.

src: Dann wurde er ein Blutklumpen; dann bildete und vervollkommnete Er (ihn)
ref: Then formed into an embryo? Then He fashioned, shaped and proportioned
draft: Then he became a blood clot; then He formed and perfected him.
hil: Then he became a lump of blood; then He formed and perfected him.
compare: Then he became a lump of blood; then He formed and perfected him.

src: Um undankbar zu sein für das, was Wir ihnen zukommen ließen. So genießet nur.
ref: That they may show ingratitude for that which We have vouchsafed unto them.
draft: To be ungrateful for what We have bestowed upon them. So just enjoy.
hil: To be ungrateful for what We have given them. So just enjoy.
compare: To be ungrateful for what We have given them. So just enjoy.

src: Wissen sie denn nicht, daß Allah die Versorgung großzügig gewährt, wem Er will, und auch bemißt?
ref: Do they not know that God enhances or restricts the provision of any one He will.
draft: Do you not know that Allah generously grants provision to whom He wills, and also measures it?
hil: Do you not know that Allah generously grants provision to whom He wills, and also measures it?
compare: Do you not know that Allah generously grants provision to whom He wills, and also measures it?

src: Und ALLAH gegenüber sollen die Mumin Tawakkul üben!
ref: And in God let the believers put their trust.
draft: And the believers shall exercise Tawakkul towards Allah!
hil: And towards Allah should the believers exercise Tawakkul!
compare: And the believers shall exercise Tawakkul towards Allah!

src: Und erwähne in der Schrift Isma'il! Gewiß, er war wahrhaftig im Versprechen und war ein Gesandter, ein Prophet.
ref: And remember Ismail in the Book; he was indeed true to his promise and was a Noble Messenger, a Prophet.
