compare: These are the companions of fire, they will abide therein forever.

src: Dabei lesen sie (alle) das Buch. Auch diejenigen, die unwissend sind, äußern sich in der gleichen Weise.
ref: So too the ignorant say the like of them.
draft: They (all) read the book. Even those who are ignorant express themselves in the same way.
hil: They (all) read the book. Even those who are unaware express themselves in the same way.
compare: They (all) read the book. Even those who are unaware express themselves in the same way.

src: Und wer sich Satan statt Allah zum Beschützer nimmt, der hat sicherlich einen offenkundigen Verlust erlitten
ref: He who holds Satan as friend in place of God will assuredly be damned to perdition.
draft: And whoever takes Satan instead of Allah as a protector has certainly suffered a clear loss.
hil: And whoever takes Satan instead of Allah as a protector, he certainly has suffered a clear loss.
compare: And whoever takes Satan instead of Allah as a protector has certainly suffered a clear loss.

src: Sie versuchten ihn in bezug auf seine Gäste zu überreden.
ref: And they indeed sought to shame his guest (by asking to commit sodomy with them).
draft: They tried to persuade him with regards to his guests.
hil: They tried to persuade him with regard to his guests.
compare: They tried to persuade him with regard to his guests.

src: Und sagte: «Ich bin krank.»
ref: And said: "I am sick (of what you worship)!"
draft: And said: "I am sick."
hil: "And said: \"I am sick.\""
compare: And said: "I am sick."

src: Gewiß, wir kehren zu unserem HERRN zurück,
ref: We shall return to our Lord.
draft: Sure, we return to our LORD,
hil: Certainly, we are returning to our LORD.
compare: Certainly, we are returning to our LORD.

src: Aber sie ziehen ihn der Lüge.
ref: But they denounced him as a liar.
draft: But they accuse him of lying.
hil: But they denounce him of lying.
compare: But they accuse him of lying.

src: Und sie leisten wissentlich falsche Eide.
ref: And they swear to a lie while they know.
draft: And they knowingly make false oaths.
hil: And knowingly they swear falsely.
compare: And they knowingly make false oaths.

src: Diejenigen aber, die glauben und gute Werke tun, werden die Bewohner des Paradieses sein. Darin werden sie ewig bleiben.
ref: But those who believe and do good deeds are people of Paradise, and shall live there forever.
draft: But those who believe and do good deeds will be the inhabitants of paradise. Therein they will remain forever.
hil: As for those who believe and do good, We never burden a soul beyond capacity. They are men of Paradise where they will abide forever.
compare: But those who believe and do good deeds will be the inhabitants of paradise. Therein they will remain forever.

src: ALLAH ist Derjenige, Der für euch das Meer gratis fügbar machte, damit die Schiffe darauf nach Seiner Anweisung fahren, damit ihr von Seiner Gunst anstrebt und damit ihr euch dankbar erweist.
ref: It is God who subjugated the ocean for you so that ships may ply through it by His command, and you may seek His bounty, and may haply be grateful.
draft: ALLAH is the One Who made the sea freely available to you so that the ships may sail upon it according to His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and be grateful.
hil: ALLAH is the One who subdued the sea for you so that ships may sail on it according to His command. This is so that you may strive for His bounty and show gratitude.
compare: ALLAH is the One Who made the sea freely available to you so that the ships may sail upon it according to His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and be grateful.

src: Aber gegen sie wird Allah dir genügen.
ref: So Allah will suffice you against them.
draft: But Allah will be sufficient for you against them.
hil: But Allah will be sufficient for you against them.
compare: But Allah will be sufficient for you against them.

src: Sag: "Entsinnt ihr euch nicht?!"
ref: Say: "Then why do you not bethink yourselves?"
draft: Say: "Don't you remember?!"
hil: Say, "Don't you remember?"
compare: Say: "Don't you remember?!"

src: Außer deinen auserwählten Dienern unter ihnen.»
ref: Except the chosen ones among Your creatures."
draft: "Besides your chosen servants among them."
hil: Except for your chosen servants among them.
compare: Except for your chosen servants among them.

src: Doch verkünde den Geduldigen eine frohe Botschaft
ref: But give good news to the steadfast.
draft: But proclaim a happy message to the patient.
hil: But announce a glad tiding to those who patiently endure.
compare: But announce a glad tiding to those who patiently endure.

src: ER sagte: "Geh! Wer dir von ihnen folgt, dann ist Dschahannam gewiß eure Vergeltung - eine ausreichende Vergeltung!
ref: He said, “Be gone – therefore whoever among them follows you – so hell is the recompense for you all, a sufficient punishment.”
draft: He said, "Go! Whoever follows you from them, then surely Hell is your recompense - and a sufficient recompense it is!"
hil: He said, 'Go! Whoever follows you from them, then surely Hell is your recompense - and a sufficient recompense it is!'
compare: He said, "Go! Whoever follows you from them, then surely Hell is your recompense - and a sufficient recompense it is!"

src: Und sie gesellten ALLAH einen Teil von dem bei, was ER an Äckern und An'am erschuf, und sagten: "Dies gehört ALLAH - ihrer Behauptung nach - und dies gehört den von uns beigesellten Partnern." Und was den von ihnen beigesellten Partnern gehört, erreicht ALLAH nicht, aber was ALLAH gehört, dies erreicht die von ihnen beigesellten Partner.
ref: They allocate a share from God's own created fields and cattle to God, and they say: "This is God's" -- or so they think -- "and that, of the compeers of God," so that what belongs to the compeers does not reach God, but that which is God's may reach the compeers (set up by them).
draft: And they attributed to ALLAH a portion of what He created of crops and livestock, and said, "This is for ALLAH," - according to their claim - "and this is for our partners [associated with Him]." But what is for their partners does not reach Allah, while what is for Allah - this reaches their partners.
hil: And they assigned to Allah a portion of what he created of crops and livestock and said, 'This belongs to Allah' - according to their claim - 'and this belongs to our partners who are associated with Him.' And what belongs to their partners will not reach Allah, but what belongs to Allah will reach the partners they associate with Him.
compare: And they attributed to ALLAH a portion of what He created of crops and livestock, and said, "This is for ALLAH," - according to their claim - "and this is for our partners [associated with Him]." But what is for their partners does not reach Allah, while what is for Allah - this reaches their partners.

src: ALLAH ermahnt euch, daß ihr jemals Gleiches wiederholt, solltet ihr Mumin sein.
ref: God counsels you not to do a thing like this, if you are believers.
draft: ALLAH reminds you that if you are a believer, you should never repeat the same mistake again.
hil: O believers, do not repeat the same mistake again, and fear God if you truly believe.
compare: O believers, do not repeat the same mistake again, and fear God if you truly believe.

src: Tritt ein unter Meine Diener,
ref: "Enter then among My votaries,
draft: Enter among My servants,
hil: Enter among My servants,
compare: Enter among My servants,

src: Und in der Nacht.
ref: Or at night.
draft: And in the night.
hil: "And in the night."
compare: And in the night.

src: Den Geduldigen wird ihr Lohn voll erstattet, ohne daß es (viel) gerechnet wird.
ref: Only those who persevere will get their reward measureless."
draft: The patient will be fully reimbursed their reward, without (much) calculation.
hil: The patient will be fully compensated for their reward without much calculation.
compare: The patient will be fully compensated for their reward without much calculation.

src: Gewiß, er ist doch euer Meister, der euch die Magie lehrte, und ihr werdet es doch noch wissen. Ich werde zweifelsohne eure Füße und eure Hände wechselseitig abtrennen und werde euch gewiß noch allesamt kreuzigen!"
ref: He is indeed your leader who taught you magic; so now you will come to know; I swear, I will certainly cut off your hands and your feet from alternate sides, and crucify all of you.”
draft: "Surely, he is still your master, who taught you magic, and you will still know it. Without a doubt, I will sever your feet and your hands alternately and certainly crucify all of you!"
hil: Surely, he is your master who has taught you magic, and you will surely still remember it. I will undoubtedly sever your feet and your hands alternately and surely crucify all of you!
compare: Surely, he is your master who has taught you magic, and you will surely still remember it. I will undoubtedly sever your feet and your hands alternately and surely crucify all of you!

src: Aber wir werden gewiß, so Gott will, die richtige finden.»
ref: If God wills we shall be guided aright."
draft: But we will certainly, God willing, find the right one.
hil: But we will certainly find the right one, God willing.
compare: But we will certainly, God willing, find the right one.

src: Not und Leid berührten sie, und sie wurden hin und her geschüttelt, so daß der Gesandte und diejenigen, die mit ihm gläubig waren, dann sagten: Wann kommt die Unterstützung Gottes? Wahrlich, die Unterstützung Gottes ist nahe.
ref: Affliction and adversity befell them; and they were shaken until the Messenger, and those who believed with him, said: 'When will the victory of Allah come' Is it not so that the victory of Allah is near.
draft: Distress and suffering touched them, and they were shaken back and forth, so that the envoy and those who believed with him said: When will the help of God come? Verily, the help of God is near.
hil: They were touched by distress and suffering, and were shaken back and forth, so that the envoy and those who believed with him said, "When will the help of God come? Verily, the help of God is near."
compare: Distress and suffering touched them, and they were shaken back and forth, so that the envoy and those who believed with him said: When will the help of God come? Verily, the help of God is near.

src: Sag: Das Wissen darüber ist nur bei Allah. Aber die meisten Menschen wissen nicht.
ref: Say: 'The knowledge of it is only with God, but most men know not.'
draft: Say: The knowledge about it is only with Allah. But most people do not know.
hil: Say: The knowledge about it is only with Allah. But most people do not know.
compare: Say: The knowledge about it is only with Allah. But most people do not know.

src: Und wenn du zehn (Jahre) vervollständigst, dann ist dies dir überlassen. Und ich will es dir nicht schwer machen.
ref: If thou completest ten, that shall be of thy own accord; I do not desire to' press hard 'upon thee.
draft: And when you complete ten (years), then it is up to you. And I don't want to make it difficult for you.
hil: And if you complete ten (years), then it is up to you. And I don't want to make it difficult for you.
compare: And when you complete ten (years), then it is up to you. And I don't want to make it difficult for you.

src: Wenn es unter euch auch nur zwanzig gibt, die standhaft sind, werden sie zweihundert besiegen. Und wenn es unter euch hundert gibt, werden sie tausend von denen, die ungläubig sind, besiegen.
ref: Urge the believers to fight; if there are twenty persevering men among you, they shall overcome two hundred; and if there are a hundred among you, they shall overcome a thousand disbelievers because the disbelievers are a people who do not have sense.
draft: If there are only twenty of you who are steadfast, they will defeat two hundred. And if there are a hundred of you, they shall defeat a thousand of those who are unbelievers.
hil: If there are only twenty of you who are firm, they will vanquish two hundred, and if there are a hundred of you, they will vanquish a thousand of those who are unbelievers.
compare: If there are only twenty of you who are steadfast, they will defeat two hundred. And if there are a hundred of you, they shall defeat a thousand of those who are unbelievers.

src: Er sprach: "So ist es; dein Herr aber spricht: "Es ist Mir ein leichtes, und Ich habe dich zuvor geschaffen, als du ein Nichts warst.""
ref: (The angel) answered: "Thus will it be. Your Lord said: 'This is easy for Me; for when I brought you into being you were nothing.'
draft: He said, "So it is; your Lord, however, says: "It is easy for Me, and I created you before, when you were nothing."
hil: He said, "So it is! Your Lord says: "It is easy for Me, and I created you before when you were nothing'."
compare: He said, "So it is! Your Lord says: "It is easy for Me, and I created you before when you were nothing'."

src: "Gewiß, ihr und das, dem ihr anstatt Allahs dient, seid Brennstoff der Hölle. Ihr werdet dahin hinabgehen."
ref: Verily you and those you worship other than God will be faggots for Hell; and come to it you will.
draft: "Indeed, you and that which you worship other than Allah are (but) firewood for Hell; therein you will go down."
hil: Verily, you and that which you serve instead of Allah are fuel for Hell. You will descend into it.
compare: "Indeed, you and that which you worship other than Allah are (but) firewood for Hell; therein you will go down."

src: Das ist das, was im Jenseits für die Gottesfürchtigen folgt.
ref: Such is the payment of the righteous.
draft: This is what follows in the afterlife for the God-fearing.
hil: This is what follows in the afterlife for the God-fearing.
compare: This is what follows in the afterlife for the God-fearing.

src: Und Pharao und diejenigen, die vor ihm lebten, und die verschwundenen Städte zeigten sündiges Verhallen.
ref: Then came the Pharaoh, and those before him whose habitations were overthrown while they were committing crimes.
draft: And Pharaoh and those who lived before him, and the disappeared cities showed sinful behavior.
hil: "And Pharaoh and those who lived before him, and the vanished cities showed sinful behavior.",
compare: "And Pharaoh and those who lived before him, and the vanished cities showed sinful behavior.",

src: Besitzer von Kraft und beim Herrn des Thrones in Ansehen,
ref: Full of power, well-established (in position) with the Lord and Master of the Throne,
draft: Owner of power and in the eyes of the Lord of Thrones,
hil: Owners of power and in the eyes of the Lord of Thrones in high regard,
compare: Owners of power and in the eyes of the Lord of Thrones in high regard,

src: Und wenn dem Menschen Unglück zustößt, richtet er an Uns Bittgebete im Liegen, im Sitzen oder im Stehen.
ref: When man is afflicted with adversity he calls to Us, whether lying on his side, or sitting or standing.
draft: And when misfortune befalls humans, he directs prayers to Us while lying down, sitting, or standing.
hil: When affliction visits a human, they call upon Us while lying, sitting, or standing.
compare: And when misfortune befalls humans, he directs prayers to Us while lying down, sitting, or standing.

src: Für sie gibt es Strafe im diesseitigen Leben; aber die Strafe des Jenseits ist wahrlich härter. Und sie werden vor Allah keinen Behüter haben.
ref: They will be punished in the life of this world, and indeed the punishment of the Hereafter is the most severe; and there is none to save them from Allah.
draft: For them there is punishment in this life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is truly harsher. And they will have no protector before Allah.
hil: For them there is punishment in this life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is truly harsher. And they will have no guardian before Allah.
compare: For them there is punishment in this life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is truly harsher. And they will have no guardian before Allah.

src: Weiß er denn nicht, wenn der Inhalt der Gräber herausgeworfen wird
ref: Does he not know when the contents of the graves are laid bare
draft: He doesn't know that when the contents of the graves are thrown out.
hil: Doesn't he know that when the contents of the graves are thrown out?
compare: Doesn't he know that when the contents of the graves are thrown out?

src: Er vergibt, wem Er will, und Er bestraft, wen Er will.
ref: He forgiveth whomsoever He will and tormenteth whomsoever He will.
draft: He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills.
hil: He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills.
compare: He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills.

src: Ausgenommen davon sind jene, derer dein Herr Sich erbarmt hat, und dazu hat Er sie erschaffen. Und das Wort deines Herrn ist in Erfüllung gegangen: "Wahrlich, Ich werde Gahannam mit den Ginn und den Menschen insgesamt füllen."
ref: Except those upon whom your Lord had mercy; and this is why He created them; and the Word of your Lord has been concluded that, “Indeed I will, surely, fill hell with jinns and men combined.”
draft: Excluded from this are those whom your Lord has had mercy on, and to this end, He has created them. And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled: "Surely, I will fill Gehenna with jinn and all people."
hil: Excluded from this are those whom your Lord has had mercy on and to this end, He has created them. And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled that I will fill Gehenna with jinn and men together.
compare: Excluded from this are those whom your Lord has had mercy on and to this end, He has created them. And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled that I will fill Gehenna with jinn and men together.

src: O ihr, die ihr glaubt, wenn ihr Allah fürchtet, wird Er euch Entscheidungskraft gewähren und eure Übel von euch nehmen und euch vergeben; und Allah ist voll großer Huld.
ref: O believers, if you follow the path shown by God, He will give you a standard (of right and wrong), and overlook your sins, and forgive you. God is abounding in benevolence.
draft: O you who believe, if you fear Allah, He will grant you discernment and remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you; and Allah is full of great bounty.
hil: O you who believe, if you fear Allah, He will grant you decision-making power, remove your misfortunes from you, and forgive you; and Allah is full of great mercy.
compare: O you who believe, if you fear Allah, He will grant you discernment and remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you; and Allah is full of great bounty.

src: Und er setzte es ihnen vor.
ref: He set it before them.
draft: And he presented it to them.
hil: And he presented it to them.
compare: And he presented it to them.

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Ibrahim von seinem HERRN mit Worten geprüft wurde, und er sie dann einhielt. ER sagte: "Gewiß, ICH mache dich zum Imam für die Menschen."
ref: Remember, when his Lord tried Abraham by a number of commands which he fulfilled, God said to him: "I will make you a leader among men."
draft: And (remember) when Ibrahim was tested by his Lord with words, and he fulfilled them. He said: "Certainly, I make you an Imam for the people."
hil: And (remember) when Ibrahim was tested by his Lord with words, and he fulfilled them. He said: 'Certainly, I make you an Imam for the people.'
compare: And (remember) when Ibrahim was tested by his Lord with words, and he fulfilled them. He said: "Certainly, I make you an Imam for the people."

src: Mein HERR schenke mir von den gottgefällig Guttuenden."
ref: (And he prayed:) "O Lord, grant me a righteous son."
draft: "My Lord, grant me of the God-pleasing goodness."
hil: My LORD! Grant me of the God-pleasing goodness. YOU have given me dominion and taught me the interpretation of dreams - YOU, the Creator of the heavens and the earth - YOU are my Protector in this world and in the Hereafter. Let me die submitting to YOU, and place me among the upright.
compare: "My Lord, grant me of the God-pleasing goodness."

src: Er sagte: "Gewiß, ich bin der Gesandte des Herrn der Weltenbewohner."
ref: He said: "I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds."
draft: He said, "Certainly, I am the messenger of the Lord of the Inhabitants of the Worlds."
hil: "He said, 'I have been sent by the Lord of the Inhabitants of the Worlds.'"
compare: "He said, 'I have been sent by the Lord of the Inhabitants of the Worlds.'"

src: Nun - und beim Schreibrohr und bei dem, was sie nie derschreiben!
ref: NUN. I CALL to witness the pen and what they inscribe,
draft: Now - and at the writing tube and at the things they never write!
hil: Now - and with the writing tube and with what they never write!
compare: Now - and with the writing tube and with what they never write!

src: Wir aber sehen sie nahe.
ref: But We see it very near.
draft: We, however, see them up close.
hil: But we see them up close.
compare: But we see them up close.

src: Ich habe doch davor ein Leben lang unter euch verweilt.
ref: (Remember that I am one of you) and have lived a whole life with you before (its revelation).
draft: I have lived among you my entire life before.
hil: I have previously lived among you my entire life.
compare: I have lived among you my entire life before.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Zweifelsohne eignen sich viele von den Rabbinern und Priestern Vermögenswerte von Menschen durch das für nichtig Erklärte an und halten vom Weg ALLAHs ab.
ref: O believers, many rabbis and priests devour the possessions of others wrongfully, and keep men away from the path of God.
draft: You who have internalized the Imam! Without a doubt, many of the rabbis and priests appropriate people's assets through the annulment and keep them from the way of Allah.
hil: Believers! Do not take those who appropriate people's assets through the annulment and keep them from the way of Allah, from many of the rabbis and priests, as friends.
compare: You who have internalized the Imam! Without a doubt, many of the rabbis and priests appropriate people's assets through the annulment and keep them from the way of Allah.

src: Und als Unsere Gesandten zu Lut kamen, geriet er ihretwegen in eine böse Lage und war durch ihre Anwesenheit beklommen.
ref: And when Our Messengers came to Lout (Lot), he was grieved on their account and felt himself straitened for them (lest the town people should approach them to commit sodomy with them).
draft: And when our messengers came to Lot, he was troubled on their account and felt restrained by their presence.
hil: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was troubled on their account and felt restrained by their presence.
compare: And when our messengers came to Lot, he was troubled on their account and felt restrained by their presence.

src: ER war Derjenige, Der dich mit Seinem Sieg und mit den Mumin gestärkt hat.
ref: It is He who has strengthened you with His help and with believers
draft: He was the one who strengthened you with his victory and with the believers.
hil: He was the One who strengthened you with His victory and with the believers, just as Allah strengthens with His help whomever He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.
compare: He was the One who strengthened you with His victory and with the believers, just as Allah strengthens with His help whomever He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.

src: Bestimmt ist für sie eine gewaltige Pein,
ref: For them is great suffering.
draft: Certainly for them, it is a tremendous pain.
hil: A tremendous torment is determined for them,
compare: Certainly for them, it is a tremendous pain.

src: Als Abraham sagte: «Mein Herr, mache dieses Gebiet sicher, und laß mich und meine Söhne es meiden, den Götzen zu dienen.
ref: Remember when Abraham prayed: "O Lord, make this a city of peace, and preserve me and my progeny from worshipping idols:
draft: When Abraham said, "My Lord, make this land safe and keep me and my sons away from serving idols."
hil: When Abraham said, 'My Lord, make this land safe and keep me and my sons away from serving idols.'
compare: When Abraham said, "My Lord, make this land safe and keep me and my sons away from serving idols."

src: Diese haben eine höhere Rangstufe als die, die erst nachher gespendet und gekämpft haben.
ref: They are higher in position than those who spent after (the victory) and fought.
draft: These have a higher rank than those who only donated and fought afterwards.
hil: These have a higher rank than those who only donated and fought afterwards.
compare: These have a higher rank than those who only donated and fought afterwards.

src: Und wenn gegen euch tatsächlich gekämpft wird, werden wir euch ganz gewiß helfen."
ref: If you are fought against, we will help you.'
draft: "And if you are actually fought against, we will certainly help you."
hil: "And if you are actually fought against, we will certainly help you."
compare: "And if you are actually fought against, we will certainly help you."

src: Sag: "Seht ihr, woran ihr anstelle von ALLAH Bitt-gebete richtet, sollte ALLAH mir Schädigendes wollen, könnten sie das Schädigende von Ihm wegnehmen? Oder sollte ER mir eine Gnade wollen, könnten diese Seine Gnade zurückhalten?"
ref: Say: "Then just think. Can those whom you worship apart from God remove the distress God is pleased to visit upon me, or withhold a blessing God is pleased to favour me with?'
draft: Say: "Do you see what instead of Allah you invoke? If Allah should intend me harm, can they remove His harm? Or if He should intend me mercy, can they withhold His mercy?"
hil: Say: 'Do you see what instead of Allah you invoke? If Allah should intend me harm, can they remove His harm? Or if He should intend me mercy, can they withhold His mercy?'
compare: Say: "Do you see what instead of Allah you invoke? If Allah should intend me harm, can they remove His harm? Or if He should intend me mercy, can they withhold His mercy?"

src: Sie sagen: «Ja doch.
ref: They will say, “Yes indeed, why not?”
draft: They say: "Yes indeed."
hil: They say, 'Yes indeed.'
compare: They say, 'Yes indeed.'

src: ALLAH setzte keinem Mann zwei Herzen in seinem Innern ein. Und ER machte eure Ehefrauen, denen ihr (die Formel von) Zihar aussprecht, nicht zu euren Müttern. Ebenfalls machte ER die nach euch Genannten nicht zu euren Söhnen. Dies ist euer Wort aus euren Mündern. Und ALLAH sagt dasWahre und ER leitet zum wahren Weg recht.
ref: Allah has not kept two hearts in the body of any man; nor has He made them your mothers those wives of yours, whom you declare to be your mothers; nor has He made them your sons, whom you have adopted; this is the statement of your mouths; and Allah proclaims the truth and it is He Who shows the path.
draft: ALLAH did not place two hearts within any man. And HE did not make your wives, whom you divorce by Zihar, to be your mothers. Similarly, HE did not make those who are called your descendants to be your sons. This is merely a statement that comes out of your mouth. And ALLAH speaks the truth and HE guides to the right path.
hil: ALLAH did not put two hearts in any man's inner being. And HE did not make your wives, to whom you speak the formula of Zihar, to be your mothers, nor did HE make those who are named after you to be your sons. This is merely a statement that comes out of your mouths. And ALLAH speaks the truth and HE guides to the right path.
compare: ALLAH did not place two hearts within any man. And HE did not make your wives, whom you divorce by Zihar, to be your mothers. Similarly, HE did not make those who are called your descendants to be your sons. This is merely a statement that comes out of your mouth. And ALLAH speaks the truth and HE guides to the right path.

src: Die vor einem jagenden Löwen fliehen?
ref: Fleeing from a lion?
draft: Flee from a lion hunting in front of them?
hil: "Flee from a lion hunting in front of them?"
compare: "Flee from a lion hunting in front of them?"

src: Ich habe ihnen nichts anderes gesagt als das, was Du mir befohlen hast, nämlich: >Dienet Gott, meinem Herrn und eurem Herrn. < Ich war Zeuge über sie, solange ich unter ihnen weilte. Als Du mich abberufen hast, warst Du der Wächter über sie. Und Du bist über alle Dinge Zeuge.
ref: “I have not told them except what You commanded me, that ‘Worship Allah, Who is my Lord and is also your Lord’; I was aware of them till I was among them; and when You raised me, only You watched over them; and all things are present before You.”
draft: I have told them nothing other than what you ordered me, namely: > Serve God, my Lord and your Lord. < I was a witness over them as long as I dwelt among them. When you recalled me, you were the watcher over them. And you are a witness over all things.
hil: I have said nothing to them except what You commanded me, namely, >Serve God, my Lord and your Lord.< I was a witness over them as long as I dwelt among them. When You recalled me, You were the watcher over them. And You are a witness over all things.
compare: I have told them nothing other than what you ordered me, namely: > Serve God, my Lord and your Lord. < I was a witness over them as long as I dwelt among them. When you recalled me, you were the watcher over them. And you are a witness over all things.

src: Immer wieder, wenn eine Umma eingetreten ist, hat sie ihre Vorgängerin verflucht.
ref: Every time a crowd enters, it will curse its sister-crowd.
draft: Again and again, when a new Umma entered, she cursed her predecessor.
hil: Time and time again, when a new Umma has entered, she has cursed her predecessor.
compare: Time and time again, when a new Umma has entered, she has cursed her predecessor.

src: Ihre Herberge wird Gahannam sein, und dies ist ein schlimmes Ende!
ref: Their abode is Hell, an evil destination?
draft: Your hostel will be Gehenna, and this is a terrible end!
hil: Your destination will be Gehenna, and what a wretched end!
compare: Your destination will be Gehenna, and what a wretched end!

src: Alif Lam Mim Ra'. Das sind die Verse des Buches. Und was dir von deinem Herrn hinabgesandt wurde, ist die Wahrheit. Jedoch die meisten Menschen glauben nicht.
ref: Alif-Lam-Meem-Ra*; these are verses of the Book; and that which has been sent down upon you from your Lord is true, but most men do not believe. (* Alphabets of the Arabic language – Allah and to whomever He reveals, know their precise meanings.)
draft: Alif Lam Mim Ra'. These are the verses of the Book. And what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe.
hil: Alif Lam Mim Ra'. These are the verses of the Book. And whatever has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth. However, most people do not believe. And what has been given to you is only consumable of this worldly life and its adornments, but what is with Allah is better and more lasting. Do you not have sense?
compare: Alif Lam Mim Ra'. These are the verses of the Book. And what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe.

src: Also hinsichtlich des Schaums, so wird er beiseite geworfen, doch hinsichtlich dessen, das den Menschen nützt, so verbleibt es in der Erde. Solcherart prägt ALLAH die Gleichnisse.
ref: Thus Allah sets forth parables (for the truth and falsehood, i.e. Belief and disbelief).
draft: Regarding the foam, it is thrown away, but regarding that which benefits people, it remains on the earth. Allah thus presents parables.
hil: Regarding the foam, it is cast away; but as for that which is useful to mankind, it remains on the earth. Thus, Allah illustrates the examples.
compare: Regarding the foam, it is thrown away, but regarding that which benefits people, it remains on the earth. Allah thus presents parables.

src: Und die Thamud, das Volk Lots und die Leute des Waldes.
ref: And the Thamud, the people of Lot, as well as the dwellers of the Wood, had denied.
draft: And the Thamud, the people of Lot, and the people of the forest.
hil: And the Thamud, the people of Lot, and the people of the forest.
compare: And the Thamud, the people of Lot, and the people of the forest.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, und eine Seele soll danach schauen, was sie für morgen vorausschickte!
ref: O ye who believe! fear Allah, and let every soul look to that which it sendeth forward for the morrow.
draft: You who have internalized the Imam! Act according to taqwa towards ALLAH, and then let a soul look at what it sent ahead for tomorrow!
hil: O believers, act with taqwa towards God as taqwa should be acted towards Him, and let a soul then look at what it sent ahead for tomorrow!
compare: O believers, act with taqwa towards God as taqwa should be acted towards Him, and let a soul then look at what it sent ahead for tomorrow!

src: Diejenigen, die ihr Vermögen bei Nacht und Tag, geheim oder offen, spenden, haben ihren Lohn bei ihrem Herrn, sie haben nichts zu befürchten, und sie werden nicht traurig sein.
ref: Those who spend of their wealth in the way of God, day and night, in secret or openly, have their reward with their Lord, and have nothing to fear or regret.
draft: Those who donate their wealth at night and during the day, secretly or openly, have their reward with their Lord, they have nothing to fear, and they will not be saddened.
hil: Those who donate their wealth at night and during the day, secretly or openly, have their reward with their Lord. They have nothing to fear, and they will not be saddened.
compare: Those who donate their wealth at night and during the day, secretly or openly, have their reward with their Lord, they have nothing to fear, and they will not be saddened.

src: Sag: Die Angelegenheit ist ganz und gar (in) Allahs (Entscheidung). Sie halten in ihrem Innersten verborgen, was sie dir nicht offenlegen; sie sagen: "Wenn wir etwas von der Angelegenheit (zu entscheiden) hätten, würden wir hier nicht getötet."
ref: Slumber overtook a party, while another party cared only for themselves, thinking of Allah thoughts that were not true, the guess of ignorance, saying: 'Have we any say in the affair' Say: 'The entire affair belongs to Allah' They conceal in themselves what they do not disclose to you.
draft: Say: The matter is entirely in Allah's (decision). They keep hidden in their hearts what they do not reveal to you; they say: "If we had anything to decide on this matter, we wouldn't be killed here."
hil: Say: The matter is entirely in Allah's (decision). They keep hidden in their hearts what they do not reveal to you; they say: 'If we had anything to decide on this matter, we would not be killed here.'
compare: Say: The matter is entirely in Allah's (decision). They keep hidden in their hearts what they do not reveal to you; they say: "If we had anything to decide on this matter, we wouldn't be killed here."

src: Aber Allah hat (euch) bewahrt.
ref: But Allah saved (you).
draft: But Allah has preserved (you).
hil: But God has preserved you.
compare: But God has preserved you.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Seid nicht wie diejenigen, die Kufr betrieben haben und zu ihren Brüdern sagten, als diese sich auf Handelsreisen oder Feldzügen befanden: "Wären sie bei uns geblieben, wären sie weder gestorben, noch getötet worden." (Sagt es nicht), damit ALLAH dies als Bitterkeit (nur) in ihren Herzen bleiben läßt. Und ALLAH (alleine) macht lebendig und läßt sterben. Und ALLAH ist dessen, was ihr tut, allsehend.
ref: O People who Believe! Do not be like the disbelievers who said regarding their brothers who went on a journey or on holy war, “If they had been here with us they would not have died or been killed” – so that Allah may make it as despair in their hearts; and Allah gives life and causes death; and Allah is seeing your deeds.
draft: You, who have internalized the imam! Do not be like those who have committed disbelief and said to their brothers when they were on journeys or military expeditions, "If they had been with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say it) so that Allah may make it a source of regret in their hearts. Allah alone gives life and causes death. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
hil: Those of you who have established faith! Do not be like those who have committed disbelief and said to their brothers on trade journeys or military expeditions, "If they had been with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say it), so that Allah may not cause it to be a source of regret in their hearts. Allah alone gives life and causes death. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
compare: You, who have internalized the imam! Do not be like those who have committed disbelief and said to their brothers when they were on journeys or military expeditions, "If they had been with us, they would not have died or been killed." (Do not say it) so that Allah may make it a source of regret in their hearts. Allah alone gives life and causes death. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.

src: Und ALLAH kennt das, was ihr verheimlicht und was ihr offenlegt.
ref: God knows what you hide and disclose.
draft: And ALLAH knows what you conceal and what you reveal.
hil: But God knows well what you conceal and what you reveal.
compare: And ALLAH knows what you conceal and what you reveal.

src: Und wer krank oder auf Reisen war, (fastet) an anderen Tagen die gleiche Anzahl. ALLAH will für euch Erleichterung, doch ER will für euch keine Erschwernis.
ref: So whosoever of you witnesseth the month, he shall fast it, and whosoever sick or journeying, for him the like number of other days.
draft: And whoever was sick or on a journey, (shall fast) the same number of days later on. Allah provides ease for you and does not want to make things difficult for you.
hil: And whoever was ill or on a journey, (shall fast) the same number of days later on. Allah intends to provide ease for you and not to make things difficult for you.
compare: And whoever was sick or on a journey, (shall fast) the same number of days later on. Allah provides ease for you and does not want to make things difficult for you.

src: Nun hatten Wir ihm zuvor Ammenbrüste verwehrt.
ref: We made (Moses) refuse a wet nurse.
draft: Now we had previously denied him wet nurses.
hil: Previously, we had denied him wet nurses.
compare: Previously, we had denied him wet nurses.

src: Aber diejenigen, die ihren Herrn fürchten, für sie wird es Obergemächer geben, über denen (andere) Obergemächer gebaut sind, unterhalb derer Flüsse strömen. (Das ist) Allahs Versprechen.
ref: But as for those who are wary of their Lord, for them there will be lofty abodes with [other] lofty abodes built above them, with streams running beneath them—a promise of Allah.
draft: But for those who fear their Lord, there will be upper chambers, above which (other) upper chambers are built, beneath which rivers flow. (This is) Allah's promise.
hil: But for those who fear displeasing their Lord there will be lofty mansions built above mansions, with rivers rippling past below them: a promise of God. God does not back on His promise.
compare: But for those who fear their Lord, there will be upper chambers, above which (other) upper chambers are built, beneath which rivers flow. (This is) Allah's promise.

src: Dann sag: "Wollt ihr denn nicht Taqwa gemäß handeln!"
ref: So tell them: "Why do you not fear Him?"
draft: Then say: "Do you not want to act according to Taqwa!"
hil: Then say: 'Will you not take heed!'
compare: Then say: 'Will you not take heed!'

src: Es ist wie das Gleichnis derjenigen (, die es) nahe vor ihnen (erlebten).
ref: Like those who had tasted the gravity of their actions a little before them.
draft: It is like the parable of those who experienced it close before them.
hil: It is like the semblance of those who experienced it close before them.
compare: It is like the semblance of those who experienced it close before them.

src: Und unterlaßt nicht aus Verdruß, es aufzuschreiben, ob es klein oder groß ist, (um es festzulegen) bis zu seiner Frist. Das ist für euch gerechter bei Gott und richtiger für das Zeugnis und bewirkt eher, daß ihr keine Zweifel hegt.
ref: Unless it be merchandise present that you give and take between you; then it shall be no fault in you if you do not write it down.
draft: And do not refrain from writing it down, out of vexation, whether it is small or large, (to fix it) until its appointed term. This is more just with Allah and makes for more reliable testimony and avoids doubt.
hil: Do not refrain from writing it down, out of vexation, whether it is small or large, to fix it until its appointed term. This is more just with Allah and makes for stronger evidence which avoids doubt.
compare: And do not refrain from writing it down, out of vexation, whether it is small or large, (to fix it) until its appointed term. This is more just with Allah and makes for more reliable testimony and avoids doubt.

src: Das (allein schon) genügt als deutliche Sünde.
ref: And this is a sufficient manifest sin.
draft: That (in itself) is enough as a clear sin.
hil: That alone is already enough as a clear sin.
compare: That alone is already enough as a clear sin.

src: Aber wenn ihr euch von ihnen scheidet, bevor ihr sie berührt und euch ihnen gegenüber schon (zu einer Morgengabe) verpflichtet habt, dann (händigt) die Hälfte dessen (aus), wozu ihr euch verpflichtet habt, es sei denn, daß sie (es) erlassen oder der, in dessen Hand der Ehebund ist. Und wenn ihr (es) erlaßt, kommt das der Gottesfurcht näher. Und versäumt es nicht, gut zueinander zu sein . Was ihr tut, sieht Allah wohl.
ref: If you divorce them before you have touched them and have appointed the bridal money, then payment of half of what is agreed is ordained unless the women forgo some of it, or he in whose hand is the marriage tie, pays more; and O men, your paying more is closer to piety; and do not forget the favours to each other; indeed Allah is seeing what you do.
draft: But if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already agreed to give them a dowry, then give them half of what you have agreed, unless they forgo it or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract forgoes it. And to forego is nearer to righteousness. And do not forget kindness among yourselves. Indeed Allah sees whatever you do.
hil: But if you divorce them before touching them and already having committed to a dowry, then give half of what you have committed, unless they forgo it or the one in whose hand the marriage contract is. And to forgo is closer to piety. And do not neglect to be kind to one another. Allah sees everything that you do.
compare: But if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already agreed to give them a dowry, then give them half of what you have agreed, unless they forgo it or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract forgoes it. And to forego is nearer to righteousness. And do not forget kindness among yourselves. Indeed Allah sees whatever you do.

src: Sag: "Das Schlechte und das Gute sind nicht gleich, selbst dann nicht, solltest du an dem großen Ausmaß des Schlechten Gefallen finden." So handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber - ihr Verständige! -, damit ihr erfolgreich werdet.
ref: Say, “The impure (evil) and the pure (good) are not equal, even though the abundance of the impure may attract you; therefore keep fearing Allah, O men of intellect, so that you may succeed.”
draft: Say: "The bad and the good are not equal, even if you should find pleasure in the magnitude of the bad." This is how Taqwa acts according to ALLAH - you understanding ones! - so that you may be successful.
hil: Say: 'The good and the bad are not the same, even if you find pleasure in the enormity of the bad.' This is how to obey Allah with Taqwa - O believers! - so that you may achieve success.
compare: Say: 'The good and the bad are not the same, even if you find pleasure in the enormity of the bad.' This is how to obey Allah with Taqwa - O believers! - so that you may achieve success.

src: Dann bestimmte ER sie zu sieben Himmeln in zwei Ay-yam, und ließ in jedem Himmel seine Anweisung als Wahy zuteil werden.
ref: Then He completed and finished from their creation (as) seven heavens in two Days and He made in each heaven its affair.
draft: Then HE determined them to seven heavens in two days, and in each heaven, his instruction was granted as Wahy.
hil: "Then HE assigned them to seven heavens in two days and let His instructions be granted as Wahy in each heaven."
compare: Then HE determined them to seven heavens in two days, and in each heaven, his instruction was granted as Wahy.

src: Und dem, der von ihnen sagen wollte: "lch bin ein Gott neben Ihm", würden Wir es mit Gahannam vergelten. Und ebenso vergelten Wir es den Ungerechten.
ref: If any one of them said: "I am God besides Him," We should award him Hell; for this is how We requite the evil-doers.
draft: And for those who would say: "I am a god beside him," we would repay them with Gehenna. And thus we repay the unjust.
hil: "And We would repay with Gehenna whoever said among them, 'I am a deity besides Him'. And We would similarly repay the unjust.",
compare: "And We would repay with Gehenna whoever said among them, 'I am a deity besides Him'. And We would similarly repay the unjust.",

src: Oder haben sie (etwa) Teilhaber?
ref: Or have they any partners?
draft: Or do they have (perhaps) partners?
hil: Do they have (have they) partners?
compare: Or do they have (perhaps) partners?

src: Das ist Frevel. Heute sind diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, an eurer Religion verzweifelt, so fürchtet sie nicht, sondern fürchtet Mich.
ref: Today the unbelievers have despaired of your religion; therefore fear them not, but fear you Me.
draft: This is sacrilege. Today, those who are unbelievers are desperate about your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me.
hil: This is sacrilege. I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. Do not fear those who disbelieve, for today I have perfected your religion for you, and I have completed My blessing upon you, and I have approved Islam for your religion. Therefore, follow not the desires of those who treat Our revelations as lies.
compare: This is sacrilege. Today, those who are unbelievers are desperate about your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me.

src: Nur ein wenig erweist ihr euch dankbar.
ref: How little are the thanks you offer!"
draft: Just a little bit you prove to be grateful.
hil: Only a little bit you show yourselves grateful.
compare: Only a little bit you show yourselves grateful.

src: Sind sie etwa nicht auf Erden umhergezogen, damit sie sehen, wie das Anschließende derjenigen vor ihnen war.
ref: Did they not travel in the land to see what sort of fate befell those before them?
draft: Are they not wandering on Earth so that they can see how those before them fared?
hil: Have they not traveled on earth, so that they can see how the end of those before them was?
compare: Have they not traveled on earth, so that they can see how the end of those before them was?

src: Da kam Allah über sie, von wo sie nicht (damit) rechneten, und jagte in ihre Herzen Schrecken, so daß sie ihre Häuser mit ihren (eigenen) Händen und den Händen der Gläubigen zerstörten.
ref: But God came upon them from where they did not suspect, and filled their hearts with terror, so that they destroyed their homes with their own hands (or were destroyed) by the hands of believers.
draft: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect, and He cast terror into their hearts so they destroyed their homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers.
hil: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect, and cast terror into their hearts so they destroyed their homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers.
compare: Then Allah came upon them from where they did not expect, and cast terror into their hearts so they destroyed their homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers.

src: Und Wir ließen sie in Unsere Barmherzigkeit eingehen; denn sie gehörten zu den Rechtschaffenen.
ref: And they were admitted to Our grace. Verily they were among the doers of good.
draft: And We let them enter into Our mercy; for they were among the righteous.
hil: And they were included in Our mercy because they belonged to the righteous.
compare: And We let them enter into Our mercy; for they were among the righteous.

src: Das Urteil ist allein Allahs.
ref: Authority belongs to God alone.
draft: "The judgment is solely Allah's."
hil: "The verdict belongs only to God."
compare: "The judgment is solely Allah's."

src: Und du hattest nicht erwartet, daß das Buch an dich gerichtet würde.
ref: (O Prophet), you never looked forward for the Book to be revealed to you.
draft: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.
hil: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.
compare: And you had not expected that the book would be addressed to you.

src: Das ist ein Versprechen Gottes. Gott bricht sein Versprechen nicht. Aber die meisten Menschen wissen nicht Bescheid.
ref: The promise of Allah; Allah does not renege on His promise, but most people do not know.
draft: This is a promise from God. God does not break His promises. But most people do not know.
hil: This is a promise from God. God does not break his promise. But most people do not know.
compare: This is a promise from God. God does not break His promises. But most people do not know.

src: Schau, wie Wir die Zeichen verschiedenartig darlegen!
ref: Behold how We turn about the signs!
draft: Look how we present the signs differently!
hil: See how we present the signs differently!
compare: Look how we present the signs differently!

src: Den Gottesfürchtigen obliegt nicht die Verantwortung für jene, sondern nur das Ermahnen, auf daß jene gottesfürchtig werden mögen.
ref: As for the heedful and devout, they are not accountable for them, but should give advice: They may haply come to fear God.
draft: The responsibility for those does not lie with the God-fearing, but only the admonition, so that they may become God-fearing.
hil: The God-fearing are not responsible for those, but only for admonishing so that they may become God-fearing.
compare: The God-fearing are not responsible for those, but only for admonishing so that they may become God-fearing.

src: Das ist besser für euch und lauterer. Wenn ihr aber nicht (die Möglichkeit dazu) findet, dann ist Allah wahrlich All verzeihend, Barmherzig.
ref: When you wish to humbly consult with the Noble Messenger, give some charity before you consult; that is much better and much purer for you; so if you do not have the means, then (know that) Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.
draft: This is better for you and purer. If you do not find (the possibility to do so), then Allah is truly All-Forgiving, Merciful.
hil: That is better and purer for you. But if you cannot find (the opportunity to do so), then Allah is truly All-Forgiving, Merciful.
compare: That is better and purer for you. But if you cannot find (the opportunity to do so), then Allah is truly All-Forgiving, Merciful.

src: Die Ungläubigen geben wahrlich ihr Vermögen (dafür) aus, um von Allahs Weg abzuhalten.
ref: Those who disbelieve spend their possessions on turning men away from God.
draft: The unbelievers truly spend their wealth (for it) to prevent (others) from the way of Allah.
hil: The unbelievers truly spend their wealth to prevent people from the way of Allah.
compare: The unbelievers truly spend their wealth to prevent people from the way of Allah.

src: Es gibt keine Gottheit außer Ihm. Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Too holy is He for what they ascribe to Him!
draft: There is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above what they associate with Him [in worship].
hil: There is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above what they associate with Him [in worship].
compare: There is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above what they associate with Him [in worship].

src: Ihr macht ja daraus Papyrusblätter, die ihr offen zeigt - und ihr haltet vieles geheim; und euch wurde beigebracht, was ihr nicht wußtet, weder ihr noch eure Väter. Sprich: Gott.
ref: Some of it ye disclose and much thereof ye conceal. And ye were taught that which ye knew not: neither ye nor your fathers.
draft: You make papyrus leaves out of it, which you show openly - and you keep much secret; and you were taught what you did not know, neither you nor your fathers. Say: God.
hil: You show much openly, but also keep much hidden. And you were taught what you did not know, neither you, nor your forefathers. Say: God.
compare: You make papyrus leaves out of it, which you show openly - and you keep much secret; and you were taught what you did not know, neither you nor your fathers. Say: God.

src: Und darin sollen die Konkurrierenden konkurrieren,
ref: So for this let the competitors compete.
draft: And therein the competitors should compete.
hil: And therein shall the competitors compete,
compare: And therein shall the competitors compete,

src: Und es gibt nichts, dessen Schatzkammern nicht bei Uns wären.
ref: And there is not a thing, but with Us are the stores thereof.
draft: And there is nothing whose treasuries are not with Us.
hil: There is nothing whose treasures are not with Us.
compare: There is nothing whose treasures are not with Us.

src: Und WIR haben dich über sie nicht als Hüter eingesetzt und du bist über sie kein Wakil.
ref: We have not appointed you their guardian, nor are you their pleader.
draft: And WE have not appointed you as a guardian over them, nor are you a representative over them.
hil: And WE have not appointed you as a guardian over them, nor are you a representative over them.
compare: And WE have not appointed you as a guardian over them, nor are you a representative over them.

src: Vergib mir und schenke mir eine Herrschaft, die niemandem nach mir möglich wird. Gewiß, DU bist Der reichlich Schenkende."
ref: Forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom, which shall not befit anyone after me; indeed only You are the Great Bestower.”
draft: "Forgive me and grant me a sovereignty that will not be possible for anyone after me. Indeed, YOU are the most abundant giver."
hil: Forgive me and grant me a sovereignty that will not be possible for anyone after me. Indeed, YOU are the bountiful giver.
compare: "Forgive me and grant me a sovereignty that will not be possible for anyone after me. Indeed, YOU are the most abundant giver."

src: Das Ende von beiden war, daß sie nun im Feuer sind; darin werden sie ewig weilen. Und das ist die Vergeltung für die, die Unrecht tun.
ref: So the fate of them both is that they are both in the fire, to remain in it forever; and this is the proper punishment for the unjust.
draft: The end of both was that they are now in the fire; therein they will dwell forever. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.
hil: The end of both was that they are now in the fire; therein they will dwell forever. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.
compare: The end of both was that they are now in the fire; therein they will dwell forever. And that is the recompense for those who do wrong.

src: Und nachdem sie von da weiterzogen, sagte er seinem Dienstjungen: "Bereite uns unser Mittagessen, gewiß, bereits haben wir auf dieser unserer Reise große Mühe gehabt.
ref: When they had gone past (the confluence), Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."
draft: And after they moved on from there, he said to his servant, "Prepare us our lunch, surely we have had great trouble on this journey of ours."
hil: And after they moved on from there, he said to his servant, 'Prepare us our lunch, surely we have had great trouble on this journey of ours.'
compare: And after they moved on from there, he said to his servant, 'Prepare us our lunch, surely we have had great trouble on this journey of ours.'

src: Den Gläubigen ist dies verboten.
ref: This is forbidden the believers,
draft: "The believers are prohibited from this."
hil: This is forbidden for the believers.
compare: "The believers are prohibited from this."

src: O mein Volk, seht ihr, wie ich euch zur Rettung rufe, ihr mich aber zum (Höllen)feuer ruft?
ref: O my people, what is wrong with me that I am calling you to preservation, while you invite me to the Fire!
draft: O my people, do you see how I call you for salvation, but you call me to (hell)fire?
hil: O my people, do you see how I call you for salvation, but you call me to (hell)fire?
compare: O my people, do you see how I call you for salvation, but you call me to (hell)fire?

src: Doch schön geduldig sein. Vielleicht wird Allah sie mir alle wiederbringen; denn Er ist der Allwissende, der Allweise."
ref: "You have made up the story; but patience is best; God may bring them back to me. He is all-knowing and all-wise."
draft: But be patiently beautiful. Perhaps Allah will bring them all back to me; for He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.
hil: "But be beautifully patient. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me; for He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise."
compare: "But be beautifully patient. Maybe Allah will bring them all back to me; for He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise."

src: Sollen wir wirklich, wenn wir gestorben und zu Staub geworden sind...? Das ist doch eine Rückkehr von weiter Entfernung.»
ref: When we are dead and turned to dust, this returning (to life) is most far-fetched."
draft: "Should we really, when we have died and turned to dust...? That is a return from far away."
hil: Should we really, when we have died and turned to dust...? That's a return from is impossible!”.
compare: "Should we really, when we have died and turned to dust...? That is a return from far away."

src: Meine Leute! Handelt euren Standpunkten entsprechend, auch ich handle. Ihr werdet noch wissen, wen Peinigung überkommt, welche ihn erniedrigt, und wer Lügner ist. Wartet nur ab! Ich warte ebenfalls mit euch ab."
ref: “And O my people! Keep on with your works in your positions, I am doing mine; very soon you will come to know – upon whom comes the punishment that will disgrace him, and who is the liar; and wait – I too am waiting with you.”
draft: "My people! Act according to your convictions, as do I. You will know who will be punished, who will be humiliated, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am also waiting with you."
hil: My people! Act according to your beliefs, just like I do. You will soon find out who will be punished, who will be humiliated, and who is a liar. Just wait and see! I am also waiting with you.
compare: "My people! Act according to your convictions, as do I. You will know who will be punished, who will be humiliated, and who is a liar. Just wait! I am also waiting with you."

src: Als sie vorbeigegangen waren, sagte er zu seinem Burschen: "Bringe uns unser Mittagessen. Wir haben ja durch diese unsere Reise (viel) Mühsal erlitten."
ref: So when they had gone beyond that place, Moosa said to his assistant, “Bring our breakfast – we have indeed faced great exertion in this journey of ours.”
draft: After they had passed by, he said to his servant, "Bring us our lunch. We have endured a lot of hardship on this journey."
hil: "After they had passed by, he said to his servant, \"Bring us our lunch. We have suffered much hardship on this journey.\""
compare: "After they had passed by, he said to his servant, \"Bring us our lunch. We have suffered much hardship on this journey.\""

src: Also sag: "Das Verborgene kennt nur ALLAH, so wartet ab!
ref: Tell them: "Unknown things are only known to God.
draft: Also say: "Only ALLAH knows the hidden, so wait!"
hil: So say: 'The hidden is only for Allah, therefore wait.'
compare: So say: 'The hidden is only for Allah, therefore wait.'

src: Und erinnert euch an das, was in euren Wohnstätten von ALLAHs Ayat und der Weisheit vorgetragen wird. Gewiß, ALLAH ist immer allgütig, allkundig.
ref: And remember that which is recited in your houses of the signs of God and the Wisdom; God is All-subtle, All-aware.
draft: And remember what is recited in your homes of Allah's verses and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Kind and Acquainted [with all things].
hil: And remember what is recited in your homes of Allah's verses and wisdom. Allah knows well what lies within the hearts. Indeed, Allah is always kind and All-Knowing.
compare: And remember what is recited in your homes of Allah's verses and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Kind and Acquainted [with all things].

src: Sag: "Mein HERR kennt das Gesagte im Himmel und auf Erden.
ref: He said: "My Lord knows whatever is spoken in the heavens and the earth.
draft: Say, "My Lord knows what is said in Heaven and on Earth."
hil: Say: verily, my Lord knows what is said in the heavens and on earth.
compare: Say: verily, my Lord knows what is said in the heavens and on earth.

src: Ist es denn Unsere Strafe, die sie beschleunigen wollen?
ref: Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?
draft: Is it then our punishment that they want to accelerate?
hil: Is it then Our punishment that they want to accelerate?
compare: Is it then Our punishment that they want to accelerate?

src: Auch wenn sie den Weg der Rechtschaffenheit erkennen, folgen sie ihm nicht als (ihren) Weg, doch wenn sie den Weg des Fehlgehens erkennen, folgen sie ihm als (ihren) Weg, dies weil sie Unsere Ayat verleugnen und ihnen gegenüber achtlos zu sein pflegten.
ref: This is so for they have called Our messages lies, and have been heedless of them."
draft: Even if they recognize the path of righteousness, they do not follow it as their path, but if they recognize the path of wrongdoing, they follow it as their own path, because they deny Our signs and used to be heedless towards them.
hil: Even if they recognize the path of righteousness, they do not follow it as their own, but when they recognize the path of error, they follow it as their own, because they deny Our signs and used to be indifferent towards them.
compare: Even if they recognize the path of righteousness, they do not follow it as their own, but when they recognize the path of error, they follow it as their own, because they deny Our signs and used to be indifferent towards them.

src: Und er hält nicht aus Geiz das (ihm offenbarte) Verborgene zurück.
ref: He is not chary of making public what is unknown.
draft: And he does not withhold the (revealed) secret out of greed.
hil: And he does not withhold the (revealed) secret out of greed.
compare: And he does not withhold the (revealed) secret out of greed.

src: Wenn diese dann dicke Regenwolken trugen, lassen WIR ihn (den Regen) zu einer toten Landschaft treiben, dann lassen WIR darauf das Wasser herab. Und damit lassen WIR von den verschiedenen Früchten sprießen.
ref: Then, when they have gathered up heavy clouds, We drive them to a dead land, where We make water come down, and with it We bring out all kinds of fruits.
draft: When they then carried thick rain clouds, we let it (the rain) drift into a dead landscape, then we let the water fall onto it. And so we let various fruits sprout.
hil: When they then carried thick rain clouds, we let it (the rain) drift into a dead landscape, then we let the water fall onto it. And thus we make different fruits grow.
compare: When they then carried thick rain clouds, we let it (the rain) drift into a dead landscape, then we let the water fall onto it. And so we let various fruits sprout.

src: Und an ALLAH werden die Angelegenheiten gewandt.
ref: To God all matters revert.
draft: And the affairs are turned to Allah.
hil: And to Allah are all affairs referred for decision.
compare: And to Allah are all affairs referred for decision.

src: Und sie folgten dem, was die Satane unter der Herrschaft Salomos vortrugen.
ref: They followed what the Shayatin (devils) gave out (falsely of the magic) in the lifetime of Sulaiman (Solomon).
draft: And they followed what the demons presented under the rule of Solomon.
hil: And they followed what the demons presented during the reign of Solomon.
compare: And they followed what the demons presented during the reign of Solomon.

src: Und Wir werden ihnen ihren Anteil fürwahr unverringert zukommen lassen.
ref: We shall verily give them their meed without diminution.
draft: And we will surely give them their share without any decrease.
hil: And for all of them, We have appointed their heirs – from whatever the parents and nearest relatives leave behind. To those with whom you have made an agreement, give them their dues without any decrease. Indeed, all things are present before Allah.
compare: And we will surely give them their share without any decrease.

src: Seid nicht wie diejenigen, die Musa verleumdeten, dann erklärte ihn ALLAH von dem, was sie ihm unterstellten, für unschuldig. Und er war bei ALLAH hochgeschätzt.
ref: Do not be like the people who troubled Moosa – so Allah freed him from the allegations they had uttered; and Moosa is honourable in the sight of Allah.
draft: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly appreciated by Allah.
hil: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly esteemed by Allah.
compare: Do not be like those who slandered Musa, then Allah declared him innocent of what they accused him of. And he was highly appreciated by Allah.

src: Sodann lasse sie mit ihren schweifenden Gesprächen ihr Spiel treiben.
ref: Say: "God," and leave them to the sport of engaging in vain discourse.
draft: Then let her play her game with her meandering conversations.
hil: Then let her play her game with her meandering conversations.
compare: Then let her play her game with her meandering conversations.

src: Die Gänge der Himmel, daß ich zum Gott des Mose emporsteige.
ref: to the heavens and be able to climb up to the Lord of Moses.
draft: "The paths of the heavens, that I ascend to the God of Moses."
hil: "The paths of heaven, so that I ascend to the God of Moses."
compare: "The paths of heaven, so that I ascend to the God of Moses."

src: Und ich war ihr Zeuge, solange ich unter ihnen weilte, doch nachdem Du mich abberufen hattest, bist Du ihr Wächter gewesen; und Du bist der Zeuge aller Dinge.
ref: And so long as I dwelt with them I was witness over their actions. And after my life had been done, You were their keeper; and You are a witness over all things.
draft: And I was their witness as long as I dwelt among them, but after you recalled me, you became their guardian; and you are the witness of all things.
hil: "And I was their witness as long as I dwelt among them, but after You recalled me, You became their guardian; and You are the witness of all things."
compare: And I was their witness as long as I dwelt among them, but after you recalled me, you became their guardian; and you are the witness of all things.

src: Sie sagte: "HERR! Wie kann ich einen Sohn haben, wo kein Mann mich jemals intim berührt hat."
ref: She said: "How can I have a son, O Lord, when no man has touched me?"
draft: She said: "LORD! How can I have a son, when no man has ever touched me intimately."
hil: She said, 'Lord! How can I have a son, when no man has ever touched me intimately.'
compare: She said, 'Lord! How can I have a son, when no man has ever touched me intimately.'

src: Ich folge doch nur dem, was mir an Wahy zuteil wird."
ref: I only follow what is revealed to me.'
draft: "I only follow what is revealed to me"
hil: I only follow what is revealed to me
compare: I only follow what is revealed to me

src: Ihm gebührt die wahre Anrufung. Diejenigen, die sie an seiner Stelle anrufen, erhören sie in keinem Anliegen.
ref: For Him (Alone) is the Word of Truth (i.e. none has the right to be worshipped but He).
draft: He deserves the true invocation. Those who call on behalf of him do not hear it in any concern.
hil: True invocation is to Him exclusively. Those who invoke others beside Him hear them not at all.
compare: True invocation is to Him exclusively. Those who invoke others beside Him hear them not at all.

src: Die Bitte Abrahams um Vergebung für seinen Vater erfolgte nur aufgrund eines Versprechens, das er ihm gegeben hatte. Als es ihm aber deutlich wurde, daß er ein Feind Gottes war, sagte er sich von ihm los. Abraham war voller Trauer und langmütig.
ref: And the seeking of forgiveness for his father (paternal uncle) by Ibrahim was only because of a promise he had made to him; then when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, Ibrahim broke off ties with him; indeed Ibrahim is surely very soft-hearted, most forbearing.
draft: The request of Abraham for forgiveness for his father was only made because of a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that his father was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patience.
hil: Abraham's plea for forgiveness for his father was only made because of a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that his father was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patience.
compare: The request of Abraham for forgiveness for his father was only made because of a promise he had given him. But when it became clear to him that his father was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was full of sorrow and patience.

src: Da erwies Allah uns eine Wohltat und bewahrte uns vor der Strafe des Glutwindes.
ref: But God has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of scorching wind.
draft: Allah granted us a favor and protected us from the punishment of the scorching wind.
hil: Allah showed us a favor and saved us from the punishment of the scorching wind.
compare: Allah showed us a favor and saved us from the punishment of the scorching wind.

src: Es entgeht Ihm nicht das Gewicht eines Stäubchens, weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde. Und es gibt nichts, was kleiner ist als dies oder größer, das nicht in einem deutlichen Buch (verzeichnet) wäre,
ref: Not even an atom's weight in the heavens and the earth, or something smaller or greater than it, is hidden from Him, and which is not recorded in the all-too-manifest Book,
draft: He does not miss the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing smaller than this or greater that would not be recorded in a clear book.
hil: He does not miss the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing smaller or greater than this that would not be recorded in a clear book.
compare: He does not miss the weight of a speck of dust, neither in the heavens nor on the earth. And there is nothing smaller or greater than this that would not be recorded in a clear book.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wenn doch ein Zeichen von seinem Herrn auf ihn herabgesandt würde!" Sag: Das Verborgene ist nur Allahs.
ref: And they say, “Why is not a sign sent down upon him from his Lord?”
draft: And they say, "If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!" Say, "The unseen is only for Allah."
hil: They say, 'If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!' Say, 'The unseen is only for Allah.'
compare: And they say, "If only a sign were sent down to him from his Lord!" Say, "The unseen is only for Allah."

src: Dem vergelten WIR mit Dschahannam.
ref: I am a god beside Him, that one We should repay with hell.
draft: We repay them with Jahannam.
hil: We will repay them with Jahannam.
compare: We will repay them with Jahannam.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Weshalb sagt ihr, was ihr nicht macht?!
ref: O you who believe, why do you profess what you do not practise?
draft: Your, who have internalized the imam! Why do you say what you don't do?!
hil: O you who believe! Why do you say what you do not do?
compare: O you who believe! Why do you say what you do not do?

src: Dann entsprangen daraus zwölf Quellen, bereits kennt jede Gruppe ihre Trinkstelle. Esst und trinkt von ALLAHs Rizq und übertreibt nicht auf Erden als Verderben-Anrichtende!
ref: Then there gushed forth thereout twelve springs; every people already knew their drinking-place; eat and drink of the provision of Allah, and commit not evil on the earth as corrupters.
draft: Then twelve springs emerged from it; each group knew its drinking place. Eat and drink from the provision of Allah and do not act corruptly on the earth as mischief-makers.
hil: Then twelve springs emerged from it; each group knew its drinking place. Eat and enjoy God's gifts, and spread no discord in the land.
compare: Then twelve springs emerged from it; each group knew its drinking place. Eat and drink from the provision of Allah and do not act corruptly on the earth as mischief-makers.

src: Und sollte dich eine Versuchung des Satans (vom Wahren) ablenken, so suche Zuflucht bei ALLAH!
ref: And if an evil whisper comes to you from Shaitan (Satan) then seek refuge with Allah.
draft: And if a temptation from Satan (from the truth) distracts you, seek refuge in ALLAH!
hil: And if you are distracted by a temptation of Satan (from the truth), seek refuge in ALLAH!
compare: And if you are distracted by a temptation of Satan (from the truth), seek refuge in ALLAH!

src: Und sporne die Gläubigen an, vielleicht wird Gott die Schlagkraft derer, die ungläubig sind, zurückhalten. Und Gott besitzt eine noch stärkere Schlagkraft und verhängt eine noch härtere Strafe.
ref: And urge on the believers; haply God will restrain the unbelievers' might; God is stronger in might, more terrible in punishing.
draft: And urge the believers, perhaps God will restrain the power of those who are unbelievers. And God possesses an even greater striking power and imposes an even harsher punishment.
hil: And urge the believers on, perhaps Allah will restrain the power of the disbelievers. And Allah possesses an even greater striking power and imposes even harsher punishment.
compare: And urge the believers on, perhaps Allah will restrain the power of the disbelievers. And Allah possesses an even greater striking power and imposes even harsher punishment.

src: Und gewiß, bereits ließen WIR Musa Wahy zuteil werden: "Brich nachts auf mit Meinen Dienern, dann schlage ihnen einen getrockneten Weg ins Meer! Habe keine Angst vor Verfolgung und fürchte dich nicht!"
ref: And We divinely inspired Moosa that, “Journey with My bondmen in a part of the night and strike a dry path in the sea for them, you shall have no fear of Firaun getting to you, nor any danger.”
draft: And indeed, we have already given Musa Wahy: "Set out at night with My servants and strike for them a dried-up path in the sea! Do not fear persecution and do not be afraid!"
hil: And indeed, we said to Musa: 'Set out with My servants by night and strike for them a dried-up path in the sea! Do not fear persecution and do not be afraid.'
compare: And indeed, we said to Musa: 'Set out with My servants by night and strike for them a dried-up path in the sea! Do not fear persecution and do not be afraid.'

src: Am Tag, da der Geist und die Engel in einer Reihe stehen. Sie werden nicht sprechen, ausgenommen der, dem der Erbarmer es erlaubt und der das Richtige sagt.
ref: Upon the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in ranks they shall speak not, save him to whom the All-merciful has given leave, and who speaks aright.
draft: On the day when the spirit and the angels stand in rows, they will not speak except for him whom the Merciful permits and who speaks the right thing.
hil: On the day when the spirit and the angels stand in rows, they will not speak except for him whom the Merciful permits and who speaks the right thing.
compare: On the day when the spirit and the angels stand in rows, they will not speak except for him whom the Merciful permits and who speaks the right thing.

src: Wenn ihr ALLAH (Seiner Sache) eine Hasan-Anleihe gebt, wird ER euch vervielfachen und euch vergeben. Und ALLAH ist reichlich belohnend, allnachsichtig.
ref: If you lend an excellent loan to Allah, He will double it for you and forgive you; and Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing.
draft: If you give ALLAH (His cause) a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And ALLAH is most appreciative and Forbearing.
hil: Oh believers, if you give Allah a beautiful loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allah is generous in rewarding, forgiving.
compare: If you give ALLAH (His cause) a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And ALLAH is most appreciative and Forbearing.

src: Alles, was in den Himmeln, und alles, was auf Erden ist, preist Allah; und Er ist der Erhabene, der Allweise.
ref: WHATEVER IS IN the heavens and the earth sings the praises of God. He is all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: All that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth glorifies Allah and He is the Exalted, the Wise.
hil: All that is in the heavens and earth glorifies Allah, and He is the Exalted, the Wise.
compare: All that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth glorifies Allah and He is the Exalted, the Wise.

src: Also laß von ihnen und von dem ab, was sie erlügen.
ref: Leave them to their falsehoods.
draft: Also let go of them and what they lie about.
hil: And leave alone from them and from that which they fabricate.
compare: And leave alone from them and from that which they fabricate.

src: Es gibt welche unter den Juden, die Worte aus ihren Stellungen verdrehen und sagen: "Wir hören und wir gehorchen nicht", und "Höre, ohne gehört zu werden", und "Sei uns nachsichtig", indem sie mit ihren Zungen lügen und den Glauben lästern. Und hätten sie gesagt: "Wir hören und wir gehorchen", und "Höre", und "Schaue gnädig auf uns", wäre es besser für sie gewesen und aufrechter. Aber Allah hat sie zur Strafe für ihren Unglauben verflucht; darum glauben sie nur wenig.
ref: Some of the Jews interchange the words from their places and say, “We hear and disobey” – and they say “Hear- may you not be able to hear” – and they say “Raena (Be considerate towards us)” distorting it with their tongues and in order to slander religion; had they said, “We hear and we obey” and “Kindly listen to us, O dear Prophet,” and “Look mercifully upon us, O dear Prophet”, it would have been much better for them and more just – but Allah has cursed them for their disbelief; so they do not believe except a little.
draft: There are among the Jews some who distort words from their [proper] usages and say, "We hear and disobey" and "Hear but be not heard" and "Ra'ina," twisting their tongues and defaming the religion. And if they had said [instead], "We hear and obey" and "Wait for us [to understand]," it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.
hil: Some among the Jews distort the words out of context and say (in place of the right words): 'We hear and do not obey,' and 'Listen without hearing,' and 'Listen to us,' twisting their tongues and reviling the faith. And if they had said (instead), 'We hear and obey,' 'Wait for us (to understand),' it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not except for a few.
compare: Some among the Jews distort the words out of context and say (in place of the right words): 'We hear and do not obey,' and 'Listen without hearing,' and 'Listen to us,' twisting their tongues and reviling the faith.
