And if they had said (instead), 'We hear and obey,' 'Wait for us (to understand),' it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not except for a few.

src: Vielleicht möchtest du einen Teil von dem, was dir (als Offenbarung) eingegeben wird, auslassen und deine Brust ist dadurch beklommen, und dies, weil sie sagen: "Wäre doch ein Schatz auf ihn herabgesandt worden oder ein Engel mit ihm gekommen!" Du aber bist nur ein Warner. Und Allah ist Sachwalter über alles.
ref: Perhaps you are leaving part of what has been sent down to you, and your chest is straitened by it, because they say: 'Why has no treasure been sent down to him, or an angel come with him' You are only a warner, and Allah is a Guardian over everything.
draft: Perhaps you would like to omit a part of what is revealed to you and your chest becomes tight because they say: "Why was not a treasure sent down to him or an angel came with him?" But you are only a warner. And Allah is the Guardian over everything.
hil: You may omit some of what is revealed to you, and may be disheartened because they say: 'Why was no treasure sent down to him, or an angel accompanied him?'. But you are only a Warner. And Allah is the Guardian over everything.
compare: You may omit some of what is revealed to you, and may be disheartened because they say: 'Why was no treasure sent down to him, or an angel accompanied him?'. But you are only a Warner. And Allah is the Guardian over everything.

src: Abraham war weder Jude noch Christ, sondern er war Anhänger des reinen Glaubens, ein Gottergebener, und er gehörte nicht zu den Polytheisten.
ref: Neither was Abraham a Jew nor a Christian, but upright and obedient, and not an idolater.
draft: Abraham was neither Jewish nor Christian, but he was a follower of pure faith, a God-submitter, and he did not belong to the polytheists.
hil: Abraham was not a Jew or a Christian, but a follower of the pure faith, a God-submitter, and he did not belong to the polytheists.
compare: Abraham was neither Jewish nor Christian, but he was a follower of pure faith, a God-submitter, and he did not belong to the polytheists.

src: Am Tag, da sie sehen, was ihnen angedroht wird, wird ihnen sein, als hätten sie nur eine Stunde vom Tag verweilt.
ref: The Day when they see what they had been warned against they will feel as though they had remained in the world no more than an hour of a day.
draft: On the day when they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have only lingered for one hour of the day.
hil: On the day when they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have only lingered for one hour of the day.
compare: On the day when they see what is threatened to them, it will be as if they have only lingered for one hour of the day.

src: Oder bis du den Himmel auf uns in Stücken herabfallen läßt, wie du behauptet hast, oder Gott und die Engel vor unsere Augen bringst,
ref: Or, let chunks of sky fall over us, as you assert (you will); or, bring God and the angels as a surety;
draft: Or until you make the sky fall down on us in pieces as you claimed, or bring God and the angels before our eyes.
hil: Or until you make the sky fall down on us in pieces as you claimed, or bring God and the angels before our eyes.
compare: Or until you make the sky fall down on us in pieces as you claimed, or bring God and the angels before our eyes.

src: Und wisst, daß unter euch ALLAHs Gesandter ist. Würde er auf euch in vielen der Angelegenheiten hören, würdet ihr sicherlich unter Unannehmlichkeiten leiden.
ref: Know that the Apostle of God is among you: If he agreed with you in most matters you would surely come to grief.
draft: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to listen to you in much of the matter, you would certainly be in difficulty.
hil: Obey Allah and the Messenger when he listens to you in most matters, lest you suffer hardship. And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah.
compare: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to listen to you in much of the matter, you would certainly be in difficulty.

src: Und ALLAH ist immer über alles allwissend.
ref: God has knowledge of everything.
draft: And ALLAH is always omniscient above everything.
hil: And implore Allah for some of His grace; verily, Allah is Knower of everything.
compare: And implore Allah for some of His grace; verily, Allah is Knower of everything.

src: Diejenigen, die von den Engeln abberufen werden - da sie gegen sich selber gefrevelt haben und nun unterwürfig geworden sind (sagen): "Wir pflegten ja, nichts Böses zu tun." Nein, wahrlich, Allah weiß wohl, was ihr zu tun pflegtet.
ref: whom the angels take while they were still harming themselves' Then they will offer submission, saying: 'We have done no evil' No, surely Allah knows what you have done.
draft: Those who are recalled by the angels - because they have sinned against themselves and have become submissive (say): "We used to do nothing wrong." No, truly, Allah knows well what you used to do.
hil: Those who are recalled by the angels - because they have sinned against themselves and have become submissive - say, "We used to do nothing wrong." No, truly, Allah knows well what they were doing.
compare: Those who are recalled by the angels - because they have sinned against themselves and have become submissive - say, "We used to do nothing wrong." No, truly, Allah knows well what they were doing.

src: Hätten aber die Bewohner (jener) Städte geglaubt und wären sie gottesfürchtig gewesen, so hätten Wir ihnen ganz gewiß die Segnungen von Himmel und Erde eröffnet. Doch sie leugneten; also erfaßten Wir sie um dessentwillen, was sie begangen hatten.
ref: But if the people of these regions had believed and feared God, We would surely have showered on them blessings of the heavens and the earth; but they only denied, and We punished them for their deeds.
draft: But if the inhabitants of those cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened up for them blessings from heaven and earth. However, they denied the truth, so We seized them for what they were earning.
hil: Had the inhabitants of those cities believed and feared Allah, We would surely have opened up for them the blessings of heaven and earth. But they denied (the truth), so We seized them for what they had earned.
compare: But if the inhabitants of those cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened up for them blessings from heaven and earth. However, they denied the truth, so We seized them for what they were earning.

src: (Er ist der) Herr der Himmel und der Erde und all dessen, was zwischen beiden liegt.
ref: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them.
draft: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them.
hil: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, worship Him, be patient in His worship.
compare: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them.

src: So ziehen sie ihn der Lüge.
ref: So they belied him, and We destroyed them.
draft: So they expose him to the lie.
hil: Thus they accuse him of lying.
compare: Thus they accuse him of lying.

src: Diese sind es, die eine schlimme Abrechnung haben werden, und ihre Herberge ist Gahannam.
ref: They will be subjected to a severe reckoning and Hell shall be their refuge.
draft: These are the ones who will have a bad reckoning, and their abode is Gahannam.
hil: These are the ones who will have a terrible reckoning, and their abode is Gahannam.
compare: These are the ones who will have a terrible reckoning, and their abode is Gahannam.

src: Und reinige mein Haus für diejenigen, die den Umlauf vollziehen, und für die, die aufrecht stehen, sich verneigen und niederwerfen.
ref: And do thou purify My House for those that shall go about it and those that stand, for those that bow and prostrate themselves;
draft: And clean my house for those who perform the circuit, and for those who stand upright and bow down in worship.
hil: And purify my house for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand up for prayer and bow down [in worship].
compare: And clean my house for those who perform the circuit, and for those who stand upright and bow down in worship.

src: (Was nun) die älteren Frauen (betrifft), die nicht mehr auf Heirat hoffen können, so trifft sie kein Vorwurf, wenn sie ihre Tücher ablegen, ohne ihre Zierde zur Schau zu stellen. Aber wenn sie sich dessen enthalten, ist das besser für sie. Und Allah ist Allhörend, Allwissend.
ref: And the old women residing in houses who do not have the desire of marriage – it is no sin upon them if they discard their upper coverings provided they do not display their adornment; and avoiding even this is better for them; and Allah is All Hearing, All Knowing.
draft: (As for) the older women who can no longer hope for marriage, they are not to be blamed if they take off their cloaks without displaying their ornaments. But to refrain from that is better for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
hil: As for elder women who can no longer hope for marriage, they are not to be blamed if they remove their cloaks without revealing their adornment. But to refrain is better for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
compare: (As for) the older women who can no longer hope for marriage, they are not to be blamed if they take off their cloaks without displaying their ornaments. But to refrain from that is better for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

src: Und wenn sie zu euch kommen, sagen sie: "Wir haben den Iman bekundet.", während sie selbst doch mit dem Kufr eingetreten und mit diesem fortgegangen sind.
ref: And when they come to you they say: we believe; whereas surely with infidelity they entered and surely with it they went forth.
draft: And when they come to you, they say, "We have declared faith (Iman)," while they themselves have entered with disbelief and returned with it.
hil: And when they come to you, they say 'We have declared faith (Iman),' while they have actually entered with disbelief and gone out with it.
compare: And when they come to you, they say, "We have declared faith (Iman)," while they themselves have entered with disbelief and returned with it.

src: Und Wir trafen mit ihnen ein festes Abkommen.
ref: We made a solemn covenant with them.
draft: And we made a firm agreement with them.
hil: "And We made a firm covenant with them."
compare: And we made a firm agreement with them.

src: Und WIR setzten für ihr Zugrunde-Richten einen Termin fest.
ref: And We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.
draft: And WE set a date for their destruction.
hil: And WE set a date for their destruction.
compare: And WE set a date for their destruction.

src: Mein HERR! Schenke mir Weisheit und lasse mich den gottgefällig Guttuenden folgen!
ref: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous,
draft: My LORD! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the godly benevolent.
hil: My LORD, grant me wisdom and let me follow the benevolent deeds that please GOD!
compare: My LORD, grant me wisdom and let me follow the benevolent deeds that please GOD!

src: Für diejenigen, die Unrecht tun, ist ein Los bestimmt wie das Los ihrer Gefährten.
ref: Those who do wrong will indeed come to the same end as their fellows (of old).
draft: "For those who do wrong, a fate is determined like the fate of their companions."
hil: For those who do wrong, a fate is determined like the fate of their companions.
compare: For those who do wrong, a fate is determined like the fate of their companions.

src: Erwarten Sie denn etwas anderes, als daß die Engel zu ihnen kommen, oder daß der Befehl deines Herrn eintrifft?
ref: So what are they waiting for, except that the angels come upon them or that your Lord’s punishment comes?
draft: Do you expect anything else than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives?
hil: Do you expect anything else besides the arrival of the angels to them, or the command of your Lord?
compare: Do you expect anything else than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives?

src: Und wer macht die Schöpfung am Anfang und wiederholt sie? Und wer versorgt euch vom Himmel und von der Erde?
ref: Or He Who initiates the creation, then will create it again, and He Who provides you sustenance from the skies and the earth?
draft: And who made the creation at the beginning and repeats it? And who provides for you from the sky and the earth?
hil: Ask: Who creates the beginning of creation and repeats it? Who gives you food and sustenance from the skies and the earth?
compare: Ask: Who creates the beginning of creation and repeats it? Who gives you food and sustenance from the skies and the earth?

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Wer von euch sich von seinem Din abwendet, so wird ALLAH Menschen bringen, die ER liebt und welche Ihn lieben.
ref: Believers, if any among you renounce the faith, God will replace them by others who love Him and are loved by Him, who will be kind and considerate towards believers and firm and unyielding towards those who deny the truth.
draft: You who have internalized the imam! If any of you turns away from his Deen, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.
hil: Believers! If any of you turns away from his faith, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.
compare: Believers! If any of you turns away from his faith, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.

src: Sie sagten: "Bist du zu uns gekommen, um uns von dem abzubringen, worin wir unsere Väter (vor)gefunden haben, und damit euch beiden die Oberhoheit im Land werde?
ref: "Have you come," said they, "to turn us back from what we found our ancestors doing, so that the two of you may attain supremacy in the land?
draft: They said: "Have you come to us to dissuade us from what we have found our fathers (in) and so that both of you may have supremacy in the country?"
hil: They said, "Have you come to us to dissuade us from what we have found our fathers (in) and so that both of you may have dominion in the land?"
compare: They said: "Have you come to us to dissuade us from what we have found our fathers (in) and so that both of you may have supremacy in the country?"

src: Und (Er läßt dies zu,) damit diejenigen, denen das Wissen gegeben wurde, erkennen, daß es die Wahrheit von deinem Herrn ist, auf daß sie daran glauben und ihre Herzen sich Ihm friedvoll unterwerfen mögen. Und siehe, Allah leitet jene, die gläubig sind, auf den geraden Weg.
ref: And so that the people given the knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, in order that they may accept faith in it, therefore their hearts may humble before Him; and indeed Allah will guide the believers on the Straight Path.
draft: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts may humbly submit to Him. Indeed, Allah guides those who believe to a straight path.
hil: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may recognize that it is the truth from your Lord, and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts may peacefully submit to Him. And behold, Allah guides those who believe to the straight path.
compare: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts may humbly submit to Him. Indeed, Allah guides those who believe to a straight path.

src: Hätten sie gesagt: «Wir hören, und wir gehorchen», und: «Höre», und: «Schau auf uns» (unzurnaa), wäre es besser und richtiger für sie. Aber Gott hat sie wegen ihres Unglaubens verflucht, so glauben sie nur wenig.
ref: If they had said, 'We have heard and obey' and 'Hear' and 'Regard us,' it would have been better for them, and more upright; but God has cursed them for their unbelief so they believe not except a few.
draft: "Would they have said, 'We hear and we obey,' and 'Listen,' and 'Look at us,' it would have been better and more proper for them. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few."
hil: If they had said, 'We hear and we obey,' and 'Listen,' and 'Look at us,' it would have been better and more proper for them. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.
compare: "Would they have said, 'We hear and we obey,' and 'Listen,' and 'Look at us,' it would have been better and more proper for them. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few."

src: Dann befände ich mich wahrlich in einem offenkundigen Irrtum.
ref: In that case I would surely be in clear error.
draft: Then I would truly be in an obvious error.
hil: Then I would truly be in a palpable error.
compare: Then I would truly be in a palpable error.

src: Wenn aber jemand (dazu) gezwungen ist, ohne (es) zu begehren und ohne das Maß zu überschreiten, so trifft ihn keine Schuld; wahrlich, Allah ist Allverzeihend, Barmherzig.
ref: If one is obliged by necessity to eat it without intending to transgress, or reverting to it, he is not guilty of sin; for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: If someone is forced to do it without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not guilty; truly, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
hil: But if someone is compelled to do it without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not guilty; surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
compare: If someone is forced to do it without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not guilty; truly, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

src: Sag: "Ihr Schriftbesitzer! Ihr habt nichts (vom Din), bis ihr At-taurat und Alindschil und das einhaltet, was euch von eurem HERRN hinabgesandt wurde.
ref: Say to them: "O people of the Book, you have no ground (for argument) until you follow the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you by your Lord."
draft: Say: "O writers! You have nothing (of the Din) until you observe the Taurat and the Injil and what has been sent down to you from your Lord."
hil: Say: "O people of the book! You have nothing (of the Din) until you observe the Taurat and the Injil and what has been sent down to you from your Lord."
compare: Say: "O people of the book! You have nothing (of the Din) until you observe the Taurat and the Injil and what has been sent down to you from your Lord."

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Musa zu seinen Leuten sagte: "Gewiß, ALLAH gebietet euch, eine Kuh zu schlachten."
ref: And when Moses said to his people, 'God commands you to sacrifice a cow.'
draft: And (remember), when Musa said to his people: "Surely, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow."
hil: "And (remember), when Musa said to his people: 'Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow.'"
compare: "And (remember), when Musa said to his people: 'Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow.'"

src: Könntest du nur sehen wenn sie mit Furcht geschlagen sein werden!
ref: And couldst thou see the time when they shall be terrified!
draft: Could you only see when they will be struck with fear!
hil: If only you could see when they will be struck with fear!
compare: If only you could see when they will be struck with fear!

src: ER ist Der Allhörende, Der Allwissende.
ref: He is the Hearer, the Knower.
draft: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
hil: It is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
compare: He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

src: Und ALLAHs Erde ist weit.
ref: And God’s earth is vast.
draft: And ALLAH's earth is vast.
hil: And Allah's earth is vast.
compare: And ALLAH's earth is vast.

src: Gewiß, die Unrecht-Begehenden werden nie erfolgreich werden."
ref: But surely the wicked will not prosper."
draft: "Surely, wrongdoers will never be successful."
hil: Verily, wrongdoers will never succeed.
compare: "Surely, wrongdoers will never be successful."

src: Verleihe uns Geduld und lasse uns als Muslime sterben!"
ref: Pour (bestow abundantly) patience on us, and bestow us death as Muslims.”
draft: "Lend us patience and let us die as Muslims!"
hil: Grant us patience and let us die as Muslims!
compare: Grant us patience and let us die as Muslims!

src: Könnt ihr uns vor Gottes Pein etwas nützen?»
ref: They will say: "Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you.
draft: "Can you help us to avoid God's punishment?"
hil: Can you be of any use to us in avoiding the torment of God?
compare: Can you be of any use to us in avoiding the torment of God?

src: Diese erhalten einen Anteil von dem, was sie sich erworben haben. Gott ist schnell im Abrechnen.
ref: They are those who will surely have their share of whatsoever they have earned; for God is swift at the reckoning.
draft: These receive a share of what they have earned. God is quick in settling accounts.
hil: They will receive a share of what they have earned. Allah is quick to take account.
compare: These receive a share of what they have earned. God is quick in settling accounts.

src: (Das ist) Allahs Versprechen in Wahrheit.
ref: The Promise of Allah is true.
draft: This is Allah's promise in truth.
hil: That is Allah's promise in truth. Allah does not break His promise.
compare: This is Allah's promise in truth.

src: Sie können doch sich selbst nicht helfen, und sie werden keinen Beistand gegen Uns erhalten.
ref: But they are not able to help themselves, nor can they find protection against Us.
draft: They cannot help themselves and they will not receive any support from us.
hil: They cannot help themselves, and they will not receive any assistance from us.
compare: They cannot help themselves and they will not receive any support from us.

src: Und lauert nicht auf jedem Weg auf, um (Menschen) einzuschüchtern und von ALLAHs Weg diejenigen abzuhalten, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben - erstrebt nach dem Krümmen (dieses Weges). Und entsinnt euch, als ihr noch wenige wart, dann ließ ER euch mehr werden. Und nehmt wahr, wie das Anschließende von den Verderben-Anrichtenden war.
ref: “And do not be seated on every road in order to scare the travellers, and to prevent from Allah’s path the people who believe in Him, wishing to distort it; and remember when you were few and He increased your numbers; and see what sort of fate befell the mischievous!”
draft: And do not lie in wait on every path to intimidate and turn away from Allah's way those who believe in Him. And seek to make the path crooked. And remember when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
hil: And do not lie in wait on every path to intimidate and turn away from the path of Allah those who have internalized faith - seek to make the path crooked. And remember when you were few, then He made you many. And see how the end of those who caused corruption was.
compare: And do not lie in wait on every path to intimidate and turn away from Allah's way those who believe in Him. And seek to make the path crooked. And remember when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.

src: ER sagte: "WIR ließen doch deine Leute nach dir der Fitna aussetzen.
ref: Said He, 'We have tempted thy people since thou didst leave them.
draft: He said, "We did leave your people after you to face the Fitna."
hil: He said, "We did leave your people after you to face the turmoil."
compare: He said, "We did leave your people after you to face the turmoil."

src: Und verkünde denen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, daß für sie Gärten bestimmt sind, unter denen Bäche fließen.
ref: And bear thou the glad tidings unto those who believe and do righteous works that verily for them shall be Gardens whereunder rivers flow.
draft: And proclaim to those who believe and do good works that gardens are destined for them beneath which rivers flow.
hil: And give glad tidings to those who believe and do good deeds; that for them are gardens beneath which rivers flow. When they are given the fruit of those gardens as sustenance, they say, "This is the same food as what was given to us before" whereas it is only a semblance of it. They are also given purified spouses in those gardens, where they will abide forever.
compare: And proclaim to those who believe and do good works that gardens are destined for them beneath which rivers flow.

src: Und gewiß, viele führen mit ihren Gelüsten durch Mangel an Wissen zum Irrweg.
ref: Surely many (men) mislead others into following their vain desires through lack of knowledge.
draft: And certainly, many lead themselves astray with their desires due to a lack of knowledge.
hil: "Certainly, many lead themselves astray with their desires due to a lack of knowledge."
compare: And certainly, many lead themselves astray with their desires due to a lack of knowledge.

src: So prüfen Wir sie dafür, daß sie zu freveln pflegten.
ref: We tried them in this way, for they were disobedient.
draft: So we check them for they used to behave wickedly.
hil: We punish them for having acted wickedly.
compare: We punish them for having acted wickedly.

src: Gewiß, WIR entsandten Nuh zu seinen Leuten: "Warne deine Leute, bevor zu ihnen eine qualvolle Peinigung kommt."
ref: SENT NOAH to his people to warn them before the painful punishment came upon them.
draft: Sure, WE sent Noah to his people: "Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them."
hil: Indeed, WE sent Noah to his people: 'Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.'
compare: Sure, WE sent Noah to his people: "Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them."

src: Vielmehr sind sie Leute, die (Allah andere) gleichsetzen.
ref: Nay, but they are a people who ascribe equals (to Him)!
draft: Rather, they are people who equate (Allah with others).
hil: In fact, they are people who turn away (from the truth).
compare: Rather, they are people who equate (Allah with others).

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwürdig, allweise.
ref: He is indeed all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: Certainly, Allah is worthy of all praise, all-wise.
hil: Certainly, Allah is worthy of all praise, all-wise.
compare: Certainly, Allah is worthy of all praise, all-wise.

src: Und WIR werden euch bestimmt das Land nach ihnen bewohnen lassen. Dies ist für denjenigen, der Ehrfurcht vor der Vorstellung Mir gegenüber hat, und der Meine Androhung fürchtet."
ref: “And indeed We will establish you in the land after them; this is for him who fears to stand before Me and fears the commands of punishment declared by Me.”
draft: "We will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for those who have reverence for the idea of ​​Me and who fear My threat."
hil: And We will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for those who have reverence for the idea of Me and who fear My threat.
compare: "We will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for those who have reverence for the idea of ​​Me and who fear My threat."

src: Hast du etwa nicht diejenigen wahrgenommen, denen gesagt wurde: "Haltet euch zurück, verrichtet ordnungsgemäß das rituelle Gebet und entrichtet die Zakat"?!
ref: Have you not seen the people who were told: "Hold back your hands (from attacking), observe your devotional obligations and pay the zakat?"
draft: Have you not noticed those who were told, "Restrain yourselves, maintain the prescribed prayer, and give zakat"?
hil: Did you not even notice those to whom it was said, 'Restrain yourselves, perform the ritual prayer properly and pay the Zakat'?
compare: Did you not even notice those to whom it was said, 'Restrain yourselves, perform the ritual prayer properly and pay the Zakat'?

src: "Und gewiß, als ALLAHs Diener aufstand, an Ihn Bittgebete zu richten, beinahe wären sie ihn Niederdrückende."
ref: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).
draft: "And certainly, when Allah's servant stood up to address Him in prayer, they almost pressed him down."
hil: And indeed, when Allah's servant rose to offer supplications to Him, they almost suppressed him.
compare: And indeed, when Allah's servant rose to offer supplications to Him, they almost suppressed him.

src: Und sie sind vor (jedem) Schrecken an jenem Tag in Sicherheit'.
ref: He will be secure from the terror of the Day of Judgment.
draft: "And they are safe from (every) terror on that day"
hil: And they will be safe from every terror on that day.
compare: And they will be safe from every terror on that day.

src: Gewiß ALLAH verfügt bei Sich über das Wissen der Stunde, ER läßt den helfenden (Regen) nieder und ER weiß, was in den Mutterschößen ist. Und kein Lebewesen weiß, was es morgen erwirbt, und kein Lebewesen weiß, in welchem Lande es stirbt. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwissend, allkundig.
ref: Surely Allah is He with Whom is the knowledge of the hour, and He sends down the rain and He knows what is in the wombs; and no one knows what he shall earn on the morrow; and no one knows in what land he shall die; surely Allah is Knowing, Aware.
draft: Surely ALLAH has with him the knowledge of the Hour. He sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. No living being knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no living being knows in which land it dies. Surely, ALLAH is all-knowing, all-aware.
hil: Surely ALLAH sends down the helping rain, and He knows what is in the wombs. No living being knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no living being knows the place where it will die. Surely, ALLAH is all-knowing, all-aware.
compare: Surely ALLAH sends down the helping rain, and He knows what is in the wombs. No living being knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no living being knows the place where it will die. Surely, ALLAH is all-knowing, all-aware.

src: Das Königreich, das wahrhaftige - an jenem Tage wird es des Allerbarmers sein; und ein Tag soll es sein, (der) schwer für die Ungläubigen (ist)
ref: The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels!
draft: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful; and it shall be a day difficult for the disbelievers.
hil: Say: 'The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful; and it shall be a day difficult for the disbelievers.'
compare: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful; and it shall be a day difficult for the disbelievers.

src: Allah wird uns zusammenbringen.
ref: Allah will bring us all together.
draft: Allah will bring us together.
hil: Allah will bring us together.
compare: Allah will bring us together.

src: Sag: "Setzt ihr ALLAH etwa (damit) in Kenntnis über etwas, was ER weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde kennt?!" Gepriesen-erhaben sei ER über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Say: "Do ye indeed inform Allah of something He knows not, in the heavens or on earth?- Glory to Him! and far is He above the partners they ascribe (to Him)!"
draft: Say: "Do you inform Allah about something that He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted and high above what they associate with Him [in worship].
hil: Say: Do you inform Allah of something that He neither knows in the heavens nor on the earth? Exalted and high above what they associate with Him [in worship].
compare: Say: "Do you inform Allah about something that He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted and high above what they associate with Him [in worship].

src: Du bringst das Lebendige aus dem Toten, und Du bringst das Tote aus dem Lebendigen hervor, und Du bescherst Unterhalt, wem Du willst, ohne (viel) zu rechnen.
ref: You bring forth the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living, and You give sustenance to whom You will beyond all reckoning.'
draft: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will without counting (much).
hil: You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living, and You grant sustenance to whom You will, without measure.
compare: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will without counting (much).

src: Aber er ist nicht den steilen Paßweg hinaufgestürmt.
ref: But he could not scale the steep ascent.
draft: But he did not rush up the steep mountain path.
hil: But he did not rush up the steep mountain path.
compare: But he did not rush up the steep mountain path.

src: Erhebt nicht eure Stimmen über die Stimme des Propheten, und seid ihm gegenüber nicht so laut mit dem Gesagten, wie die einen von euch den anderen gegenüber laut sind, sonst werden eure Handlungen zunichte, während ihr es nicht merkt.
ref: Do not raise your voices higher than the voice of the Prophet, nor speak to him loudly the way you shout to one another, lest your deeds go to waste whilst you are unaware. (Faith will go waste due to the slightest disrespect towards the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.
draft: Do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet and do not speak loudly to him as some of you are loud to others, otherwise your deeds will be nullified without you realizing it.
hil: O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and do not speak loudly to him as you speak loudly to one another, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.
compare: O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and do not speak loudly to him as you speak loudly to one another, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.

src: Sie pflegten nicht zuzuhören und sie pflegten nicht einzublicken.
ref: They could not bear to hear (the preachers of the truth) and they used not to see (the truth because of their severe aversin, inspite of the fact that they had the sense of hearing and sight).
draft: They did not tend to listen and they did not tend to look into things.
hil: "They were not in the habit of listening and they were not in the habit of looking closely."
compare: "They were not in the habit of listening and they were not in the habit of looking closely."

src: Und WIR ließen Musa Wahy zuteil werden, als seine Leute ihn um Wasser baten: "Schlage mit deinem Stock gegen den Felsen!"
ref: And We revealed unto Musa, when his people asked him for drink: Smite the rock with thy rod.
draft: And WE granted Musa Wahy when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!"
hil: And WE said to Moses: 'Strike the rock with your staff!' when his people asked him for water.
compare: And WE granted Musa Wahy when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!"

src: Und wenn der Himmel (wie ein Fell) abgezogen wird,
ref: The curtain drawn back from the skies,
draft: And when the sky (like a pelt) is stripped away,
hil: And if the sky is stripped away (like a pelt),
compare: And when the sky (like a pelt) is stripped away,

src: Und daß ihr fastet, ist besser für euch, wenn ihr (es) nur wißt!
ref: And if you fast it is good for you, if you knew.
draft: And that you fast is better for you, if you only knew!
hil: And that you fast is better for you, if you only knew!
compare: And that you fast is better for you, if you only knew!

src: Und verheiße den Gläubigen die frohe Botschaft.
ref: So convey glad tidings to those who believe.
draft: And promise the believers the good news.
hil: And give the believers the glad tidings.
compare: And give the believers the glad tidings.

src: Diejenigen, die es lieben, daß sich das Abscheuliche unter denjenigen, die glauben, verbreitet, für sie wird es schmerzhafte Strafe geben im Diesseits und Jenseits. Allah weiß, ihr aber wißt nicht.
ref: There is painful punishment in this world and the next for those who like that immorality should spread among the believers, for God knows and you do not know.
draft: Those who love that the abominable should spread among those who believe will have a painful punishment in this world and the hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
hil: As for those who love that the abominable should spread among those who believe, for them there will be a painful punishment in this world and the hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
compare: Those who love that the abominable should spread among those who believe will have a painful punishment in this world and the hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.

src: Sie sagen: "Allah hat Sich Kinder genommen." Preis sei Ihm! Er ist der Unbedürftige. Ihm gehört, was in den Himmeln und was auf der Erde ist. Keine Ermächtigung habt ihr dafür. Wollt ihr über Allah etwas sagen, was ihr nicht wißt?
ref: They said, “Allah has created a son for Himself”- Purity is to Him! He is the Perfect (Unwanting, free of needs); to Him only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; “You do not have any proof of this; do you say a thing concerning Allah which you do not know?”
draft: They say, "Allah has taken children to Himself." Praise be to Him! He is the Self-Sufficient. To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?
hil: They said: 'Allah has taken an offspring for Himself' - Purity is to Him! He is the Self-Sufficient. His dominion comprises all that is in the heavens and the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?
compare: They say, "Allah has taken children to Himself." Praise be to Him! He is the Self-Sufficient. To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?

src: Und hätten sie sich doch in Geduld geübt, bis du zu ihnen herauskommst, wäre dies sicher besser für sie.
ref: If they had waited for you to come out it would have been better for them.
draft: And if they had just practiced patience until you came out to them, this would certainly be better for them.
hil: And if only they had practiced patience until you came out to them, it would have been better for them.
compare: And if only they had practiced patience until you came out to them, it would have been better for them.

src: Möge sein Herr ihm, wenn er euch (alle) entläßt, zum Tausch andere Gattinnen geben, die besser sind als ihr: muslimische Frauen, die gläubig und demütig ergeben sind, bereit zur Umkehr sind, (Gott) dienen und umherziehen, ob sie früher verheiratet waren oder Jungfrauen sind.
ref: In case he divorces you, his Lord will give him better wives in return, who will be modest, true believers, obedient to God, repentant, observant of prayer and fasting, both widows and virgins.
draft: May his Lord give him, when he dismisses you all, other wives to replace you who are better than you: Muslim women, who are devout, submissive, repentant, worshipful, and given to fasting; whether previously married or virgins.
hil: When he releases you, his Lord may give him other wives in exchange who are better than you: Muslim women who are devout, obedient, repentant, worshipping, and moving around, whether previously married or virgins.
compare: May his Lord give him, when he dismisses you all, other wives to replace you who are better than you: Muslim women, who are devout, submissive, repentant, worshipful, and given to fasting; whether previously married or virgins.

src: Das ist ein gerader Weg."
ref: This is the straight path."
draft: This is a straight path.
hil: "Say, 'This is a straight path.'"
compare: This is a straight path.

src: Da wollte er sie aus dem Land aufschrecken.
ref: So he resolved to turn them out of the land (of Egypt).
draft: He wanted to scare her out of the country.
hil: Then he wanted to scare them out of the land.
compare: He wanted to scare her out of the country.

src: Kostet nun die Pein dafür, daß ihr ungläubig waret.»
ref: Therefore now taste the punishment, the result of your disbelief.”
draft: Now pay the penalty for your disbelief.
hil: Now taste the torment for having been unbelievers.
compare: Now taste the torment for having been unbelievers.

src: Dachten sie etwa nicht über sich selbst nach?!
ref: What, have they not considered within themselves?
draft: Did they not think about themselves?!
hil: Did they not think about themselves?!
compare: Did they not think about themselves?!

src: Und die frohe Botschaft gib den Demütigen
ref: Give good tidings to those who bow in obedience to God,
draft: And give the glad tidings to the humble.
hil: Give the glad tidings to the humble.
compare: And give the glad tidings to the humble.

src: Das Gleichnis derer, denen die Thora auferlegt wurde, und die ihr dann nicht nachlebten, ist wie das Gleichnis eines Esels, der Bücher trägt. Übel steht es um die Leute, die Allahs Zeichen leugnen. Und Allah rechtleitet kein ungerechtes Volk.
ref: The example of those who were entrusted with the Taurat, and did not carry out its commands, is like the donkey carrying books; what a wretched example is of the people who denied the signs of Allah; and Allah does not guide the unjust.
draft: The parable of those who were entrusted with the Torah but then did not uphold it is like the parable of a donkey that carries books. It is an evil example of the people who reject Allah's signs. And Allah does not guide the unjust people.
hil: The parable of those to whom the Torah was entrusted but then did not follow it is like the parable of a donkey carrying books. It is a bad situation for the people who deny Allah's signs, and Allah does not guide an unjust people.
compare: The parable of those who were entrusted with the Torah but then did not uphold it is like the parable of a donkey that carries books. It is an evil example of the people who reject Allah's signs. And Allah does not guide the unjust people.

src: Und WIR wiesen dem Menschen zu, seinen Eltern Ihsan zu erweisen. Seine Mutter war schwanger mit ihm in Angestrengtheit und brachte ihn zur Welt in Angestrengtheit.
ref: We have enjoined on man to be good to his parents: His mother carries him in her womb with hardship, and gives birth to him in pain.
draft: And WE have assigned to human being to show kindness to his parents. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship.
hil: And WE have instructed humans to show kindness to their parents. His mother carried him with difficulty and gave birth to him with difficulty.
compare: And WE have instructed humans to show kindness to their parents. His mother carried him with difficulty and gave birth to him with difficulty.

src: Sie sagten: "Al-'aziz!
ref: They said, “O governor!
draft: "They said: "Al-'aziz!"
hil: "They said, "Al-Aziz!"
compare: "They said: "Al-'aziz!"

src: Und euer HERR ist gewiß Der Allgnade Erweisende.
ref: Surely your Lord is Ar-Rahman.
draft: And your LORD is certainly the All-Merciful Demonstrating (His) Grace.
hil: From the Lord of the heavens, the Earth, and whatever is between them, He is the One who shows mercy.
compare: And your LORD is certainly the All-Merciful Demonstrating (His) Grace.

src: Und wenn du sie fragst, wer die Himmel und die Erde erschaffen und die Sonne und den Mond dienstbar gemacht hat, sagen sie bestimmt: «Gott.» Wie leicht lassen sie sich doch abwenden!
ref: And if you ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth, and subjected the sun and the moon?”, they will surely say, “Allah”; so where are they reverting?
draft: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth and made the sun and the moon subservient, they will surely say, "God." How easily they can be turned away!
hil: If you ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth, and who set the sun and the moon to work?" They will answer: "God." How easily they can be turned away!
compare: If you ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth, and who set the sun and the moon to work?" They will answer: "God." How easily they can be turned away!

src: Und wenn die Menschen (vor Mir) versammelt werden, werden sie ihre Feinde sein und ihre Anbetung verleugnen.
ref: When all men are gathered together (on that Day) they will become their enemies and deny their worship.
draft: And when people are gathered (before Me), they will be your enemies and deny your worship.
hil: And when people are gathered before Me, they will be your enemies and deny their worship.
compare: And when people are gathered before Me, they will be your enemies and deny their worship.

src: Sag: "Ja!
ref: Say: "Yes!
draft: Say: "Yes!"
hil: Say: 'Yes!'
compare: Say: "Yes!"

src: Als er zu seinem Vater sagte: "Mein Vater! Weshalb betest du etwas an, das weder sieht, noch hört, noch von dir irgend etwas abwenden kann?
ref: Remember, when he said to his father: "O my father, why do you worship that which can neither hear nor see nor even profit you the least?
draft: When he said to his father: "My father! Why do you pray to something that neither sees nor hears nor can turn away anything from you?
hil: After he said to his father: "My father! Why do you pray to something that neither sees nor hears nor can turn away anything from you?", his father responded: "My son! Sometimes people are taught to believe in things beyond human capabilities. It gives them a sense of comfort and guidance in life."
compare: When he said to his father: "My father! Why do you pray to something that neither sees nor hears nor can turn away anything from you?

src: sie würden gewiß sagen: "Nur unsere Blicke sind benommen; wahrlich, man hat uns nur etwas vorgegaukelt."
ref: They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."
draft: They would certainly say: "Only our eyes are numb; truly, we have only been shown something."
hil: Surely they would say, "Only our vision is impaired, truly, we have only been shown something."
compare: They would certainly say: "Only our eyes are numb; truly, we have only been shown something."

src: Es ist so! Denn ALLAH wandelt keine Gabe (in Bestrafung) um, die ER Leuten beschert hat, bis sie sich selbst (zum Schlechten) verändern.
ref: That is so because Allah will never change a grace which He has bestowed on a people until they change what is in their ownselves.
draft: It is so! Because ALLAH does not turn any gift (into punishment) that HE has bestowed upon people until they change themselves (for the worse).
hil: It is true! For ALLAH does not transform any gift (into punishment) that HE has bestowed upon people until they change themselves (for worse).
compare: It is so! Because ALLAH does not turn any gift (into punishment) that HE has bestowed upon people until they change themselves (for the worse).

src: Ihr Menschen! Esst von dem, was auf Erden ist, an genießbaren Halalmitteln, und folgt nicht den Fußstapfen des Satans!
ref: O men, eat only the things of the earth that are lawful and good.
draft: "O people! Eat from the things on earth that are lawful and good, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan."
hil: O men, eat of what is in the earth lawful and good; and follow not the steps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.
compare: "O people! Eat from the things on earth that are lawful and good, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan."

src: Sagt: "Wollt ihr mit uns über ALLAH disputieren, wo ER unser und euer HERR ist, und wo uns unsere Taten und euch eure Taten gehören, und wo wir Ihm gegenüber aufrichtig sind?!"
ref: Say: "Why do you dispute with us about God when He is equally your Lord and our Lord? To us belong our actions, to you yours; and we are true to Him."
draft: Say, "Do you want to argue with us about Allah while He is our and your Lord? And to us are our deeds and to you are your deeds. And we are sincere to Him [in deed and intention]."
hil: Say, "What do you dispute with us about Allah, while He is our and your Lord, and to us are our deeds and to you are your deeds? And we are sincere to Him."
compare: Say, "Do you want to argue with us about Allah while He is our and your Lord? And to us are our deeds and to you are your deeds. And we are sincere to Him [in deed and intention]."

src: Und WIR ließen sie in Unsere Gnade eintreten.
ref: And they were admitted to Our grace.
draft: And WE let them enter into Our grace.
hil: And We allowed them to enter into Our grace.
compare: And WE let them enter into Our grace.

src: Auch hat mein Bruder Aaron eine redegewandtere Zunge. So sende ihn mit mir zur Unterstützung, daß er mich bestätige. Ich fürchte, daß sie mich der Lüge zeihen.»
ref: So send my brother Aaron with me as helper for he is more fluent than I with words, that he should affirm me, for I fear that they would call me a liar."
draft: Also, my brother Aaron has a more eloquent tongue. So send him with me for support, that he may confirm me. I fear that they will accuse me of lying.
hil: Also, my brother Aaron has a more eloquent tongue. Send him with me for support, so that he can confirm me. I fear they will accuse me of lying.
compare: Also, my brother Aaron has a more eloquent tongue. So send him with me for support, that he may confirm me. I fear that they will accuse me of lying.

src: Immer wieder wenn sie aus ihr (Dschahannam) aus einer Drangsal herausgehen wollten, werden sie wieder zu ihr zurückgeschickt.
ref: Whenever in their anguish they try to get out of it, they are restored to it.
draft: Again and again, when they wanted to leave it (Jahannam) out of distress, they are sent back to it.
hil: Again and again, whenever they wanted to leave from it (Jahannam) out of distress, they are sent back to it.
compare: Again and again, whenever they wanted to leave from it (Jahannam) out of distress, they are sent back to it.

src: Jene laden zum (Höllen)feuer ein. Allah aber lädt zum (Paradies)garten und zur Vergebung ein, mit Seiner Erlaubnis, und macht den Menschen Seine Zeichen klar, auf daß sie bedenken mögen.
ref: They invite you to Hell, but God calls you to Paradise and pardon by His grace. And He makes His signs manifest that men may haply take heed.
draft: Those invite to the (Hell)fire. Allah, however, invites to the (Paradise)garden and to forgiveness, by His permission, and makes clear His signs to the people that they may give thought.
hil: Those invite to the fire of hell. However, Allah invites to the Garden of Paradise and to forgiveness, by his permission, and makes his signs clear to the people for them to reflect.
compare: Those invite to the fire of hell. However, Allah invites to the Garden of Paradise and to forgiveness, by his permission, and makes his signs clear to the people for them to reflect.

src: Und solltest du diejenigen sehen, die über Unsere Ayat lästern, so wende dich von ihnen (so lange) ab, bis sie zu einem anderen Thema übergehen.
ref: When you see them argue about Our messages, withdraw from their company until they begin to talk of other things.
draft: And if you see those who mock Our verses, turn away from them until they turn to another topic.
hil: And if you see those who mock Our verses, turn away from them until they turn to another topic.
compare: And if you see those who mock Our verses, turn away from them until they turn to another topic.

src: Er aber erklärte (es) für Lüge und war ungehorsam.
ref: But (the Pharaoh) disavowed and disobeyed.
draft: But he declared it to be a lie and was disobedient.
hil: He, however, declared it to be a lie and was disobedient.
compare: He, however, declared it to be a lie and was disobedient.

src: Haben WIR euch etwa nicht ein langes Lebensalter gewährt, während dessen derjenige sich erinnern konnte, der sich erinnern wollte?! Auch der Warner kam zu euch.
ref: But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you?
draft: Have WE not granted you a long lifetime during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! The Warner also came to you.
hil: "Have WE not granted you a long lifetime during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! The Warner also came to you."
compare: Have WE not granted you a long lifetime during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! The Warner also came to you.

src: Der Satan ist gegen den Erbarmer widerspenstig.
ref: Verily Satan was disobedient to Ar-Rahman.
draft: The Satan is rebellious against the Merciful.
hil: "The Satan is rebellious against the Merciful."
compare: The Satan is rebellious against the Merciful.

src: Und (auch) diejenigen unter diesen da, die Unrecht tun, werden die bösen Taten treffen, die sie begangen haben.
ref: So will the evil deeds of those who are sinners among them recoil back on them.
draft: And (also) those among them who do wrong will be affected by the evil deeds they have committed.
hil: And also those among them who do wrong will face the evil deeds they have committed.
compare: And (also) those among them who do wrong will be affected by the evil deeds they have committed.

src: Euer Besitz und eure Kinder sind nur eine Versuchung; Allah aber - bei Ihm gibt es großartigen Lohn.
ref: Your wealth and children are surely meant as trial for you: But with God is the great reward.
draft: Your possessions and your children are only a temptation, but Allah - with Him is an immense reward.
hil: Your wealth and your children are only a temptation. But with Allah, there is a great reward.
compare: Your possessions and your children are only a temptation, but Allah - with Him is an immense reward.

src: Und dort vor Salomo wurden dessen Heerscharen der Ginn und Menschen und Vögel versammelt, und sie standen in Reih und Glied geordnet
ref: His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled, formed into ranks, (and marched)
draft: And before Solomon, his armies of jinn, humans, and birds were gathered, and they stood in rows and ordered ranks.
hil: "And before Solomon, his hosts of jinn and men and birds were gathered, and they stood in rows and ranks."
compare: "And before Solomon, his hosts of jinn and men and birds were gathered, and they stood in rows and ranks."

src: Das ist der Tag, an dem sie nicht reden
ref: They will not be able to speak that day,
draft: "This is the day on which they do not speak."
hil: "This is the day when they will not speak."
compare: "This is the day on which they do not speak."

src: Vielmehr sind es geehrte Diener.
ref: (Those whom they think are God's sons) are only His honorable servants.
draft: Rather, they are honored servants.
hil: Rather, they are honored servants.
compare: Rather, they are honored servants.

src: Sie werden ihrem Herrn begegnen. Allein, ich erachte euch für ein Volk, das unwissend ist.
ref: Surely, they are going to meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people that are ignorant.
draft: You will meet your master. However, I consider you to be a people who are ignorant.
hil: "You will meet your Lord. However, I consider you to be a people who are ignorant."
compare: "You will meet your Lord. However, I consider you to be a people who are ignorant."

src: Auch ist es eine Erinnerung für die Mumin.
ref: You are to warn with it—and a reminder for the believers.
draft: Also, it is a reminder for the Moomins.
hil: Also, it is a reminder for the believers.
compare: Also, it is a reminder for the Moomins.

src: So kehre dich von ihnen ab; du bist (hierin) nicht zu tadeln.
ref: Turn away from them. You will not be blamed.
draft: So turn away from them; you are not to blame (for this).
hil: So turn away from them; you are not to be blamed for this.
compare: So turn away from them; you are not to be blamed for this.

src: Du versuchst nur, ein Tyrann im Land zu werden, und du willst kein Friedensstifter sein."
ref: You only want to be a tyrant in the land and no peacemaker."
draft: "You are only trying to become a tyrant in the country, and you do not want to be a peacemaker."
hil: You are only trying to become a tyrant in the country, and you do not want to be a peacemaker.
compare: "You are only trying to become a tyrant in the country, and you do not want to be a peacemaker."

src: Ob er wohl (die Botschaft) für Lüge erklärt und sich abkehrt?
ref: If he cries lies, and turns away -
draft: Whether he (declares the message) to be a lie and turns away?
hil: Whether he denies (the truth) and turns away?
compare: Whether he (declares the message) to be a lie and turns away?

src: Allah hatte ja mit den Kinder Isra'ils ein Abkommen getroffen. Und Wir beriefen von ihnen zwölf Obmänner.
ref: God covenanted the people of Israel and raised twelve leaders among them, and said: "I shall verily be with you.
draft: Allah had made a covenant with the Children of Israel, and We appointed twelve leaders from among them.
hil: Indeed, Allah had taken a bond from the Children of Israel, and We raised twelve wardens from among them.
compare: Allah had made a covenant with the Children of Israel, and We appointed twelve leaders from among them.

src: Und gewiß, ich denke doch über dich, du Pharao! - daß du verleitet bist."
ref: I truly think, O Pharaoh, your days are done."
draft: "And surely, I do think about you, you Pharaoh! - that you are led astray."
hil: And indeed, I am thinking about you, O Pharaoh, that you are led astray.
compare: And indeed, I am thinking about you, O Pharaoh, that you are led astray.

src: Laß Mich in Ruhe mit denen, die diese Botschaft für Lüge erklären.
ref: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me.
draft: "Leave me alone with those who declare this message a lie."
hil: Leave the one who denies this matter to me. We shall soon steadily take them away from a place they do not know.
compare: "Leave me alone with those who declare this message a lie."

src: Geh hinaus. Du gehörst zu den Erniedrigten.»
ref: Go, and away; you are one of the damned."
draft: "Go out. You belong to the humiliated."
hil: Go outside. You belong to the humiliated.
compare: Go outside. You belong to the humiliated.

src: Und Gott zürnt ihm und verflucht ihn und bereitet ihm eine gewaltige Pein.
ref: For him a greater punishment awaits.
draft: And God is angry with him and curses him and prepares a mighty pain for him.
hil: And Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and has kept prepared a terrible punishment for him.
compare: And God is angry with him and curses him and prepares a mighty pain for him.

src: (Es sind) diejenigen, die glauben und deren Herzen im Gedenken Allahs Ruhe finden.
ref: “Those who accepted faith and whose hearts gain solace from the remembrance of Allah; pay heed!
draft: (They are) those who believe and find tranquility in the remembrance of Allah.
hil: Those who believe and find peace in their hearts from the contemplation of Allah: Surely there is peace of heart in the contemplation of Allah!
compare: (They are) those who believe and find tranquility in the remembrance of Allah.

src: Die Entscheidungsträger vom Pharaos Leuten sagten: "Gewiß, dieser ist doch ein im Wissen fundierter Magier!
ref: The nobles of Pharaoh said: "He surely is a clever magician.
draft: The decision-makers of the Pharaoh's people said, "Surely, he is a magician founded in knowledge!
hil: The proud assembly of the Pharaoh's people said, 'Surely, he is a magician founded in knowledge!'
compare: The decision-makers of the Pharaoh's people said, "Surely, he is a magician founded in knowledge!

src: Wir fordern von keiner Seele etwas über das hinaus, was sie zu leisten vermag. Und wenn ihr eine Aussage macht, so übt Gerechtigkeit, auch wenn es einen nahen Verwandten (betrifft); und haltet den Bund Allahs ein.
ref: Give full measure and weight, according to justice, We never charge a soul with more than it can bear, when you speak, observe justice, even though it concerns a close relative; and fulfil the covenants of God.
draft: We do not demand anything from any soul beyond what it can bear. And when you make a statement, practice justice, even if it concerns a close relative; and keep the covenant of Allah.
hil: We do not expect anything from any soul beyond what it can bear. And when you make a statement, practice justice, even if it concerns a close relative; and keep the covenant of Allah.
compare: We do not demand anything from any soul beyond what it can bear. And when you make a statement, practice justice, even if it concerns a close relative; and keep the covenant of Allah.

src: Sie (die Königin) sagte: "Ihr Vornehmen, ein ehrenvoller Brief ist mir überbracht worden.
ref: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me.
draft: She (the queen) said: "You (the nobleman), an honorable letter has been brought to me."
hil: She (the queen) said: 'You (the nobleman), a honorable letter has been brought to me.'
compare: She (the queen) said: "You (the nobleman), an honorable letter has been brought to me."

src: Dann bezichtigten sie ihn der Lüge, dann verletzten sie ihm (dem Kamelweibchen) die Beine, dann richtete ihr HERR sie wegen ihrer Verfehlung zugrunde, dann ließ ER es ihnen gleichmäßig sein.
ref: But they called him a liar and hamstrung her. So God obliterated them for their crime, and (destroyed) all of them alike.
draft: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured his (the female camel's) legs, then their LORD destroyed them because of their wrongdoing, then HE made it equal for them.
hil: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured the legs of the female camel, then their LORD destroyed them due to their transgression, then HE made it equal for them.
compare: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured the legs of the female camel, then their LORD destroyed them due to their transgression, then HE made it equal for them.

src: Und wenn diejenigen, die Unrecht begingen, die Peinigung gesehen haben, wird diese ihnen weder erleichtert, noch wird ihnen Zeitaufschub gewährt.
ref: And when the wicked shall face the torment it will not be decreased, nor will they be reprieved.
draft: And when those who committed injustice have seen the punishment, it will not be made easier for them, nor will they be granted a reprieve.
hil: And on that day, their excuses will be of no avail to the sinners, and they will not be allowed to beg for favor. And when those who committed the wrongs see the punishment, it will not be made easier for them, nor will they be granted a reprieve.
compare: And when those who committed injustice have seen the punishment, it will not be made easier for them, nor will they be granted a reprieve.

src: Ihre Angelegenheit unterliegt nur ALLAH, dann wird ER ihnen das kundtun, was sie zu tun pflegten.
ref: Their affair is with God. He will tell them the truth of what they were doing.
draft: Your matter is subject to Allah only, then He will inform you of what you used to do.
hil: Your matter is subject to Allah only, then He will inform you of what you used to do.
compare: Your matter is subject to Allah only, then He will inform you of what you used to do.

src: So ließen Wir die einen von ihnen auf die anderen folgen und machten sie zu(m Gegenstand von) Geschichten. Weg darum mit Leuten, die nicht glauben!
ref: So oft as there came unto a community their apostle, they belied him, so We made them follow one anot her, and We made them bywords: so away with a people who believe not!
draft: Therefore, We caused some of them to follow the others, and We made them subject of tales. Away then with people who do not believe!
hil: Thus, we made one follow the other (to its doom) and turned them into bygone tales. Away with those who do not believe!
compare: Thus, we made one follow the other (to its doom) and turned them into bygone tales. Away with those who do not believe!

src: Bis auf eine alte Frau unter denen, die zurückblieben und dem Verderben anheimfielen.
ref: Except one old woman who remained behind.
draft: Except for an old woman among those who stayed behind and fell into ruin.
hil: We destined her to be of those who remained behind.
compare: Except for an old woman among those who stayed behind and fell into ruin.

src: Der Mensch ist ja eilfertig.
ref: Curse him, etc." and that one should not do, but one should be patient].
draft: The human is indeed hasty.
hil: Indeed, man is hurried.
compare: Indeed, man is hurried.

src: Allah wird sie bald in Seine Barmherzigkeit einführen. Wahrlich, Allah ist Allvergebend, Barmherzig.
ref: This is certainly a means of achieving nearness (to God), and God will admit them to His mercy, for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: "Allah will soon introduce them into his mercy. Truly, Allah is All-forgiving, Merciful."
hil: Verily, God is forgiving and merciful. He will soon lead them into His mercy.
compare: "Allah will soon introduce them into his mercy. Truly, Allah is All-forgiving, Merciful."

src: Sie glauben nicht eher, bis sie dich über das richten lassen, was zwischen ihnen umstritten ist, und hierauf in sich selbst keine Bedrängnis finden durch das, was du entschieden hast, und sich in voller Ergebung fügen.
ref: They will not believe until they make you a judge in their disputes, then do not find within their hearts any dissent to your verdict and submit in full submission.
draft: They will not believe until they have you judge concerning that which is disputed among them, and then find in themselves no discomfort with that which you have decided, and submit completely.
hil: They will not believe until they have you judge concerning that which is disputed among them, and then find in themselves no discomfort with that which you have decided, and submit completely.
compare: They will not believe until they have you judge concerning that which is disputed among them, and then find in themselves no discomfort with that which you have decided, and submit completely.

src: In Deiner Hand ist das Gute; wahrlich, Du hast Macht über alle Dinge.
ref: All goodness is Yours (entirely). Indeed You have the power over all things.
draft: In your hand is the good; truly, you have power over all things.
hil: The good lies within your hands; indeed, you have power over all things.
compare: The good lies within your hands; indeed, you have power over all things.

src: ALLAH möge euch vergeben.
ref: God will forgive you.
draft: May Allah forgive you
hil: May Allah forgive you.
compare: May Allah forgive you

src: Und auswirft, was in ihr ist, und somit ganz leer wird
ref: And throws out whatever it contains and is empty,
draft: And throws out what is in it, and thus becomes completely empty.
hil: And throws out what is inside it, and thus becomes completely empty.
compare: And throws out what is in it, and thus becomes completely empty.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wann wird dieses Versprechen (verwirklicht werden), wenn ihr wahrhaftig seid?"
ref: They say: "When is this promise going to come, if what you say is true?"
draft: And they say: "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"
hil: And they say, 'When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?'
compare: And they say: "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"

src: Vielmehr wissen die meisten von ihnen nicht.
ref: Nay, most of them know not.
draft: Most of them, in fact, do not know.
hil: Most of them, however, do not know.
compare: Most of them, however, do not know.

src: Die Vergeltung für diejenigen unter euch, die dies tun, ist nichts als Schande im diesseitigen Leben, und am Tag der Auferstehung werden sie der härtesten Pein zugeführt werden. Und Gott läßt nicht unbeachtet, was ihr tut.
ref: There is no other award for them who so act but disgrace in the world, and on the Day of Judgement the severest of punishment; for God is not heedless of all that you do.
draft: The retribution for those among you who do this is nothing but shame in this worldly life, and on the Day of Resurrection, they will be subjected to the most severe punishment. And God does not leave unnoticed what you are doing.
hil: The retribution for those among you who do this is nothing but shame in this worldly life, and on the Day of Resurrection, they will be subjected to the most severe punishment. And God does not leave unnoticed what you are doing.
compare: The retribution for those among you who do this is nothing but shame in this worldly life, and on the Day of Resurrection, they will be subjected to the most severe punishment. And God does not leave unnoticed what you are doing.

src: Und wenn sie um Hilfe rufen, wird Ihrem Hilferuf entsprochen mit Wasser wie das Geschmolzene, das die Gesichter schmort.
ref: If they ask for water they will be helped to liquid like molten brass that would scald their mouths.
draft: And when they call for help, your cry for help will be answered with water like the melted one that singes faces.
hil: And when they call for help, their cry for help will be answered with water like melted one that singes faces.
compare: And when they call for help, their cry for help will be answered with water like melted one that singes faces.

src: Ihr Menschen! Bereits ist zu euch doch ein Gesandter mit der Wahrheit von eurem HERRN gekommen, so verinnerlicht den Iman, dies ist besser für euch.
ref: O men, the Messenger has now come to you with the truth from your Lord; so believe; better is it for you.
draft: "Your people! Indeed, a messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so internalize the faith, this is better for you."
hil: O people who believe! A messenger has already come to you with the truth from your Lord. Firmly establish the commands of Allah. Internalize the faith, this is better for you.
compare: "Your people! Indeed, a messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so internalize the faith, this is better for you."

src: Uns beeilen, ihnen gute Dinge (zu gewähren)? Aber nein! Sie merken nicht.
ref: We provide them with the means of competing with each other in virtuous deeds, but they do not realize this.
draft: We hurry to grant them good things? But no! They don't notice.
hil: Hurry to grant them good things? But no! They don't realize.
compare: Hurry to grant them good things? But no! They don't realize.

src: Nein, sondern wir glauben, daß ihr Lügner seid!"
ref: In fact, we think you are a liar."
draft: "No, but we believe that you are liars!"
hil: No, but we believe that you are liars!
compare: "No, but we believe that you are liars!"

src: Dient eurem HERRN, Der euch erschuf und diejenigen vor euch, damit ihr Taqwa gemäß handelt.
ref: Worship your Lord, Who has created you and those before you, in the hope of attaining piety.
draft: Serve your Lord Who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous.
hil: Serve your Lord Who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous.
compare: Serve your Lord Who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous.

src: Und stifteten darin viel Unheil.
ref: And multiplied corruption.
draft: And caused much mischief therein.
hil: And caused much mischief therein.
compare: And caused much mischief therein.

src: Betreiben sie etwa Schirk mit dem, was Nichts schafft, während sie alle doch erschaffen werden?!
ref: Do they associate those with Him who cannot create a thing, and are themselves created,
draft: Do they operate Schirk with what creates nothing while they will all be created?!
hil: Do they engage in shirk with what creates nothing while they themselves will be created?
compare: Do they engage in shirk with what creates nothing while they themselves will be created?

src: Da ergriff sie Gott wegen ihrer Sünden.
ref: But Allah seized them with punishment for their sins.
draft: Then God seized her because of her sins.
hil: God seized her for her sins.
compare: Then God seized her because of her sins.

src: Dies sind Allahs Grenzen, so übertretet sie nicht! Wer aber Allahs Grenzen übertritt, diejenigen sind die Ungerechten.
ref: Do not exceed the limits of God, for those who exceed the bounds set by God are transgressors.
draft: These are the limits of Allah, so do not cross them! But whoever transgresses the limits of Allah, then those are the wrongdoers.
hil: These are Allah's limits, so do not exceed them! But those who exceed Allah's limits are the wrongdoers.
compare: These are Allah's limits, so do not exceed them! But those who exceed Allah's limits are the wrongdoers.

src: Euch wird euer Lohn am Tag der Auferstehung voll erstattet.
ref: And only on the Day of Resurrection shall you be paid your wages in full.
draft: You will be fully reimbursed your wage on the Day of Resurrection.
hil: On the Day of Resurrection, your wage will be fully reimbursed to you.
compare: You will be fully reimbursed your wage on the Day of Resurrection.

src: Doch wenn ihr Kufr betreibt, so ist Meine Peinigung gewiß qualvoll."
ref: My punishment is dire.
draft: But if you commit infidelity, surely My punishment will be painful.
hil: But if you commit infidelity, My punishment will surely be painful.
compare: But if you commit infidelity, My punishment will surely be painful.

src: Und für euch gibt es anstelle von ALLAH weder Wali, noch Beistehenden.
ref: And you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.
draft: And for you there is neither a guardian nor a supporter instead of Allah.
hil: For you, there is no guardian or supporter instead of Allah.
compare: For you, there is no guardian or supporter instead of Allah.

src: Und für diejenigen, welche die gottmißfälligen Taten intrigieren, ist eine harte Peinigung bestimmt.
ref: To Him ascend (all) the goodly words, and the righteous deeds exalt it (the goodly words i.e. the goodly words are not accepted by Allah unless and until they are followed by good deeds), but those who plot evils, theirs will be severe torment.
draft: And for those who plot the displeasing deeds, a harsh punishment is determined.
hil: And for those who plot the displeasing deeds, a severe punishment is determined.
compare: And for those who plot the displeasing deeds, a harsh punishment is determined.

src: Doch solltet ihr euch abwenden, so fürchte ich doch für euch die Peinigung eines langen Tages.
ref: But if you turn away, I fear the punishment of a terrible Day for you.
draft: But if you turn away, I fear for you the punishment of a long day.
hil: But if you turn away, then I fear for you the punishment of a long day.
compare: But if you turn away, then I fear for you the punishment of a long day.

src: Es sind aber nur die Ungläubigen, die Unsere Zeichen leugnen.
ref: Only those who are infidels will deny it.
draft: But it is only the unbelievers who deny Our signs.
hil: But only the unbelievers who deny Our messages will be punished for their disobedience.
compare: But it is only the unbelievers who deny Our signs.

src: Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER! ER ist ALLAH, Der Einzige, Der Allbezwingende.
ref: Exalted is He; He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
draft: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is ALLAH, the One, the Almighty.
hil: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is God; there is no god but He, the One, the Almighty, the King, the Holy, the Preserver, Protector, Guardian, the Strong, the Powerful, Omnipotent.
compare: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is ALLAH, the One, the Almighty.

src: Also gräme dich nicht wegen der fisq-betreibenden Leute!"
ref: So do not grieve for these, the wicked people."
draft: Do not worry about the people who are disturbing you with fisq!
hil: So do not worry about the people who carry out fisq!
compare: So do not worry about the people who carry out fisq!

src: Seine Mutter war schwanger mit ihm in Angestrengtheit und brachte ihn zur Welt in Angestrengtheit. Und (die Zeit) der Schwangerschaft mit ihm und sein Entwöhnen ist dreißig Monate.
ref: His mother beareth him with reluctance, and bringeth him forth with reluctance, and the bearing of him and the weaning of him is thirty months, till, when he attaineth full strength and reacheth forty years, he saith: My Lord!
draft: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And the period of pregnancy and weaning him is thirty months.
hil: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And the period of pregnancy and weaning him is thirty months.
compare: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And the period of pregnancy and weaning him is thirty months.

src: Aber dir gehört es, zu befehlen.
ref: It is for you to decide.
draft: But it's up to you to command.
hil: But it is for you to command.
compare: But it is for you to command.

src: Sie sind doch im Zweifel über die Begegnung mit ihrem HERRN.
ref: They are in doubt concerning the Meeting with their Lord? (i.e. Resurrection after their deaths, and their return to their Lord).
draft: You are in doubt about the encounter with your LORD.
hil: They are indeed in doubt about the encounter with their lord.
compare: You are in doubt about the encounter with your LORD.

src: Und der Gesandte sagt: "O mein Herr, mein Volk mied diesen Qur'an unter Mißachtung."
ref: The prophet will say: "O my Lord, my people had fettered the Qur'an."
draft: "And the messenger says, 'O my Lord, my people have disregarded this Qur'an.'"
hil: And the messenger said, 'O my Lord, I conveyed to my people the message of my Lord and warned them; but they disregarded this Qur'an.'
compare: And the messenger said, 'O my Lord, I conveyed to my people the message of my Lord and warned them; but they disregarded this Qur'an.'

src: So haben Wir ihn als klare Zeichen hinabgesandt, und (es ist so,) daß Allah rechtleitet, wen Er will.
ref: That is why We have sent down these clear revelations, for God gives guidance whomsoever He please.
draft: So We sent it down as clear signs, and (it is so) that Allah guides whom He wills.
hil: "Thus have We revealed it as clear signs, and verily Allah guides whom He wills".
compare: So We sent it down as clear signs, and (it is so) that Allah guides whom He wills.

src: So wendet euch nicht als Schuldige ab."
ref: So do not turn away from Him as sinners."
draft: "So do not turn away as guilty."
hil: "So do not turn away as guilty."
compare: "So do not turn away as guilty."

src: Und dein HERR genügt als Wakil."
ref: Thy Lord suffices as a guardian.
draft: "And your Lord is sufficient as a guardian."
hil: O people! Your Lord is the Perfect (Not needing anything), the Merciful; your Lord is sufficient as a guardian.
compare: "And your Lord is sufficient as a guardian."

src: Dem, der Gutes vollbringt, wird Besseres als das zuteil sein, und sie werden vor dem Schrecken an jenem Tag sicher sein.
ref: Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done), and be safe that day from terror.
draft: To the one who does good, better things than that will happen, and they will be secure from terror on that day.
hil: To the one who does good, better things than that will be granted, and they will be safe from terror on that day.
compare: To the one who does good, better things than that will be granted, and they will be safe from terror on that day.

src: Und hätten sie doch das getan, womit sie ermahnt werden, wäre es besser für sie und würde sie noch mehr (im Iman) bestärken.
ref: And did they do that which they are exhorted to do, it would be for them better and more strengthening.
draft: And if they had done what they were admonished, it would be better for them and would strengthen them even more (in faith).
hil: If they had done what they were admonished, it would have been better for them and it would have further strengthened their faith.
compare: If they had done what they were admonished, it would have been better for them and it would have further strengthened their faith.
