src: um undankbar zu sein für das, was Wir ihnen gegeben haben, und um zu genießen; sie werden (es noch) erfahren.
ref: And deny what We had given them, in order to go on enjoying themselves. They will come to know soon.
draft: To be ungrateful for what We have given them, and to enjoy; they will (still) find out.
hil: And to be ungrateful for what We have given them and to continue enjoying it; they will soon find out.
compare: And to be ungrateful for what We have given them and to continue enjoying it; they will soon find out.

src: (Aber) gewiß, Meine List ist fest.
ref: Verily, My Plan is strong.
draft: (But) certainly, my cunning is firm.
hil: (But) certainly, My trickery is firm.
compare: (But) certainly, my cunning is firm.

src: Ihnen genügt Dschahannam, sie werden darin hineingeworfen.
ref: Hell is enough for them. They will roast in it.
draft: They are satisfied with Jahannam, they will be thrown into it.
hil: They are content with Jahannam and will be thrown into it.
compare: They are content with Jahannam and will be thrown into it.

src: Das ist Allah, euer Herr. Segensreich ist darum Allah, der Herr der Welten.
ref: That then is God, your Lord, so blessed be God, the Lord of all Being.
draft: This is Allah, your Lord. Therefore, Allah is blessed, the Lord of the Worlds.
hil: That is Allah, your Lord. Therefore, Allah is blessed, the Lord of the Worlds.
compare: This is Allah, your Lord. Therefore, Allah is blessed, the Lord of the Worlds.

src: Allah wird ganz gewiß diejenigen kennen, die die Wahrheit sprechen, und Er wird ganz gewiß die Lügner kennen.
ref: So Allah will surely know those who are true and He will surely know the liars.
draft: Allah will surely know those who speak the truth, and He will surely know the liars.
hil: Allah will surely know those who speak the truth, and He will surely know the liars.
compare: Allah will surely know those who speak the truth, and He will surely know the liars.

src: (Ihre Abneigung gegen diese Einteilung von Al-anfal ist) genauso (wie damals), als dein HERR dich aus deiner Wohnstätte mit der Wahrheit herausführen ließ, während eine Gruppe von den Mumin gewiß dem doch abgeneigt war.
ref: As your Lord sent you from your home (to fight) for the true cause, a section of the faithful were averse,
draft: (Your aversion to this division of Al-anfal is) just like (back then), when your LORD led you out of your home with the truth, while a group of the believers were certainly averse to it.
hil: O believers! Your aversion to this allocation of the spoils of war is like that (of the believers) when your Lord caused you to leave your home with the truth, while a group of the believers certainly disliked it.
compare: (Your aversion to this division of Al-anfal is) just like (back then), when your LORD led you out of your home with the truth, while a group of the believers were certainly averse to it.

src: Die Kaffara dafür ist die Speisung von zehn Bedürftigen in jenem Maß, wie ihr die Eurigen im Durchschnitt speist, oder Ihre Bekleidung oder die Befreiung eines Unfreien.
ref: The atonement for it is by feeding ten needy people from the average of what you feed your families, or by clothing them, or by freeing a slave.
draft: "The expiation for that is the feeding of ten needy people with the average of what you feed your own family, or the clothing of them, or the freeing of a slave."
hil: The expiation for it is feeding ten needy people with the average of what you feed your own family, or their clothing or the freeing of a slave.
compare: "The expiation for that is the feeding of ten needy people with the average of what you feed your own family, or the clothing of them, or the freeing of a slave."

src: Gewiß, sie waren jungeMänner, die den Iman an ihren HERRN verinnerlichten, undWIR ließen sie noch mehr Rechtleitung gewinnen.
ref: They were a few young men who believed in their Lord; so We gave them greater guidance.
draft: Certainly, they were young men who internalized faith in their Lord, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.
hil: Indeed, they were young men who internalized the faith in their Lord, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.
compare: Certainly, they were young men who internalized faith in their Lord, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.

src: Aber der Lohn des Jenseits ist wahrlich besser für diejenigen, die glauben und gottesfürchtig sind.
ref: And certainly the recompense of the life to come is better for those who believe and follow the right path.
draft: But the reward of the Hereafter is truly better for those who believe and are pious.
hil: But the reward of the Hereafter is truly better for those who believe and are pious.
compare: But the reward of the Hereafter is truly better for those who believe and are pious.

src: ER trifft damit von Seinen Dienern, wen ER will.
ref: He makes it reach whomever He wills of His servants.
draft: He thus meets whom He wills of His servants.
hil: He meets whom He wills of His servants. And He is the All-forgiving, the All-compassionate.
compare: He thus meets whom He wills of His servants.

src: Und Wir legten zwischen ihnen und den Städten, die Wir gesegnet haben, sichtbare Städte an.
ref: We placed other prominent towns between them, the towns that We had blessed and had set well-measured stages between them.
draft: And We have placed visible cities between them and the cities that We have blessed.
hil: We have placed visible cities between them and the cities that We have blessed.
compare: And We have placed visible cities between them and the cities that We have blessed.

src: Wahrlich, Allah ist über alle Dinge Allwissend.
ref: Verily God has knowledge of everything.
draft: Truly, Allah is All-Knowing about all things.
hil: Truly, Allah is All-Knowing about everything.
compare: Truly, Allah is All-Knowing about everything.

src: Ha Mim.
ref: HA MIM.
draft: Alif Lam Mim
hil: Alif Lam Mim.
compare: Alif Lam Mim

src: Die Engel und Gabriel steigen zu Ihm auf in einem Tage, dessen Ausmaß fünfzigtausend Jahre beträgt.
ref: To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend, whose length is fifty thousand years.
draft: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day, the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
hil: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day, the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
compare: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day, the extent of which is fifty thousand years.

src: Seine Leute kamen eilig zu ihm getrieben. Zuvor pflegten sie böse Taten zu begehen.
ref: And his people came to him, running towards him; and erstwhile they had been doing evil deeds.
draft: His people came rushing to him. Previously, they used to commit evil deeds.
hil: "His people came rushing to him driven. Previously, they used to commit evil deeds."
compare: His people came rushing to him. Previously, they used to commit evil deeds.

src: Und manche von ihnen bezichtigen dich (ungerechter Verteilung) der Sadaqa. Doch würde ihnen davon etwas gegeben, wären sie zufrieden. Aber wenn ihnen davon nichts gegeben wird, so sind sie wütend.
ref: And among them is one who slanders you regarding the distribution of charity; so if they receive some of it they would be happy – and if not, thereupon they get displeased!
draft: And some of them accuse you of (unfair distribution) of Sadaqa. But if something is given to them, they are satisfied. But if nothing is given to them, then they are angry.
hil: "And some of them accuse you of (unfair distribution) of Sadaqa. But if something is given to them, they are satisfied. But if they are not given anything, they become angry."
compare: "And some of them accuse you of (unfair distribution) of Sadaqa. But if something is given to them, they are satisfied. But if they are not given anything, they become angry."

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Musa für seine Leute um Wasser bat, dann sagten WIR: "Schlage mit deinem Stock an den Felsen!" Dann entsprangen daraus zwölf Quellen, bereits kennt jede Gruppe ihre Trinkstelle. Esst und trinkt von ALLAHs Rizq und übertreibt nicht auf Erden als Verderben-Anrichtende!
ref: And when Moosa asked for water for his people, We said, “Strike this rock with your staff”; thereupon twelve springs gushed forth from it; each group recognised its drinking-place; “Eat and drink from what Allah has provided, and do not roam about the earth making turmoil in it.”
draft: And (remember) when Musa asked for water for his people, then WE said, "Strike the rock with your staff!" Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, so that each group knew their drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's rizq (provision) and do not act corruptly on the earth as mischief-makers.
hil: And (remember) when Musa asked for water for his people, then WE said: "Strike the rock with your staff!" Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, so that each group knew its drinking place. Eat and drink, enjoy God's gifts, and spread no discord in the land.
compare: And (remember) when Musa asked for water for his people, then WE said, "Strike the rock with your staff!" Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, so that each group knew their drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's rizq (provision) and do not act corruptly on the earth as mischief-makers.

src: Und esst und trinkt, bis für euch der weiße Faden (der Dämmerung) vom schwarzen Faden (der Nacht) unterscheidbar wird, dann vollendet das Siyam bis zur Nacht! Und werdet nicht intim mit ihnen, während ihr I'tikaf in den Moscheen vollzieht.
ref: And eat and drink, until the white thread shows clearly to you from the black thread at the dawn; then complete the Fast unto the night, and do not lie with them while you cleave to the mosques.
draft: "And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread of night. Then complete the Siyam (fast) until the night (fall). And do not have intimacy with them while you are in I'tikaf (spiritual retreat) in the mosques."
hil: and eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread of night. then complete the Siyam (fast) until the night (fall)! and do not have intimacy with them while you are in I'tikaf (spiritual retreat) in the mosques.
compare: "And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread of night. Then complete the Siyam (fast) until the night (fall). And do not have intimacy with them while you are in I'tikaf (spiritual retreat) in the mosques."

src: So verinnerlicht den Iman an ALLAH und an Seine Gesandten.
ref: So have faith in Allah and His apostles, and do not say, ‘[God is] a trinity.’
draft: So internalize the faith in Allah and His messengers.
hil: Therefore, internalize the faith in Allah and His messengers.
compare: Therefore, internalize the faith in Allah and His messengers.

src: Also esset von dem, was sie für euch fangen, und sprecht Allahs Namen darüber aus.
ref: So eat from what they catch for you, and pronounce God’s name over it.
draft: Also eat from what they catch for you, and mention Allah's name over it.
hil: Eat, therefore, of those beasts and birds of prey which you have trained as hounds, training and teaching them to catch in the manner as directed to you by Allah; so eat of what they catch for you, but pronounce the Name of Allah over it and fear Allah. Verily, Allah is swift in reckoning.
compare: Also eat from what they catch for you, and mention Allah's name over it.

src: Und keine lasttragende (Seele) nimmt die Last einer anderen auf sich.
ref: If you are grateful He will be pleased with you.
draft: And no burden-bearing (soul) takes on the burden of another.
hil: No soul bears the burden of another.
compare: No soul bears the burden of another.

src: Und sie eilen dann zum Weg um die Wette, aber wie könnten sie da sehen?
ref: Then they would have raced along to cross the Bridge but how could they have seen (their way)?
draft: And then they hurry to the path to compete, but how could they see there?
hil: And they rush then to the path to compete, but how could they see there?
compare: And then they hurry to the path to compete, but how could they see there?

src: Gewiß, ER ist Seinen Dienern gegenüber allkundig, allsehend.
ref: He is all-aware and all-seeing.
draft: Certainly, HE is all-knowing, all-seeing towards His servants.
hil: Und gewiss, Er ist allwissend und allsehend gegenüber Seinen Dienern.
compare: Certainly, HE is all-knowing, all-seeing towards His servants.

src: Sie geben einander zum Trug prunkende Rede ein und hätte es dein Herr gewollt, hätten sie es nicht getan; so überlaß sie sich selbst mit dem, was sie erdichten.
ref: But if your Lord had willed they would not have done so. Pay no attention to them and to what they fabricate.
draft: They give each other deceivingly pompous speeches, and if your lord had wanted it, they would not have done it; so let them be left to themselves with what they invent.
hil: They give each other deceivingly pompous speeches, and if their Lord had willed it, they would not have done so; so leave them alone to what they invent.
compare: They give each other deceivingly pompous speeches, and if their Lord had willed it, they would not have done so; so leave them alone to what they invent.

src: Das Gebäude, das sie errichtet haben, wird nicht aufhören, Zweifel in ihren Herzen zu errregen, bis ihre Herzen in Stücke gerissen sind. Und Allah ist Allwissend, Allweise.
ref: The edifice they have built will always fill their minds with perturbation (which will not cease) till their hearts are rent to pieces, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.
draft: The building they have erected will not cease to arouse doubt in their hearts until their hearts are torn into pieces. And Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
hil: The building they have erected will not stop arousing doubts in their hearts until their hearts are torn into pieces. And Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
compare: The building they have erected will not cease to arouse doubt in their hearts until their hearts are torn into pieces. And Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.

src: Und gehöre nicht zu den Unachtsamen!
ref: Be not thou among the heedless.
draft: And do not be among the careless!
hil: And do not be among the careless!
compare: And do not be among the careless!

src: Das ist Allahs Anordnung, die Er zu euch (als Offenbarung) herabgesandt hat.
ref: This is the commandment of God that is sent down to you.
draft: This is Allah's order that He has sent down to you (as a revelation).
hil: That is Allah's decree that He has revealed to you (as a revelation).
compare: This is Allah's order that He has sent down to you (as a revelation).

src: Dann ist es an jenem Tag ein schwerer Tag,
ref: It will be a day of distress,
draft: Then it is a heavy day on that day.
hil: Then it will be a heavy day on that day when no soul shall have power (to do) aught for (another) soul, and the commandment on that day will be done by God alone.
compare: Then it will be a heavy day on that day when no soul shall have power (to do) aught for (another) soul, and the commandment on that day will be done by God alone.

src: So wartet ab! Ich gehöre mit euch zu den Abwartenden."
ref: So wait (for what is to come), I am waiting with you."
draft: So wait! I belong with you to those who are waiting.
hil: Just wait; I am waiting with the ones who are waiting.
compare: So wait! I belong with you to those who are waiting.

src: Um damit Korn und Pflanzen hervorzubringen
ref: That We may produce from it grain and vegetation,
draft: To produce grain and plants with it.
hil: To produce grain and plants with it.
compare: To produce grain and plants with it.

src: Gewiß, das Gebet hält davon ab, das Schändliche und das Verwerfliche (zu tun). Und das Gedenken Allahs ist wahrlich größer.
ref: Surely prayer keeps you away from the obscene and detestable, but the remembrance of God is greater far; and God knows what you do.
draft: Certainly, prayer prevents (one) from doing shameful and reprehensible (acts). And the remembrance of Allah is indeed greater.
hil: Indeed, prayer prevents one from commanding the shameful and reprehensible. And the remembrance of Allah is truly greater.
compare: Certainly, prayer prevents (one) from doing shameful and reprehensible (acts). And the remembrance of Allah is indeed greater.

src: O die ihr glaubt, nehmt nicht die Ungläubigen anstatt der Gläubigen zu Schutzherren!
ref: O believers, do not hold unbelievers as friends in preference to the faithful.
draft: O you who believe, do not take the unbelievers as guardians instead of the believers!
hil: Believers! Do not take the unbelievers for your allies instead of the believers.
compare: Believers! Do not take the unbelievers for your allies instead of the believers.

src: Sind beide im Gleichnis etwa gleich?!
ref: Can they be equal?
draft: Are both about equal in the analogy?!
hil: Are they equal in comparison?
compare: Are they equal in comparison?

src: Er aber gab (dir) Macht über sie; und Allah ist Allwissend, Allweise.
ref: So He gave you mastery over them, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.
draft: He gave you power over them; and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
hil: But he gave you power over them, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
compare: He gave you power over them; and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

src: Es ist wie mit den Leuten des Pharao und denen, die vor ihnen lebten: Sie erklärten die Zeichen ihres Herrn für Lüge, so ließen Wir sie für ihre Sünden verderben, und Wir ließen die Leute des Pharao ertrinken.
ref: Their case is like that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them: they rejected the signs of their Lord as false and so We destroyed them for their sins, and caused the people of Pharaoh to drown.
draft: It's like with the people of the pharaoh and those who lived before them: they denied the signs of their Lord, and so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of the pharaoh.
hil: It is like those who were before the people of Pharaoh; they denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh.
compare: It is like those who were before the people of Pharaoh; they denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh.

src: Der alles gut gemacht hat, was Er erschuf. Und Er begann die Schöpfung des Menschen aus Ton.
ref: Who made all things He created excellent; and first fashioned man from clay,
draft: He who made everything well that He created. And He began the creation of man from clay.
hil: "He who created everything well that He made. And He began the creation of man from clay."
compare: He who made everything well that He created. And He began the creation of man from clay.

src: Keineswegs haben sie ALLAH verherrlicht, wie es Ihm gebührt, als sie sagten: "ALLAH hat keinem Menschen irgend etwas hinabgesandt." Sag: "Wer hat denn die Schrift hinabgesandt, mit der Musa als Licht und als Rechtleitung für die Menschen kam?
ref: And they (the Jews) did not realise (or appreciate) the importance of Allah as was required when they said, “Allah has not sent down anything upon any human being”; say, “Who has sent down the Book which Moosa brought, a light and guidance for mankind, which you have divided into different papers, some which you show and hide most of them?
draft: By no means did they glorify Allah as He should have been glorified when they said, "Allah has not revealed anything to anyone." Say, "Who then revealed the scripture that Moses brought as a light and guidance for the people?"
hil: Say, "Who revealed the scripture that was sent down with Moses as a light and guidance for the people?" They did not glorify Allah as He deserves when they said, "Allah has not sent down anything to anyone."
compare: By no means did they glorify Allah as He should have been glorified when they said, "Allah has not revealed anything to anyone." Say, "Who then revealed the scripture that Moses brought as a light and guidance for the people?"

src: Dann bringe uns, was du uns androhst, solltest du von den Wahrhaftigen sein."
ref: Then bring upon us what you predict for us, if you are a man of truth."
draft: "Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are truly among the truthful."
hil: Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are among the truthful.
compare: "Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are truly among the truthful."

src: Die Zahl der Monate bei Gott ist zwölf Monate, im Buch Gottes festgestellt am Tag, da Er die Himmel und die Erde erschaffen hat. Vier davon sind heilig. Das ist die richtige Religion. So tut euch selbst in ihnen kein Unrecht. Und kämpft gegen die Polytheisten allesamt, wie sie gegen euch allesamt kämpfen. Und wißt, Gott ist mit den Gottesfürchtigen.
ref: Indeed the number of months before Allah is twelve – in the Book of Allah – since the day He created the heavens and the earth, of which four are sacred; this the straight religion; so do not wrong yourselves in those months; and constantly fight against the polytheists as they constantly fight against you; and know well that Allah is with the pious.
draft: The number of months with God is twelve months, in the Book of God established on the day when He created the heavens and the earth. Four of them are sacred. That is the right religion. So do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight against the polytheists altogether as they fight against you altogether. And know that God is with the righteous.
hil: Lo! the number of the months with Allah is twelve months by Allah's ordinance on the day that He created the heavens and the earth. Of them four are sacred: that is the right religion. So wrong not yourselves in them. And fight against the idolaters all together as they fight against you all together. And know that Allah is with the cautious.
compare: The number of months with God is twelve months, in the Book of God established on the day when He created the heavens and the earth. Four of them are sacred. That is the right religion. So do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight against the polytheists altogether as they fight against you altogether. And know that God is with the righteous.

src: Doch ihr seid keineswegs dessen Aufbewahrer.
ref: It is not ye who are the holders of the store thereof.
draft: But you are by no means its keepers.
hil: "But you are by no means its keepers."
compare: But you are by no means its keepers.

src: Darin liegen Zeichen für die Leute, die Verstand haben.
ref: Verily there are signs in this for men of understanding.
draft: Therein lie signs for people who have understanding.
hil: Therein lie signs for those who have understanding.
compare: Therein lie signs for those who have understanding.

src: Und Allah ist wahrlich All verzeihend und Allvergebend.
ref: But God is forbearing and forgiving.
draft: And Allah is truly All-forgiving and All-merciful.
hil: And God is indeed All-Forgiving and Merciful.
compare: And Allah is truly All-forgiving and All-merciful.

src: Und niemand kann Uns voraus sein.
ref: And we are not to be outrun.
draft: And no one can be ahead of Us.
hil: And no one can be ahead of Us.
compare: And no one can be ahead of Us.

src: Und ALLAH hat euch erschaffen, dann läßt ER euch sterben. Und manch einer von euch wird in das faselnde Alter zurückgesetzt, damit er nichts mehr weiß, nachdem er über Wissen verfügte.
ref: It is God who creates you, then makes you die; and some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they had known before.
draft: And Allah created you, then He lets you die. And some of you are reset to babbling age, so that they no longer know anything, even though they had knowledge.
hil: And God creates you, then lets you die. And some of you are reset to babbling age, so that they no longer know anything, even though they had knowledge.
compare: And Allah created you, then He lets you die. And some of you are reset to babbling age, so that they no longer know anything, even though they had knowledge.

src: Und erfüllt die (eingegangene) Verpflichtung. Gewiß, nach der (Erfüllung der) Verpflichtung wird gefragt werden.
ref: And fulfil the covenant; surely the covenant shall be questioned of.
draft: And fulfill the (incurred) obligation. Of course, there will be a question asked after the (fulfillment of the) obligation.
hil: And fulfill the (incurred) obligation. Certainly, after fulfilling the obligation, there will be a question asked.
compare: And fulfill the (incurred) obligation. Of course, there will be a question asked after the (fulfillment of the) obligation.

src: Und nehmt Zeugen, wenn ihr miteinander Handel treibt. Und weder dem Schreiber noch dem Zeugen soll Schaden zugefügt werden.
ref: Have witnesses to the deal, (and make sure) that the scribe or the witness is not harmed.
draft: And take witnesses when you transact with one another. And neither the writer nor the witness shall be harmed.
hil: And take witnesses when you are trading with one another. And neither harm shall be done to the writer nor the witness.
compare: And take witnesses when you transact with one another. And neither the writer nor the witness shall be harmed.

src: Dies sind wahrlich die Worte eines edlen Gesandten,
ref: That this is indeed the word of an honoured Messenger,
draft: This is truly the words of a noble envoy.
hil: Truly, these are the words of a noble envoy.
compare: Truly, these are the words of a noble envoy.

src: Haben sie denn nicht auf das geschaut, was vom Himmel und von der Erde vor ihnen und was hinter ihnen ist?
ref: Do they not see what is before them and what is behind them of the heavens and the earth?
draft: Have they not looked at what is above them in the sky and on the earth and what is before them and what is behind them?
hil: Behold they not that which is before them and that which is behind them of the heaven and the earth?
compare: Behold they not that which is before them and that which is behind them of the heaven and the earth?

src: Als die Munafiq zu dir kamen, sagten sie: "Wir bezeugen, daß du doch ALLAHs Gesandter bist." Und ALLAH weiß, daß du doch Sein Gesandter bist. Und ALLAH bezeugt: "Gewiß, die Munafiq sind doch Lügner."
ref: When the hypocrites come in your presence (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) they say, “We testify that you surely are Allah’s Noble Messenger”; and Allah knows that you indeed are His Noble Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are indeed liars.
draft: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We testify that you are indeed Allah's Messenger." And Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, but Allah testifies that the hypocrites are indeed liars.
hil: As the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We testify that you are indeed Allah's Messenger." And Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, but Allah testifies that the hypocrites are indeed liars.
compare: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We testify that you are indeed Allah's Messenger." And Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, but Allah testifies that the hypocrites are indeed liars.

src: Bestimme für mich eine Aya!"
ref: Make a sign for me."
draft: "Select a verse for me!"
hil: He said, "Lord, select a verse for me!" HE said, "Your token shall be that you will not speak to people for three full nights, although in proper health."
compare: "Select a verse for me!"

src: Darin werden sie auf immer ewig weilen; und sie werden weder Freund noch Helfer finden.
ref: They will live in it for ever, and will find no saviour or helper.
draft: "They will dwell there forever and ever, and they will find neither friend nor helper."
hil: Therein they shall abide forever, and they will find neither friend nor helper.
compare: "They will dwell there forever and ever, and they will find neither friend nor helper."

src: Und die spenden, was sie spenden, während ihre Herzen sich (davor) ängstigen, daß sie zu ihrem Herrn zurückkehren werden,
ref: Who give whatsoever they give (in His way), and their hearts tremble with fear that they have to go back to their Lord,
draft: And they donate whatever they donate while their hearts tremble with the fear that they will return to their Lord.
hil: And they donate whatever they donate while their hearts tremble with the fear that they will return to their Lord.
compare: And they donate whatever they donate while their hearts tremble with the fear that they will return to their Lord.

src: Und sie haben Allah andere als Seinesgleichen zur Seite gestellt, um (die Menschen) von Seinem Weg abirren zu lassen.
ref: They have appointed equals of God to mislead people from His path. Tell them: "Enjoy yourselves (so long as you may).
draft: And they have set up partners to Allah, to lead (people) astray from His path.
hil: And they have set up partners to Allah, to mislead [people] from His way.
compare: And they have set up partners to Allah, to lead (people) astray from His path.

src: Fürwahr, ungläubig sind diejenigen, die sagen: "Gewiß, Allah ist al-Masih, der Sohn Maryams", wo doch al-Masih (selbst) gesagt hat: "O Kinder Isra'ils, dient Allah, meinem Herrn und eurem Herrn!"
ref: They are surely infidels who say: "God is the Christ, son of Mary." But the Christ had only said: "O children of Israel, worship God who is my Lord and your Lord."
draft: Truly, those who say, "Indeed Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary" are unbelievers. Messiah has said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord, and your Lord."
hil: Verily, those who say, "Indeed, Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary" are unbelievers. While the Messiah has said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord, and your Lord!"
compare: Verily, those who say, "Indeed, Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary" are unbelievers. While the Messiah has said, "O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord, and your Lord!"

src: Und wenn WIR wollten, hätten WIR sie mit ihresgleichen eingetauscht.
ref: And whenever We list, We can replace them with others like Unto them.
draft: And if we wanted to, we could have exchanged them with their own kind.
hil: And if WE willed, WE could have exchanged them with their like.
compare: And if we wanted to, we could have exchanged them with their own kind.

src: Wir begreifen nicht viel von dem, was du sagst - außerdem gewiß sehen wir, daß du doch unter uns ein Schwacher bist.
ref: We do not understand much of what you say, and we see you a weak (man, it is said that he was a blind man) among us.
draft: We do not understand much of what you are saying - moreover, we certainly see that you are a weakling among us.
hil: We do not understand much of what you are saying - moreover, certainly we see that you are a weakling among us.
compare: We do not understand much of what you are saying - moreover, we certainly see that you are a weakling among us.

src: Könnt niemanden gegen Ihn verführen,
ref: Can mislead anyone away from Him,
draft: No one can tempt him.
hil: No one can tempt him.
compare: No one can tempt him.

src: Bestimmt ist für sie bei ihrem Herrn die Wohnstätte des Friedens. Er ist ihr Freund wegen dessen, was sie zu tun pflegten.
ref: For them is the abode of peace with their Lord and He is their Master – the result of their deeds.
draft: Surely, with their Lord is the home of peace, and He is their friend for what they used to do.
hil: Surely, with their Lord is the abode of peace, and He is their friend because of what they used to do.
compare: Surely, with their Lord is the home of peace, and He is their friend for what they used to do.

src: Und wer dem Gesandten widerspricht - nachdem ihm die Rechtleitung deutlich wurde, und einem anderen als dem Weg der Mumin folgt, den werden WIR das verantworten lassen, wofür er verantwortlich war, und dann werden WIR ihn in Dschahannam hineinwerfen lassen. Und erbärmlich ist dieses Werden.
ref: And he who opposes the Prophet even after the way has become clear to him, and follows a path other than the way of believers, We shall lead him to what he has chosen for himself, and shall take him to Hell: How evil a journey's end.
draft: And whoever contradicts the messenger - after guidance has become clear to him, and follows a path other than that of the believers, We will leave him in what he has chosen and drive him into Hell, and what an evil destination.
hil: And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows a way other than that of the believers - We will call him to account for what he did, and We will cast him into Hellfire- an evil destination indeed.
compare: And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows a way other than that of the believers - We will call him to account for what he did, and We will cast him into Hellfire- an evil destination indeed.

src: Als dein Herr Mose rief: «Geh zum Volk, das Unrecht tut,
ref: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people,
draft: As your master Moses called: "Go to the people who are doing wrong,
hil: As soon as your Lord had called Moses, 'Go to the people who do wrong and
compare: As soon as your Lord had called Moses, 'Go to the people who do wrong and

src: Dennoch gibt es unter euch welche, die nur auf sie hören. Und Gott weiß über die Bescheid, die Unrecht tun.
ref: They have some spies among you, and Allah knows best the wrongdoers.
draft: Nevertheless, there are some among you who only listen to them. And God knows the ones who do wrong.
hil: Yet there are some among you who only listen to them. And God knows those who do wrong.
compare: Nevertheless, there are some among you who only listen to them. And God knows the ones who do wrong.

src: Und damit Staub aufwirbeln,
ref: Raising clouds of dust,
draft: And to raise dust,
hil: "And to raise dust,"
compare: "And to raise dust,"

src: Und nehmt zwei gerechte Leute von euch zu Zeugen, und erhaltet das Zeugnis Gottes aufrecht.
ref: And call in to witness two men of equity from among yourselves; and perform the witnessing to God Himself.
draft: And take two just persons from among yourselves as witnesses and establish the testimony for Allah.
hil: And let two just persons from among you witness [the contract]; and let them bear witness to the fact for Allah.
compare: And take two just persons from among yourselves as witnesses and establish the testimony for Allah.
